loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
MwanaJ. is married with 6 children between the ages of 1 and 17 years old. She has been a charcoal seller since 2007. Everyday she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

In the past, MwanaJ. took out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania (Kiva's Field Partner) to expand her business. MwanaJ. now requests a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Goib

texts.en:
Goib M. is 45 years old. He is married and has three children. Goib is a hard-working man who, while continuing to work another job, started his own business as a source of additional income and savings in case of unemployment. He knew many people who purchased cattle, and this motivated him to start his own business 20 years ago. With time, he has increased his sales and now he needs assistance investing in his business, which has been going well and which he would like to continue to grow. 

Goib is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni ($600 USD) to buy cattle; he will reinvest the capital to grow his business as he has been doing. He is offering to repay the loan in 12 months. With the profit from this loan, he wants to support his children with their education. His elder son is studying in a military college and his daughter is studying foreign languages at the University. He and his family thank you very much for the support that you offer them in continuing this business and helping them give their children a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Hamda

texts.en: A 49-year-old woman, Hamda lives with her husband and children in Jib Jenin in the Bekaa valley. Hamda began her small business by producing and selling homemade food supplies from her house to local residents. Following a growing demand of her products, she opened her own grocery store in 2004 and added a bigger array of products, such as spices and bottled food supplies. She requests a loan of $1,000 to buy supplies from which she would be able to produce her goods.

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: N. Jean

texts.fr: Né vers 1964 à Dangbo, sieur K. N. Jean est père de deux enfants Luc-Martin agé de 20 ans est etudiant, et José-Mario agé de 16ans en classe de 1èreD, il est mécanicien de formation et a lui-même son garage. Pour couvrir ses differentes charges liées  à sa petire famille il a crée ce petit commerce. vu la demande regulière de sa clientèle il a sollicité son prémier pret.
texts.en:
Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans. Born around 1964 in Dangbo, N. Jean Kodgo is the father of two children, Luc-Martin who is a 20 year-old student, and Jose-Mario, a 16 year-old in high school. He is a mechanic and has his own garage. To supplement his family’s small income, he has decided to apply for a loan in order to sell rechargeable phone cards.

Translated from French by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rechargeable cell phone cards

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Married with four children who are currently in school, Vida, 37, supports her husband in providing for the household through the sale of used clothing. She lives in Atebubu in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana, a farming community consisting largely of peasant farmers both young and old. 

The market for used clothing in Ghana is substantial because brand new clothes are too expensive for many people.  In this business for the past 22 years, Vida makes her sales by ‘hawking,’ which consists of going from one market center to another with her wares. She is now requesting a loan to buy more bales of used clothes to increase her inventory, and believes the loan will help her save for her children’s future and eventually rent a store to trade from. 

Vida belongs to the Holiness Trust Group, whose members agree to support and guarantee each other’s loans.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Zubaida Khanum Abdul Latif Group

texts.en:
"My name is Zubaida Khanum and I am a 57-year-old married lady. I have been a citizen of a city named Multan, Pakistan, for the last 25 years. I am married to a man whose name is A. L. and he is a factory worker. I have five kids: three sons and two daughters. My eldest son drives a donkey cart for loading different items (furniture, construction supplies). Another works in a vegetable market and packs the vegetables in sacks. The others are getting education from a school which is located near to the house. I make plastic shopping bags on orders. I complete the orders in two days to earn income. I use my income to pay off the school fees of my children. I am applying for a loan to buy plastic beans for making plastic bags."

She is the group leader of some more women in her locality. Bismillah baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Qubra baji and Parveen baji each want a loan to buy thread to resell. Zainab baji wants a loan to buy marble stone to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy plastic beans for making plastic shopping bags

loans.name: Mukisa Group

texts.en:
N. A. is a soft-spoken mother of 8 children. She is also a caretaker of three other family members. Of the 8 children, 4 are adults, and 2 have attained university level education. She has a food business which produces mainly Matoke, which is a local staple. The main challenge in her business is the fluctuating prices of the goods. At time of buying, prices can vary widely.

She earns about 70000 ugsh /week in profit. She's been in business for about 15 years and has been involved with her lending group for 11. The strength of her business, she says, is having great customer care. 

Her benefits from the loan include her ability to build her own house and send all her kids to school. She started borrowing 50,000 Ugsh 15 years ago. Now she has gone up to 900,000. This is her 36th loan. She is so grateful that the loans have enabled her to send her kids to school. 

Her vision is to have all her children attend University.

loans.use: Buying goods for her food shop

loans.name: Thi Nga's Group

texts.vi:
Nguyễn Thị Nga sinh năm 1948, ( Mã số: 010103040018). Hiện chị đang sống cùng vợ chồng người con trai lớn. Gia đình chị có 6 người. Con dâu đi chợ hoa quả, con trai chị làm nghề xe ôm, 3 cháu nội còn nhỏ . Chị chủ yếu ở nhà làm nông nghiệp, chăn nuôi. Chu kỳ vay vốn này, chị vay mức vốn: 4.142.000 VND để đầu tư chăn nuôi gà. Là người có uy tín, lại tháo vát, nhanh nhẹn nên chị được bầu làm nhóm trưởng nhóm vay gồm có:
 Chử Thị Hằng sinh năm 1982, ( Mã số: 010103040019) gia đình chị có 1 cửa hàng bán sơn. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình khoảng 4.500.000 VND. Chị tham gia vay mức vốn: 4.142.000 VND để kinh doanh sơn.
 Nguyễn Thị M. sinh năm 1967, ( Mã số: 010103040023 ). Gia đình chị chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp, chăn nuôi. Hàng ngày chị vẫn đi làm thuê ( đi phụ xây). Chị tham gia mức vay: 4.142.000 VND để đầu tư chăn nuôi gà.
 Phạm Thị V. sinh năm 1947, ( Mã số: 010103040022 ). Chị là công nhân đã về hưu có lương ổn định theo tháng khoảng 2.500.000 VND. Chị tham gia vay mức vốn: 4.142.000 VND để chăn nuôi gà.
texts.en:
Mrs. N. T. Nga (ID No: 010103040018), born in 1948, currently lives with her eldest son's family. There are 6 persons in her family. Her daughter-in-law sells fruits and vegetables in the market; her son is a driver for hire; her 3 grandchildren are still very young. Mrs. Nga mainly stays at home to perform agriculture tasks and raise livestock. This time, she would like to borrow 4,142,000VND to raise chickens. A responsible and nimble woman, she was trusted to be the group leader. Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. Chu T. H. (ID No: 010103040019), born in 1982. Her family has a store selling paints. Her family's average monthly income is about 4,500,000VND. She would like to borrow 4,142,000VND to buy and sell paints.
  • Mrs. N. T. M. (ID No: 010103040023), born in 1967. Her family mainly does farming and raising livestock. Everyday, she also works as a builder assistant. She would like to borrow 4,142,000VND to raise chickens.
  • Mrs. Pham T. V. (ID No: 010103040022), born in 1947. She is a retiree with a stable monthly income of 2,500,000VND. She would like to borrow 4,142,000VND to raise chickens.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising chickens

loans.name: Philma

texts.en: Philma O. sells petroleum products like gas, diesel, lubricants, etc. She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more petroleum products to sell. She is 40 years old and married with seven children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more petroleum products to sell

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma has owned a food items shop in the Jang’ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for 4 years. She belongs to Allah Karim group loan (Group code 2021). She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 80.Every day she works at her business for 8 hours.

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Mwajuma is 22 years old, married, and has a one-year-old child.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Putri Widiani

texts.en:
Ni Nyoman Putri Widiani - (DNR.M-0643) is a 33-year-old female living in the town of Dsn. Anggasari, Ds. Ekasari.  She is widowed and has 2 school-aged children.  To make a living, Ni Nyoman Putri Widiani owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for her business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.  Ni Nyoman Putri Widiani has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 300,000 IDR a month from these activities.


In 2007, Ni Nyoman Putri Widiani joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Nyoman Putri Widiani has successfully repaid a previous loan of 350,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  Ni Nyoman Putri Widiani is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  The loan will be her third loan from DINARI.  Ni Nyoman Putri Widiani plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Ni Nyoman Putri Widiani - (DNR.M-0643) merupakan 33 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Dsn. Anggasari, Ds. Ekasari.  Dia (perempuan) janda/duda (pasangan meninggal) dan memiliki 2 anak usia sekolah.  Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Nyoman Putri Widiani memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Nyoman Putri Widiani sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 4 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Nyoman Putri Widiani menghasilkan sekitar 300,000 IDR sebulan.


Dalam 2007, Ni Nyoman Putri Widiani bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Nyoman Putri Widiani meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang.  Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 5,000,000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli pakan ternak & pasokan lain.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 3rd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.  Ni Nyoman Putri Widiani berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk meningkatkan/memperluas bisnis peminjam.


Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. .  Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam  Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Jimoh

texts.en:
Jimoh is a 50-year-old, divorced woman. She is the loving mother of four children.

To make a living, Jimoh sells medicines. She is now seeking a loan in the amount of $700 (100,000 NGN) in order to purchase additional medicines for resale purposes. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional medicines for resale purposes

loans.name: Taleh

texts.en: Taleh has his own grocery store, and is requesting a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy more foodstuffs in order to improve his business. In 2006 he applied for his first loan of $1000 USD through Kiva, and he repaid this loan successfully. Now he is applying for his second loan through Kiva. He sends his thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose sells cooked foods and drinks. Rose is very eager to increase the standard of living of her family. Rose is 36 years old and married with five children. Rose hopes for a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks. 
She says thank you!

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru: Шерали Мамуров проживает в районе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 43 года. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Шерали более 20 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Он в основном выращивает бахчевые растения, а потом продает их на рынке. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы закупить минеральные удобрения и горючее и  использовать их для посева.
texts.en:
Sherali M. lives in the Qurgan-Tube district. He is 43 years old, married and has 6 children. Sherali has been involved in agriculture for over 20 years. He primarily grows melon plants and then sells them at a market. Client is requesting a loan to buy mineral fertilizer and fuel, and use them for sowing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increasing her stock of hairdressing and beauty products at her salon

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La señora TERESA G. C. , tiene 45 años, vive en el distrito del Porvenir  , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal SEMILLITAS CREATIVAS 
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria  , tiene 3 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella.
TERESA   se dedica a  la fabricación y perfilado de calzado en un pequeño taller que tiene en su domicilio.
Su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de materiales para la fabricación de sus zapatos, sandalias, zapatillas y carteras como: cuero, plantas, cuerina ,plantilla ,hebillas, etc.
Este crédito de 700 nuevos soles lo invertirá  en la compra de mas materiales para la fabricación de su calzado y carteras.
Teresa sueña con tener su propio stand en un centro comercial de Trujillo en donde vender su calzado al por mayor y menor.
texts.en:
Sra. Teresa G. C. is 45 years old and lives in the District of Porvenir, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She belongs to the Communal Bank “Semillitas Creativas”.

This entrepreneur completed her education through the 5th year of secondary school. She has 3 dependent children.

Teresa designs and manufacturers footwear in her small workshop, which is located in her home. Her first loan of 300 PEN was used to buy materials for making shoes, sandals, slippers, and handbags. These items included leather, soles, suede, patterns, buckles, etc.

Teresa will use her new loan in the amount of 700 PEN to purchase more materials for making footwear and handbags. She dreams of having her own booth at a shopping center in Trujillo where she can sell shoes wholesale and retail.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making shoes & handbags

loans.name: Magali

texts.es:
La señora Magali es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth”, ubicado en el Centro poblado de López del distrito de Ilave, provincia de el Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y sin hijos,  estudio secundaria completa, y  vive  en el  centro poblado de López.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 1 año, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para compra de abarrotes y golosinas.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, este préstamo ella lo va a utilizar en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, fideos, golosinas, galletas, etc. Para su tienda.

Su deseo es poder surtir mejor su tienda.

A ella le gustan  las reuniones.

loans.use: Para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, fideos, golosinas, galletas, etc.

loans.name: Florecitas De Villa Hermosa Group

texts.es:
La alcancía  comunal “Florecitas de Villa Hermosa”; esta conformada por 12 socios, ellos  tienen como afinidad, de que todos los integrantes son vecinos del  mismo barrio de Villa Hermosa, de ahí se origina el nombre de su alcancía, esta ubicado en la entrada de Huaycan  del distrito Ate, departamento de Lima. 
Trabajan con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad desde hace 3 años actualmente asume el cargo de presidenta la señora Maribel L., natural de Lima,  conviviente y con un hijo de 13 años.
Maribel es emprendedora e ingeniosa realiza 2 actividades, se dedica la venta de ropa en forma ambulatoria desde hace  6 años y también a la venta de comida junto con su hermano desde hace 10 años. Con su nuevo préstamo Maribel lo invertirá en la compra de ropa de temporada para así cubrir los pedidos solicitados y en los insumos para la preparación de los diferentes menús.
Nuestros socios se  dedican a diferentes actividades: una de ellas a la venta de neumáticos (llantas), otra se dedica a los tejidos a crochet y a palitos, 3 se dedican a la venta de productos de belleza, 2 tienen su tienda de abarrotes, otra socia vende comida y es cocinera, 3 socias se dedican a la venta de ropa,
una socia tiene su restaurante y un socio presta servicio de moto taxi. Todos nuestros socios tienen el deseo de aumentar sus ganancias y  en invertir para mejorar sus ingresos y la educación de sus hijos.
Nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo que les brindan Edaprospo - Prosperidad mediante los préstamos y se comprometen en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The Florecitas de Villa Hermosa Communal Bank is comprised of 12 members. They have great affinity for each other. They are all neighbors in the Villa Hermosa neighborhood, which is how they got the name for their communal bank. It is located at the entrance to Huaycan in the Ate district, Lima department. They have worked with EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad for three years. Maribel L., who is from Lima, is the president. She is in a common law marriage and has a 13 year old son. Maribel is enterprising and clever woman who does two activities. She is a street vendor who sells clothes. She has done this for six years. For ten years she has also been selling food with her brother. With the new loan Maribel will buy seasonal clothes to cover orders and buy supplies for preparing different meals. Our members are involved in different activities. One of them sells pneumatics (tires), another crochets and knits, three sell beauty products, two have grocery stores, another member sells food and is a cook, three members sell clothes, one member has a restaurant, and one member provides “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized cart) services. All of our members have the desire to increase their earnings and to invest in order to increase their incomes for their children’s education. Our members are grateful for the support offered through loans by Edaprospo – Prosperidad. They promise to make their payments on the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seasonal clothes to cover orders and supplies to make different meals

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: Gilberto S. C. tiene la edad de 39 años, es  padre casado y tiene 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El quiere comprar mas ganado y cerdo. Hace muchos anos que el dedico a su campo y quiere crecer. Es el segunda préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. También, el es parte del comité la luchita, el banco de campo, hace 5 anos. El es el tesorero del comité y su iglesia y le gusta participando en los comités por que tiene mas respeto de la comunidad. El no tenía problemas con su campo hace cinco anos y por esta razón, cree que crecer su campo sin riesgo. El deseo de el es de proporcionarles a sus hijos la educación necesaria para que se preparen para la vida. Esto es el primer prestamo de FUDECOSUR.
texts.en:
Gilberto S. C. is 39 years old and is married with 2 children, who are his highest priority. He wants to buy more pigs and livestock. His land has been his livelihood for many years and he wants it to develop further. This is the second loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has also been part of the La Luchita committee, a farming communal bank, for 5 years. He is the treasurer of the committee and of his church. He likes participating in committees because he has a lot of respect for community. He has not had any problems with his land over the past five years, and for that reason, he believes that there is little risk that his land will not develop further. His wish is to provide his children with the education necessary to prepare them for life. This is FUDECOSUR's first loan on Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more cattle and pigs

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta G. is from the village of Palao, Iligan City. She is 34 years old. Marietta is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Marietta owns and operates a service-based business specifically providing manicure and pedicure services in their local community. Marietta is just starting this business.

Marietta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marietta is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional materials used in providing the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Marietta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies and materials for her manicure and pedicure services

location.town: Palao, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 42 years old and married with three children between 9 and 20 years of age. All her children go to school. She owns a one-room house where she stays with three people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Rebecca takes care of additional family members. She incurs additional transport costs to and from buying chicken feed at Owino Market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda. She sells chickens and eggs to all categories of people at retail and at wholesale.  Rebecca works seven days a week. On average, she receives 20 customers a day. Rebecca has been in this business for seven years and with MCDT for five years, servicing her 20th loan. Her monthly expenses include school fees for her children and feeding the family. Rebecca wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of chicken feed and chicks. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and to start selling at wholesale only. She also hopes to own 10,000 chickens.

loans.use: To buy more chicken feed and chicks

loans.name: Edith

texts.fr: K. Edith est née en 1954 à Tanzoun au Bénin. Edith est mariée à TOVIZOUNKOUN Joseph et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Edith réside depuis une quinzaine d’année au quartier Hlacomey à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C’est avec ses enfants et son conjoint que Edith vit. Seul Joseph supporte les charges de la famille. Edith n’a jamais été à l’école. C’est pourquoi, depuis une vingtaine d’année, Edith vend du maïs et également de l’akassa (aliment local fait à base d’amidon de maïs) à son domicile. Edith s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Edith n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de ALIDé. Pour mieux développer son activité et accroître plus sa clientèle, Edith sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
K. Edith was born in 1954 in Tanzoun in Benin.  She is married to TOVIZOUNKOUN Joseph and is the mother of three children who are all in school.  For about 15 years, she has been residing in the Hlacomey district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She lives with her children and husband, Joseph, who is solely responsible for supporting the family. Edith has never been to school.  This is why, for some 20 years, she has been selling corn and also akassa (a local food made with corn starch) out of her home.  She stocks up from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She has never had an ALIDé loan before.  To develop her business more and to grow her customer base further, she's requesting an initial loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seven sacks of corn

loans.name: John

texts.en: John C. renders his motorbike transport services to repeat and walk-in customers in his rural area of Shiaisala.  His business challenges are strong competition and impassable roads in bad weather.  He will use the  proceeds of the KES20,000 loan to buy riding gear and to place a downpayment on another motorbike. In the future, John wants to own ten motorbikes and have a big transport business in the Butere district.  John is married with no children and describes himself as committed and dedicated enterpreneur.

loans.use: To buy riding gear and another  motorbike.

loans.name: Suubilyamukama Group 1, Lugazi

texts.en: Josephine N. is a married lady with five children. The eldest is at the university and the last born is still in primary school. She also takes care of orphans. She has had a boutique in Jinja for over 15 years selling new clothes like gomesi (colorful full-length dress), bitenge (similar to sarongs), and casual wear. Although she says that she has challenges, like transportation costs and inconsistency in the quality clothes, she is able to make a 150,000 profit per week. This is attributed to her good customer care skills and the availability of stock due to her loans. She hopes to become a wholesale supplier and build a house for her children as their mother. She needs loans for business growth, because they help her have a steady supply of products and school fees. She is such a hard working lady who wants the best for others.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros J., 54, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Manuel J., a driver, they are blessed with one child who is now studying in college. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her variety store for ten years.

Milagros has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than two years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow seven times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used all the money she borrowed to buy added stocks for her variety store. Her business lets her earn a profit of PHP 11,000 per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 8,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying additional stocks like snacks, soft drinks, and other household commodities.

She prays that her business will continue to be blessed by God so that she can support her son until he graduates from college and have a better life in the future.  

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks like snacks, soft drinks, and other household commodities.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma R., 48, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Renato R., a direct-selling vendor, she is blessed with three children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. Both of them have been selling different kinds of furniture for several years.

Norma has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than two years now. She regularly attends the weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow nine times in CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to buy raw materials for her furniture business. Her business lets her earn a profit of PHP 4,500 per month.

Now, with your help, Norma would like to obtain a PHP 8,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying products like chairs, tables and mosquito nets.

Norma dreams that they will have more clients so that they can earn more for their children’s education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more products like chairs, tables and mosquito nets

loans.name: Flaviana

texts.en:
Flaviana H. is from the village of Pangabuan Tangub City. She is 59 years old and she is married. To make a living, Flaviana owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish, shrimp and shellfish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $113 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Flaviana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Flavinia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr: Maïmouna Y. est âgée de 55 ans, elle est mariée à un homme polygame, elle mère de 8 enfants et vit avec sa coépouses dans la même maison. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Vélingara Foulbé2 depuis 5 ans et y a eu 10 expériences avec le crédit. Elle développe un petit commerce de crème glacé, de la bouillie de mil, du jus de fruits naturel et du couscous au lait. Avec ses bénéfices elle parvient à prendre en charge sa progéniture et de participer aux différentes charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Maimouna Y. is 55. She is in a polygamous marriage, has eight children and lives in the same house as her husband's other wives. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Vélingara Foulbé2 for five years, and has had ten loans. She has a small business selling ice-cream, millet porridge, natural fruit juices and couscous with milk. She uses her profits to take care of her children and to share in paying for family activity.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow her business

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is a 30-year-old married mother of four children ages four months to 10 years old.  All of her older children go to school.  She rents a one-room house where she lives with five people. The family has access to electricity and piped water.  Harriet takes care of additional family members.  She has a ladies salon in Busega Kiribedda and pays for transport costs to and from shopping to buy her cosmetics from shops in Kampala City. On average she serves about 10 customers each day. She works on the outskirts of Kampala and has been in business for five years.  Her monthly expenses include feeding the family, accommodation, and medication. Her business challenges include transportation during the rainy season which hinders her customers from coming to her salon because it is in a muddy place. She has been with MCDT for four years and is now requesting her ninth loan which she will use to buy more boxes of relaxers and cosmetics. She aspires to grow her business and start buying directly from manufacturers.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of relaxers and cosmetics.

loans.name: Olatunde

texts.en:
Olatunde is 46 years old and is married with four children. His children attend school and this makes him happy. His wife is a caterer and she also supports their home.

Olatunde sells and repairs electronics to make a living. He is an honest and hardworking man and is so determined to excel in his business and family life. He is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more electronics to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics to sell

loans.name: Ishongororo Twekundire Group

texts.en:
Hard working R. Aidah, aged 48 years, started her retail shop business ten years ago. Being strategically located in Kakinga trading centre, Ishongororo, she gets many customers, earning her a profit of 60,000 Ugandan shillings monthly. Aidah’s main drawback is having a small amount of stock that cannot match the demand from her customers.

With this loan Aidah hopes to buy more stock for her business. This will help her expand her market and also earn more sales revenue to cater for the requirements of her three children, who are still undergoing school, and also be able to progress economically.

Aidah belongs to a group of twelve members who are on their 9th loan. They hold each other accountable and insure each other in paying back the loan.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her business

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mrs. Mercedes A. is from Poblacion, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 40 years old and married with eight children. She is a PDP-LP member. Out of her eight children, three went to school. Mrs. Mercedes manages her snack vending business while her husband is a farmer, which supports their daily basic needs. She earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

She joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to engage in other business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 3,000 PHP taken from PMPC. As of now, she has a new loan of 5,000 PHP taken from PMPC, which is intended for her business. It will serve as an expansion of her business and as additional capital. 

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for her snack vending

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es: Benedicta, es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 50 años al igual que su esposo Javier, juntos tienen 4 hijos, pero sólo viven con uno de ellos en su casa propia. Pese a los diversos problemas familiares y económicos, encontró fuerzas para salir adelante, es por ello que hace mas de 3 años empezó con la venta de diversas variedades de refrescos y mates acompañados de sándwich de huevo, quesos y hamburguesas de pollo y carne; mientras que su esposo labora como chófer en moto taxi. De esa manera logran remunerar diariamente S/. 45.00 nuevos soles, con este ingreso cubre los gastos académicos de su último hijo, además puede solventar los gastos domésticos que tienen. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es ofrecer los productos que comercializa y como estrategia de venta, ofrece degustación de sus platillos. Por ahora desea priorizar en la compra de productos comestibles y golosinas para abastecer su puesto de venta, ya que este trabajo lo realiza de manera ambulante, siendo los transeúntes sus principales compradores.  Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y siente que su progreso empezó desde que trabaja con los integrantes de su grupo comunal, a quienes respeta  y valora mucho, asimismo su participación es de manera activa. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará dulces, galletas, golosinas, además de bebidas gasificadas.
texts.en:
Benedicta is a hard-working woman who, like her husband Javier, is 50 years old. They have 4 children together, but only one still lives with them, in the house they own. Despite diverse family and financial problems, she found the strength to forge ahead. For this reason, three years ago, she started selling a variety of refreshments along with egg and cheese sandwiches and hamburgers. Meanwhile, her husband works as a moto-taxi driver. With these activities, they manage to bring in 45.00 Peruvian soles each day, and with this income they support the education of their youngest child and pay for their household expenses. The aspect she enjoys most about her work is selling her products. She offers samples of her food as a marketing strategy. For now, she wants to prioritize by purchasing edible products and sweets to supply her stand, since she conducts her business in an ambulatory manner. This is her sixth credit with MFP. She feels her progress began once she started working with the other members, who she respects and values a great deal. She is an active participant in the group. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy candy, cookies, sweets, and sodas.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food and candy to supply her stand.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a 30-year-old shoe seller.  She sells shoes to local customers at a marketplace along a busy road that leads to Nairobi.  She has been in this business for 5 years.  Loice is married and has 3 children, 2 boys and 1 girl, from 4 to 14 years old.  Before selling shoes on her own, she worked in a retail shop.

Loice plans to use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase additional shoe inventory for resale.  In the future, she hopes to supply uniforms to schools and government agencies.

Loice describes herself as a loving and caring mother.

loans.use: To purchase additional shoe inventory for resale

loans.name: God Is In Control Group

texts.en:
James T., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God Is In Control. 

He is 25 years old and single.  James was only able to attend school through 9th grade due to lack of financial support.  

For 4 years, he has been operating a motorcycle transport business in Harbel Firestone, outside of Monrovia, Liberia.

He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this group loan to buy a motorcycle.

James deecribes himself as kind and easy-going. His dream is to expand his business and  buy more motorcycles.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Doris' picture is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Noruzkan's Group

texts.en: Noruzkan B. is the leader of this group. She is 55 and married. She has a son who is 30 and who works as a private driver. Noruzkan rents a place where she sells convenience goods. She has been doing this for ten years and started with the initial investment of 30,000 soms. Now she makes 10,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase a variety of goods in order to increase the turnover of her business. In the future Noruzkan plans to expand her business. Ainagul K., 37, is married. She has two sons and a daughter: the sons are in school but the daughter is not yet. Ainagul’s husband went to Russia to work to make some money. Ainagul herself rents a place where she sells convenience goods. She started her business activity three years ago with the initial investment of 30,000 soms and now she makes 10,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase a variety of goods in order to increase the turnover of her business. In the future Ainagul wants to build her own store. Shaanigul A. is the treasurer of the group. She is 23 and married and has a son who is just three years old. Shaanigul works in a post office and her husband works in a state registry department. Five years ago Shaanigul and her husband began to breed cattle. They started this activity with an initial investment of 25,000 soms. Sometimes, if they need money, they can sell some farm animals to cover their expenses. With the money received from the loan, Shaanigul wants to purchase a cow to increase the number of her cattle. In the future she wants to purchase a vehicle. Bukush K., 63, is a widow. She has a son and a daughter. Three years ago Bukush got a loan and bought equipment which is needed to prepare cakes. By taking orders and selling cakes, Bukush makes 10,000 soms per month. With the money received from the loan she wants to purchase flour. In the future, Bukush plans to open a confectionery shop. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of goods in order to increase the turnover of her business

loans.name: Balbina

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Balbina A. la esta haciendo falta impermeabilizar el techo de su casa ya que este en muy malas condiciones.
Desea repararlo entes de que llegue la temporada de invierno, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejora. Es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo y planea pagarlo con el ingreso que obtiene como limpiando casa. 
Ya que su hijo el joven  Federico Garcia A. le ayuda con los gastos familiares con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como guardia de seguridad.
texts.en:
The roof over Ms. Balbina A.’s home needs to be waterproofed because it is in bad shape. She would like to repair it before winter, but she does not have the money. This is why she is requesting this loan, which she plans to repay out of the money she earns by cleaning houses. Her son, Federico Garcia A., helps her with the family expenses with the money he earns from his job as a security guard.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roof repair

loans.name: Gladis Edid

texts.es:
La Señora Gladis Edid C. es socia del banco comunal Primero de Enero, vive en la comunidad Primero de Enero que pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, tiene como atractivo la hermosa laguna de Cochabamba (llena de totora).
 
La Señora Gladis Edid tiene 25 años, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 1 año de edad, su primer hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad, recibe el apoyo del padre de sus hijos y vive en su casa propia la misma que la ha construido con su esfuerzo.
 
Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de ropa surtida de adulto, la misma que la vende recorriendo la ciudad, realiza esta actividad hace 3 años sin tener un horario fijo de trabajo. Es su primer crédito que realiza en la fundación y le ha invitado una amiga a formar parte de este hermoso banco comunal, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa interior, su meta es llegar a tener un local comercial.
texts.en:
Our member sells assorted clothing for adults in an itinerant manner throughout the city. She’s been in this line of work for three years and does not have a fixed work schedule. This is the first loan she’s gotten from the foundation. A girl friend invited her to be part of this beautiful communal bank. She will use the funds to buy underwear. Her goal is to have a fixed locale someday.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy underwear.

loans.name: Hodari Group

texts.fr: Mawazo Bakulu C. est présidente actuel du groupe Hodari pour son nouveau cycle de crédit, elle est âgée de 44 ans, mariée, mère de 11 enfants. Son mari est tailleur couturier. Tous ces 10 enfants vont à l’école sauf le cadet qui a encore 3 ans. Elle fait le petit commerce de vente de souliers et vêtements divers. Elle n’a pas un lieu précis, elle vend de manière ambulatoire, elle fait de crédits aux divers preneurs de ses produits. Elle commence avec le 50$ de crédit de Hekima, après avoir connu un vol de son capital au niveau de Kampala (Ouganda, elle rentabilisa ce crédit, et actuellement elle inspire  au crédit de 800$. Ce crédit sera affecté dans le business de vente de vêtements. Comme défis majeur, elle est encore incapable de louer une chambre (boutique) pour une exposition de ses produits. Elle souhaite dans le jour avenir, acheter une seconde parcelle et y construire confortablement. En outre elle souhaiterait que ses enfants étudient confortablement. La cliente Mawazo Bakulu C. remercie Hekima pour le crédit qu’elle reçoit sans aucune garantie.
texts.en:
C. Mawazo Bakulu is the current president of the Hodari group for the new loan cycle. She is 44 years old, married, and a mother to 11 children. Her husband is a tailor. All of her children attend school except for the youngest, age 3. C. has a small business selling miscellaneous footwear and clothing. Having no fixed location to carry on her activities, she goes on the road to sell her goods, and allows her customers to buy on credit. She received a $50 loan from Hekima after being robbed of her capital in Kampala, Uganda. She managed to achieve profitability and is currently seeking an $800 loan, which she will use in her clothing retail business. Being unable to rent space to display her merchandise remains a major hurdle. In the future, she wants to buy a second plot of land to build a comfortable home. She also wants her children to receive proper schooling. As a member of the micro-finance institution, C. wishes to thank Hekima for granting her a loan without any guarantees.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase of 30 pairs of pants, 50 sets (blouse and skirt), 40 blouses, and 20 children’s outfits

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.en:
Leoncio D. is from the village of Unidos, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. He is 54 years old and is married with two school-aged children. Leoncio owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as vinegar, cooking oil, soy sauce, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Leoncio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Leoncio is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his third from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kurbonmurod

texts.ru: Хасанов Курбонмурод проживает в районе Варзоб. Возраст, 39 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Образование средне - специальное, сварщик. По специальности проработал 5 лет. Сейчас он занимается торговлей. Имеет собственную торговую точку, где продает угль. Этим видом деятельности занимается 2 года. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота. Клиент хочет закупить в оптом угль, так как в это время года спрос на его товар увеличивается.
texts.en:
Kurbonmurod H. lives in the Varzob district. He is 39 years old, married and has 4 children. He has a secondary-specialized education as a welder. He worked in that field for 5 years. Currently, Kurbonmurod is involved in sales. He owns a retail outlet, where he sells coal. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. He is requesting this loan in order to increase goods tunover. The client wants to buy coal wholesale because the demand on his goods increases this time of year.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel O. is 34 years old and married to Jacinta Anyango. They have seven children who are between 15 and six years old. They live in Corner legio in Kisumu city. 

Gabriel has a butcher shop and has been in this business for the last five years. He is applying for his second loan, after repaying his first loan without any difficulties. His monthly income is 10,000 Kenyan shillngs, and  he want to buy a bull to be used to add more meat to his shop. His clients mostly consist of hotel owners and the locals in his neighborhood. He intends to use the money to build a pig slaughter house that will enable him to sell pork in his shop.

His hope and dream is to see his business expand and give his children the best education.

loans.use: purchasing a bull for slaughter

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel de 46 años, vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil( zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas), tiene una tienda de víveres en donde vende, enlatados, canes etc. 

El trabajaba en una empresa pero cuando lo liquidaron decidió invertir el dinero de la liquidación en víveres de primera necesidad, convirtiendo la parte delantera de su casa en un pequeño local. Trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 21h30pm todos los días vendiendo enlatados, bebidas, granos etc. Una de las dificultades en estos meses para trabajar en su tienda ha sido la enfermedad de su esposa ya que el se debe encargar de sus hijos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas, enlatados, arroz para poder vender en su tienda. En el futuro quiere incrementar la mercadería de su tienda.
texts.en: Miguel is 46 years old and lives in Fortín de Guayaquil (a suburban area with dirt roads and hills). He has a grocery store where he sells canned goods and other items. He worked at a company but when it went out of business he decided to invest the money from his settlement in foods of primary need and converted the front part of his home into a store. He works from 6 a.m. until 9:30 p.m. every day selling canned goods, beverages, grains, etc. Lately one of the difficulties of working in his store has been that his wife has been sick so he has been left to care for their children. With the loan, he plans to purchase beverages, canned goods and rice to sell in his store. In the future he wants to increase his store's merchandise.

loans.use: Purchase canned goods, rice, oil

loans.name: Abla Wola Dope

texts.fr: Cette  femme est mariée et mère de 2 enfants . Elle genère des activités de revenu et s’invertit dans la restauration. Elle a 34 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché local d’assiyéyé . Elle exerce cette activité 2 ans déjà.  Elle sollicite ce credit pour acheter un tas d'igname, 2 bidons de sodabi, 2 sacs de mais,2 sacs de riz pour mieux satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en: This woman is married and the mother of two. She makes a living by preparing food for sale. She is 34 years old. She stocks up at the local market of Assiyéyé. She has been in this business for two years already. She is seeking this loan to purchase a pile of yams, two jugs of sodabi [a local liquor]. two bags of corn, and two bags of rice in order to better meet her customers’ needs.

loans.use: Purchasing materials necessary for food production

loans.name: De Esmeralda Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama De Esmeralda. Está ubicado en  el Estado de México.  El grupo está conformado por  9  integrantes.
La señora Maria Araceli Castañeda es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 30 años, es comerciante y tiene en total 2 hijos; 1 mujer y 1 varón.  Ella se dedica a  la venta de Chamarras y Abrigos que inició hace 9 años con un pequeño puesto de kocteles de fruta fuera de la escuela de su comunidad pidiendo ayuda a los niños para cobrar porque no sabía sumar ni restar y como sus ventas eran buenas fue ahorrando y compró ropa y como es buena vendedora sus vecinas le han solicitado que les traiga sabanas y colchas las cuales las vende en tandas o pagos semanales, su esposo que trabaja en un fabrica tambien le ayuda a vender con sus compañeros de trabajo, ya que la señora Araceli es muy entusiasta y jamas se rinde aunque en algunas ocaciones sus ventas han caido demasiado, puesto que siempre le dice a su esposo que “mas vale un peso en la mano bien gando y no millones bien robados”. Solicita el préstamo para la inversion de chamarras y abrigos que son los que se venden más en esta temporada y  asi acrecentar más sus ventas y negocio para que en un futuro pueda darle a sus hijos una muy buena calidad en su educación ya que desea que sean buenos profesionistas y no se queden como ella que con mucha dificultad aprendió a hacer cuentas.
texts.en:
This group is called De Esmeralda. It is located in Mexico state. The group is formed by 9 members. Maria Araceli Castañeda is the president of the group. She is 30 years old, is a businesswoman, and has two children: a boy and a girl. She sells coats and jackets, an activity she began 9 years ago with a small fruit cocktail stand outside of the community's school, asking the children for help when charging because she did not know how to add or subtract. Since her sales were good, she continued saving and bought clothes and because she is a good saleswoman, her neighbors had her bring them sheets and bedspreads, which she sold in batches or monthly payments.

Her husband works in a factory and also helps her sell along with her coworkers. Ms. Araceli is very enthusiastic and never gives up although on occasion her sales have dropped very much. She always tells her husband "a peso earned is worth more than one thousand robbed." She is seeking this loan to invest in jackets and coats which she sells a lot of in this season and grow her sales and her business so that in the future she can give her children a high quality education who she hopes to be good professionals and not be like her, who learned arithmetic with much difficulty.

loans.use: To invest in the business

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María es de la ciudad de San Ignacio Misiones, tiene 25 años, actualmente se encuentra trabajando como vendedora en la Empresa Tigo, con esfuerzo y dedicación sigue luchando por salir adelante y está estudiando informática, ya que en la actualidad es casi una obligación tener un conocimiento en esta área.
Ella solicita el préstamo para el pago de las cuotas.
María agradece este préstamo ya que le ayudará para continuar con sus estudios y así ampliar sus conocimientos.
texts.en:
María is from the town of San Ignacio Misiones.  She is 25 years old and is currently working as a saleswoman for the company Tigo.  Through hard work and determination, she is working to get ahead.  She is studying IT since it is currently almost obligatory to have knowledge of this field.  She is requesting a loan so that she can pay her course fees.

María is grateful for this loan which will help her to continue with her studies and thereby enable her to increase her knowledge.

loans.use: To pay her monthly fees

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es: Cirila, de 41 años, es una mujer muy amable y sencilla, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Arístides de 56 años y sus 3 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Las chacras de Cirila son de las mejores cuidadas en el poblado de Limonchayocc, todas las mañanas, trabaja desde muy temprano en sus tierras, ya que sabe que del cuidado que le brinde a su cacao, café y hojas de coca dependerán los ingresos de su familia. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene para pasear por los verdes campos de su poblado, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus tierras de las plagas. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono e insecticidas para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Cirila, 41, is a very friendly and simple woman.  She lives with her husband, Arístides, who is 56 years old, and her three young children, to whom she hopes to offer a better quality of life.  Cirila's farmland is the best cared for in the village of Limonchayocc.  She starts working on her land very early every morning because she knows that her family's income is dependent upon how well she cares for her cocoa, coffee, and coca leaves.

Her favorite thing about her work is the freedom that she has to stroll through the green fields of her settlement.  She has been doing this work for 20 years and considers the most difficult part to be protecting her fields from plagues.

In time, she hopes to buy more land in order to increase her production.  This is her second loan through Microfinanzas Prisma and she hopes to be very punctual with her repayments, as she does not want to cause problems for her communal bank, which she is very content with.  She will use the requested 1,500 nuevos soles to buy fertilizer and insecticides for her crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es: Maria Antonieta se dedica a una pulpería. Todos los días tiene que levantarse temprano y buscar la forma de generar ingresos para su hogar. Esta no es la primera vez que tiene créditos con Fundación pues ha sido de gran ayuda    ha demostrado el pagar sus cuotas en tiempo y forma. Ahora solicita un nuevo crédito para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan entre otros. Ya que se acerca una buena temporada festiva.
texts.en: Maria Antonieta has a stationery store. Every day she has to get up early in search of a way to generate income for her household. This is not her first loan with the Fundacion, and these loans have been a great help. She has paid off her quotas in a timely manner. She is now requesting a new loan for the purchase of candies, drinks and bread among other items, as we are approaching a good festive season.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Chimboco Group

texts.es: El Grupo solidario Chimboco esta conformado por 3 integrantes todas ellas mujeres, la  representante del grupo es la Sra. Florencia,  vive en la zona D. Chimboco por eso el nombre del grupo, vive en la casa D. sus suegros, tiene tres hijos, ella venD. verduras en Cochabamba en uno e los mercados mas populares D. la ciudad, con el dinero del crédito comprara verduras por sacos,  es un   grupo  D. amigas, vecinas D. muchos años las otras dos clientes realizan la venta D. ropa y la otra Sra., realiza la venta D. dulces y refrescos , el préstamo lo invertirán para incrementar su capital D. trabajo.
texts.en:
The Chimboco solidarity group is maD. up of three members, all women. The group representative is Mrs. Florencia. She lives in the Chimboco zone, hence the name of the group. She lives in the home of her parents-in-law. She has three children and sells vegetables in Cochabamba, in one of the city's most popular markets. She will use this loan to buy bags of vegetables.

This is a group of long-time friends and neighbours. 

The other two members sell clothing, and the other married woman also sells candies and drinks. They will invest this loan to increase their working capital.

loans.use: the purchase of vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Serieux Group

texts.fr:
SÉRIEUX est un groupement de quatre femmes toutes mariées, de l’association DJIGUISSEME, ayant en moyenne 51 ans, 6 enfants et vivant dans des familles nucléaires avec leurs époux et enfants  à Sido préfecture de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Les membres du groupe SÉRIEUX se sont connus à travers des liens de  parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans l’idée de trouver un fonds de commerce suffisant pour satisfaire leurs clientèles, elles ont décidé d’adhérer une fois de plus au programme de crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Elles utilisent les prêts pour faire le commerce de savon, de tissus, d’articles divers et par Sitan T. le commerce de condiments.  Elles sont à leurs onzièmes prêts de groupe dont tous les prêts précédents ont été remboursés correctement à l’échéance.
Avec ce nouveau prêt Sitan T. la présidente du groupe, compte acheter, 5 paniers de tomate, 5 sacs d’oignons, 2 sacs de 25 kg de sel et 5 paquets de cube maggi.  Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Sido au niveau des grossistes et effectue sa vente à la maison en détail, en espèce et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 25.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera réinvesti dans son activité et le reste pour rembourser le prêt et payer les frais de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
"Sérieux" is a group of four married women from the Djiguisseme Association. They average 51 years of age, with an average of six children each, and live in nuclear families with their husbands and children in the Sido prefecture of Bougouni (Mali's third administrative region). 

The members of the Sérieux group met each other through relations and neighbors. With the aim of finding sufficient business funds to satisfy their customers, they decided once more to join the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. They use their loans to trade in soap, fabric and other products. Sitan T., for instance, trades in condiments. The women are on their eleventh group loan, and all the previous loans were repaid on time and in full. 

With this new loan, Sitan T., who is the president of the group, is planning on buying five baskets of tomatoes, five sacks of onions, two 25kg sacks of salt and five packets of "Maggi" stock cubes. She gets her supplies from wholesalers at the market in Sido and sells her goods at home on a retail basis, for cash and on credit, to a customer base made up of women and men.

With this loan she is hoping to make a monthly profit of 25,000FCFA, of which part will be reinvested in her business and the rest used to repay her loan and her children's health costs.

loans.use: Purchase of condiments

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet M. is from the town of Banga. She is 47 years old. Janet is married and has a 14-year-old child. To make a living, Janet owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Janet has been engaged in farming for 25 years now.

Janet joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janet has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Janet is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman who lives in Bataraza, Palawan. She earns her living by fish vending and fishing. Her husband Mateo, who is 43 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have eight children who are between 2 and 15 years old. Emma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 24 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Emma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 18,700, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 25th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000 to buy a freezer for her fish. She is convinced that she can continue building a second story on her house and provide higher education to all her children. Emma is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase an additonal freezer for her fish

loans.name: Luceros En La Mañana Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama Luceros En La Mañana, porque se encuentra en la parte alta de la comunidad, y se ubica en Tehuacan en el estado de Puebla en Mexico. El grupo esta conformado por 11 integrantes y es la 3 vez que solicitan credito. La señora Irma P. es integrante de este grupo, ella tiene una estetica y también se dedica a la venta de aves, que inicio hace 5 años. Solicita el prestamo para la compra de articulos de belleza y asi poder tener más variedad en sus productos y mejores servicios, también lo pide para la compra-venta de aves. Tiene 43 años, estudió hasta la primaria, es casada y tiene en total 2 hijos, 1 varon y 1 mujer de 12 y 18 años de edad respectivamente. Sus clientes opinan que tiene buen servicio devido a la variedad en sus productos, además de estar en una buena ubicacion,  ella cuenta con las aves necesarias para cualquier eventualidad. Al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente alegre porque va a poder cumplir con las espectativas de sus clientes. Quiere este crédito para invertir en su negocio y asi obtener mayores ganancias. Espera que su negocio tenga crecimiento y seguir apoyadoce economicamente para salir adelante ya que su hijo decea seguir estudiandoy ella quiere brindarle esa ilución.
texts.en:
This group is called Luceros En La Mañana [Bright Stars in the Morning], because they are in the upper part of the community, and they live in Tehuacan in the Mexican state of Puebla. The group is made up of 11 members and this is the third time they have requested a loan. Señora Irma P. is a member of this group. For 5 years she has had a beauty salon and she also sells birds. She requests the loan in order to purchase beauty products so she can have a wider variety of products and provide better services, and also for buying and selling birds.

She is 43 years old, went to primary school, is married and has 2 children, a boy, 12, and a girl, 18. Her customers say she has a good business owing to the variety of her products, as well as a good location, and she has the necessary birds for any eventuality. She feels happy about requesting this loan because she will be able to meet her customers' expectations. She wants this loan in order to invest in her business and make higher profits. She hopes her business will grow and continue supporting her economically so she can get ahead, since her son wishes to continue studying and wants to fulfill that dream.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her beauty salon and birds

loans.name: Dina Elisa

texts.es:
La Señora. Dina Z. es socia del banco comunal El Cruce hacia el Futuro, vive por el sector de Miraflores en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es  la tercera ciudad  más importante del país, la belleza de su centro histórico que es una mezcla de lo moderno y lo colonial, su gastronomía es muy variada.

Doña Dina tiene 40 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos de 22, 20, 17, 14, 7 y 3 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado e independiente, su segundo y cuarto hijo estudian en un colegio de la ciudad, su tercera hija  trabaja y su penúltimo hijo está en la escuela. Su esposo es artesano, trabaja con mármol. No tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
La Señora Dina  se dedica hace 3 años al comercio informal, ella vende  ropa, trabaja todos los días recorriendo la ciudad sin un horario fijo.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de pantalones, camisetas, blusa, ropa de niños, etc. para crecer más en su negocio.
 
Su sueño tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Dina Z. is a member of “El Cruce Hacia el Futuro” Communal Bank. She lives in the Miraflores area of the city of Cuenca. This is the third most important city in the country. The historic center is a beautiful mixture of modern and colonial and its cuisine is very diverse.

Dina is 40 years old, married, and has six children who are 22, 20, 17, 14, 7 and 3 years old. Her oldest son is married and independent; her second and fourth children go to a high school in the city; her third oldest works, and her second youngest is in elementary school. Her husband is a craftsman and works with marble. They do not own their home, which is why they are renting.

Dina has worked informally selling clothes for the past three years. She works every day throughout the city without a set schedule.

This is her second loan with the communal bank and she will invest it in the purchase of pants, T-shirts, blouses, children’s clothing, etc. so that her business will grow.

Her dream is to own her own house.

loans.use: to buy pants, T-shirts, blouses, children’s clothing, etc.

loans.name: Josephine Atieno

texts.en:
Josephine Atieno O. runs a salon as her primary business and a car hire business as a secondary business. She has been working in these businesses for 12 years in the summer and earns an income of 12,000 KES. She is widowed and blessed with five children.
Josephine has applied for her first loan from Kiva partner, KADET. She plans to use the entire loan amount to purchase more beauty products for resale. She will use her anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. Josephine hopes to expand and improve her car hire business by purchasing a new vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty products for resale

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco Marcelo P. Cadena, tiene 45 años de edad, es oriundo de la ciudad de Ibarra, vive en unión libre, no tiene hijos, su nivel de educación es primario. Francisco empezó a trabajar desde que tenía 11 años como ayudante de albañil, con el tiempo ha adquirido experiencia y ahora él mismo hace sus propios diseños de casas y se especializa en la construcción mixta en ladrillo visto y madera, actualmente trabaja con 4 ayudantes. Actualmente vive en un departamento arrendado, pero al momento está construyendo su propia casa en el terreno que le corresponde como herencia, por lo que está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material necesario, terminar su casa y en el futuro poder tener hijos y darles las comodidades que él nunca tuvo.
texts.en:
Francisco Marcelo P. Cadena, age 45, is from the city of Ibarra.  He is in a common-law marriage, and he does not have children.  He has an elementary school education.

Francisco started working as a bricklayer’s helper when he was 11 years old.  In time he acquired experience, and now he makes his own designs for houses.  He specializes in building a mix of brick facade and wood.  He currently works with four helpers.

He now lives in a rented apartment.  However, he is currently building his own house on land that he inherited.

He is requesting to loan to be able to buy the needed material to finish his house.  In the future he will be able to give his children the amenities that he never had.

loans.use: to buy construction material to finish his house.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
En el departamento del Cusco, capital Cusco conocido desde hace muchos años como la "Capital Arqueológica de América", se reúnen cada treinta días las socias del Banco Comunal “Todos Unidos” en la oficinas central de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú.

En este banco comunal conocimos al señor Antonio y nos cuenta que nació en la ciudad de Puno, tiene 55 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tiene tres hijos. 

Antonio desde el año 2000 que se dedica a vender adornos y auto partes para automóviles, él tiene un puesto de venta en el centro comercial “Auto Partes San Pedro” pero el local está alquilado. En esta oportunidad Antonio requiere el préstamo para comprar mercedaria como por ejemplo adornos, radios, bocinas, llantas, gatas y otras cosas más.
texts.en:
Every thirty days, the members of the "Todos Unidos" (Everyone United) community bank meet in Asociación Arariwa's central office, in Cusco, Peru.  This city has been known for many years as the "Archaeological Capital of America".

Here we meet Antonio, a member of the bank, who tells us that he was born in the city of Puno, is 55 years old, married, and has three children.

Since the year 2000, Antonio has been selling decorative accessories and spare parts for cars.  He has a sales location "Auto Partes San Pedro" in a shopping center but he rents his premises.  On this occasion, Antonio needs a loan to buy merchandise such as, for example, decorative accessories, radios, horns, tires, jacks, etc.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as decorative accessories, radios, horns, tires, jacks, etc.

loans.name: Inocenta

texts.es:
