Inocenta tiene 46 años de edad, ella vive con su novio y sus dos hijos en un caserío (comunidad rural de condición baja) ubicado en el distrito de La Victoria – Chiclayo, donde la actividad principal es la crianza de animales y las labores agrícolas.

Inocenta se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral las cuales comercializa en los mercados de la zona. Inocenta tiene más de 18 años ejerciendo esta actividad lo que la hace una experta en el rubro. Adicionalmente, se dedica a la elaboración de chicha de jora (bebida macerada hecha a base de maíz) y ambos negocios cuentan con clientela establecida.

Inocenta solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles que utilizará para mejorar y ampliar los corrales  con los que cuenta así como para implementar uno más. 

Inocenta cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos en sus actividades y existe una buena relación familiar. Ella estaría muy agradecida de concedérsele el crédito pues le sería de gran utilidad.
texts.en:
Inocenta tiene 46 años de edad, ella vive con su novio y sus dos hijos en un caserío (comunidad rural de condición baja) ubicado en el distrito de La Victoria – Chiclayo, donde la actividad principal es la crianza de animales y las labores agrícolas.

Inocenta se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral las cuales comercializa en los mercados de la zona. Inocenta tiene más de 18 años ejerciendo esta actividad lo que la hace una experta en el rubro. Adicionalmente, se dedica a la elaboración de chicha de jora (bebida macerada hecha a base de maíz) y ambos negocios cuentan con clientela establecida.

Inocenta solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles que utilizará para mejorar y ampliar los corrales  con los que cuenta así como para implementar uno más. 

Inocenta cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos en sus actividades y existe una buena relación familiar. Ella estaría muy agradecida de concedérsele el crédito pues le sería de gran utilidad.

loans.use: Mejorar, ampliar  e implementar corrales.

loans.name: Cristine

texts.en:
Cristine  is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. She  has a retail shop that sells beverages like soft drinks & alcoholic drinks. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional stocks of beverages.

Cristine  is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Cristine  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of beverages.

loans.name: Newton

texts.en:
Newton, aged 22, is unmarried and lives with his younger sister. He practices farming, mainly dairy farming and poultry keeping, which he has been doing for two years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES. 8,700.

This is his first loan term with Kiva partner KADET LTD.  He will use the loan funds to buy a dairy cow for milk production which he will in turn sell to customers.

Newton intends to use the expected profits to buy 50 chicks so as to increase his egg supply.  He hopes to operate a large scale farm in the future.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lira

texts.es:
La señora Lira es socia del banco comunal Manos Maravillosas del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y tiene cinco hijos, pero solo cuatro de ellos están a su cargo.
Se dedica a la venta de golosina, utiliza un tablero para poder exhibir su mercadería. Esta actividad la realiza de forma ambulatoria junto a un grifo de la zona, donde ya tiene clientes fijos.

Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 2 cajitas de chocolate, 2 cajas de galletas, 2, cajas de chicle, 2 bolsas de caramelo, 3 tiras de chizitos, 3 tiras de papas fritas, 3 tiras de chistriz.
Todavía tiene hijos pequeños que dependen de su trabajo y dedicación, su esposo es trabajador independiente y no cuenta con un sueldo seguro, tiene que trabajar duro para poder mantener su hogar.  Gracias a la ayuda de Lira pueden solventar los gastos de casa, él está muy contento por ello.
texts.en:
Lira is a member of the 'Manos Maravillosas' community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 43 years old, married and has five children, only four of whom are in her care.

Lira's business is selling candies.  She uses a board to display her merchandise.  She makes her sales as an itinerant vendor next to a local filling station where she has regular customers.

With her new loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles, Lira will buy 2 boxes of chocolate, 2 boxes of cookies, 2 boxes of gum, 2 bags of candies, 3 strips of Chizitos (a brand of cheese puffs), 3 strips of chips (crisps) and 3 strips of Chistriz.

Lira still has young children who are dependent on her work and commitment.  Her husband is self employed and doesn't have a very stable wage.  He has to work hard to support their household.  Thanks to Lira's help, they are able to cover their household expenses and this makes her husband very happy.

loans.use: to buy treats such as candies, snacks, chocolate, etc.

loans.name: And Soukali Jeeguene Pire 9 Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de 5 membres qui habitent dans le village de Pire à cent km de DAKAR la capitale du Sénégal, leur activité principale est le commerce de produits agricoles  les tubercules de manioc. Elles sont expérimentées dans le domaine et disposent  d’une bonne  clientèle. Leur journée commence à 8 heures du matin et se  termine vers 20heures du soir. Avec ce financement elles comptent  acheter 100 sacs de manioc qu’elles vont revendre  au marché. Les revenus tirés de la vente du manioc leur permettra de renforcer leur commerce mais aussi de satisfaire les besoins de leurs enfants (paiement des frais de scolarité les frais médicaux et participer a l’entretien de la maison).
texts.en:
This is a group composed of five members who live in Pire, a village located 100 kilometers from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. Their main business activity involves trading with farm products, such as cassava tubers. The group members are experienced in this field and have a strong customer base. The workday starts at 8 a.m. and ends around 8 p.m.

With this financing, the group members intend to buy 100 sacks of cassava that they will resell at the market. The income earned from the sale of cassava will enable them to strengthen their business and provide for their children (school fees, healthcare and household expenses).

loans.use: to buy cassava, groundnuts and millet.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy, 38 years old, is a mother of three children, ages 13, 10, and 6. She is raising chickens for sale. She also keeps layer hens for eggs. She has been in this business for three years. With this loan, she plans to buy chicken feed and more layer hens so that she can get better returns.

From the anticipated profits, she hopes to add more chicks and build a better house for her family. She also desires and plans to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy food for her chickens and more layer hens

loans.name: Ernalyn

texts.en:
Ernalyn is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.

Ernalyn has a fruit shop that sells lanzones (a fruit) by the kilogram. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan of 17,000 PHP to buy a box or bunch of lanzones to sell.

Ernalyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Ernalyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a box or bunch of lanzones to sell

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a single woman who owns a house that neither has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are water bills and food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a restaurant business, selling to town dwellers and neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding to become self dependent in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase food products, bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and salt. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase food products, bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and salt for her restaurant

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en: Gertrude is a 41-year-old married woman with four children living in her own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her main dream is to educate her children up to university level. For fifteen years she has been farming, and is also in the transport sector. Her major challenge is mechanical breakdowns. Her dream is to buy a taxi. Gertrude needs the loan facility to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Rechel

texts.en:
Rechel is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Rechel has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Rechel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rechel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Antonieto

texts.en:
Antonieto is 54 years old and lives in Conat Aloran, Misamis Occidental.  He is married with children.  Antonieto has a fish vending (selling) business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase more fish for fish vending. 
Antonieto has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Antonieto hopes to have a fishing boat. Antonieto is a MIGS member of PMPC. Antonieto is a hard working father and has a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for his fish vending business.

loans.name: Fanni Rosa

texts.es: El socio Fanni está solicitando otro préstamo para comprar mercadería pues se está acercando campaña navideña entonces desea comprar ropa como por ejemplo chompas y peluches. El anterior crédito a la socia Fanni le ayudo a pagar deudas que le había generado la anterior campaña navideña, ella se encuentra muy tranquila y feliz pues el banco comunal tiene confianza en ella y pudo acceder nuevamente al micro crédito. La socia Fanni está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en: Fanni is requesting another loan to buy merchandise as the Christmas season is getting close and she wants to buy clothing such as sweaters, and stuffed animals.  Fanni used her previous loan to pay off the debt she generated the previous Christmas season.  She is very content and happy because her communal bank has confidence in her and she was able to access another micro loan.  Fanni is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: purchase merchandise such as sweaters and stuffed animals for the holiday season.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
La señora Felicita tiene 42 años de edad, es casada.

Ella se dedica a prestar sus servicios con un molino, que muele maíz y chicharrón para las pupusas. Antes se dedicaba a elaborar y vender tortillas.

Felicita solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para reparar la estructura que soporta el molino, ya que la base esta podrida.

Esto le permitirá tener en buen estado su herramienta de trabajo, y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y recibir ingresos. A ella le gustaría hacerle mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Felicita is 42 years old and is married.

She has a business providing services with her mill, which grinds corn and pork for pupusas (a traditional Salvadoran dish.)  Prior to this  business, she used to make and sell tortillas.

Felicita requests a loan from Fundación Campo to repair the structure that supports her mill, since the base has rotted.

This will allow her to have her work tool in good condition, so that she can provide better service to her customers and receive income.  Felicita would like to make some improvements to her house.

loans.use: to repair the structure that supports her mill

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 61 years old married to Lepapa, and they are blessed with four children. She runs a school in the area of Olekaitioriori, Kajiando, and most of her children come from the locality. She has been in this business for the past two years and earns an income of KES 10,000 per month.


Alice was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET staff member. She has good credit history in KADET and she is applying for her second loan of KES  50,000 from KADET LTD. She plans to use KES 30,000 to construct a classroom and KES 20,000 to purchase desks. She will use the extra profits to start a secondary school.

Alice hopes to start a high school and even a college. She is very visionary and hardworking.

loans.use: to construct a classroom and purchase desks.

loans.name: Delina

texts.es:
La Sra. Delina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amor y Paz”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba y Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, de 35 años de edad, tiene 04 hijos, los tres varoncitos tienen 16, 12 y 5 años de edad y la mujercita de 10 años, estudiantes de nivel primario y secundario.
Empezó con un capital de S/.500.00 nuevos soles, vendiendo bebidas alcohólicas, posteriormente deja la venta de éstas bebidas para  dedicarse a la venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad ya que sus hijos van creciendo y también sus necesidades; también se dedica a la venta de chupetes, gelatinas, flan, mazamorras y en las noches a la venta de anticuchos, juanes refrescos, de esta manera ayuda a su esposo que trabaja motocarreando. Se encuentra muy satisfecha con el ingreso que le genera sus ventas. Actualmente cuenta con clientes fijos, moradores de la zona y familiares, gracias al trato y amabilidad que les brinda.Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00,  piensa comprar productos que tienen más salida paraimplementarsu negocio como golosinas, bebidas gaseosas, sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, cajas de leche, aceites en litros, carnes, verduras y otros y mantener satisfechos a sus clientes actuales.Delina, es una mujer luchadora ytrabajadora,  su sueño es que su negocio este surtido de productos, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindar la oportunidad a mujeres como ella y así poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Delina belongs to the “Amor y Paz” (Love & Peace) communal bank in Moyobamba District, Moyobamba Province and San Martín Department.  She’s 35 years old, has a spouse and four children, three boys who are 16, 12 and 5 years old and a little girl who is 10 years old; they all go to elementary and secondary school.

She started out with a capital of 500 new soles selling alcoholic beverages.  Later on she stopped those beverage sales and went into grocery and staple merchandise sales because her children are growing and so are their needs.  She also sells lollipops, gelatin treats, flan, mazamorras [type of sweet corn pudding] and at night she sells anticuchos [grilled, skewered meat], juanes [seasoned rice wrapped in a green bijao leaf. Seasoning typically includes turmeric and cumin, giving the rice a warm flavor and a yellowish color. Most juanes also contain a small piece of chicken, a slice of egg and an olive or two], soft-drinks.  In this way she helps her husband who works as a driver.  She is very satisfied with income from her sales.  At present, she has regular customers, area residents or family members, thanks to the good service she provides.

With this 1000 sol loan she plans to buy products that are her best sellers like snacks, soft-drinks, sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, boxes of milk, liters of oil, meats, vegetables and others to keep her customers satisfied.

Delina is a very hardworking, tenacious woman.  Her dream is that her store is well-stocked with items and she’s very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for providing women like her with the opportunity to make their dreams a reality.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Felix Matias

texts.es:
Felix de 68 años, hace 30 años aproximadamente compro un triciclo y frutas y comenzó a vender, ahora también elabora jugos para la venta, y gracias a Dios le ha ido muy bien.

Realiza su trabajo solo, sale a recorrer las calles de lunes a sábados desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. Su dificultad es la demora de los pagos cuando deja fiado sus frutas, y otra dificultad que tiene es su edad. Esta separado desde hace mucho tiempo atrás. Y todos sus hijos son mayores de edad.

Tiene mcuhas aspiraciones por eso quiere comprar con el prestamo frutas para incrementar su capital. 
Su meta es poder mantenerse activo hasta cuando Dios le permita.
texts.en:
68-year-old Felix bought a tricycle cart and began selling fruit about thirty years ago. Now he also makes juice to sell, and thanks to God it has gone very well. 

He does his job alone, going up and down the streets Monday through Sunday from 9 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon. One difficulty he faces is the delay in payment when he sells his fruit on credit, and another is his age. He got separated a while back, and all his children are grown. 

He has many aspirations, and because of this he wants to increase his capital by buying fruit with the loan. 

His goal is to be able to keep himself active as long as God is willing.

loans.use: to buy oranges and seasonal fruits.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, El préstamo lo utilizara para fortalecer mas su negocio y comprar mercadería: faldas, pantalones, camisas los productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite de esa forma podrá surtir mas su negocio y obtener más ingresos.
El sueño de teresa es establecer un mini súper y ofrecer variedad y de esa forma poder darles lo necesario a su familia.
texts.en: This loan will help Theresa to build her business and buy merchandise such as skirts, pants, blouses and other necessary items such as rice, beans, sugar and oil. In this way she will be able to provide a greater variety of products and earn a larger income. Theresa’s dream is to of establish a mini-market, where she will sell a variety of goods. In this way she will be able to provide her family with basic necessities.

loans.use: to buy skirts, pants, blouses and basic need products.

loans.name: Esmilce

texts.es:
La Señora Esmilce es de la ciudad de Villarrica, tiene 28 años de edad, está casada con el Sr Mario, viven en casa propia con sus 2 hijos.
Nos comenta que tiene un local de venta de carne dentro del Mercado Municipal Numero 2 de la ciudad de Villarrica. Su marido es el que compra los animales vacunos para la faena y la posterior venta. Gracias al arduo trabajo que hacen los dos, pueden mantener la casa y a los hijos. El deseo de Esmilce y Mario es siempre luchar por un futuro mejor, y de esa forma ayudar a sus hijos.
Esmilce acude a la fundación y kiva para la compra de animales vacunos para después poder faenarlos. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que le da.
texts.en:
Esmilce is from the city of Villarrica.  She is 28 years old, and she is married to Mario.  They live in their own house with their two children.

She tells us that she has a place where she sells meat at the Mercado Municipal Numero 2 in the city of Villarrica.  Her husband is the one who buys the sheep to slaughter and later sell.  Thanks to the arduous work the two of them do they are able to support their household and their children.

Esmilce’s and Mario’s wish is to always strive for a better future, which will help their children.  Esmilce turns to the Fundación and Kiva in order to buy the animals and to later be able to slaughter them.  She is grateful to the Funación for the opportunity it is giving her.

loans.use: to buy sheep to slaughter.

loans.name: Chamkim Shg Group

texts.en:
Thenkholhing is 39 years old married woman and a mother to 4 children (2 sons and 2 daughters) who are still pursuing their studies. She is the representative of the group CHAMKIM SHG and also the featured borrower with her hand raise in the picture. Her husband is engage in cultivation and they reside in Saikul Hill Town.
Thenkholhing is a hardworking woman and engage herself inn running a shop. She has taken loan from WSDS and with the loan she manages to run a shop. But the income she gets was not sufficient to meet the daily needs of the family and also for paying her children school since she was unable to keep more items in her shop.
Thenkholhing applies for the loan so that she could buy more items for changing her shop into a grocery store so that she could make more profit to pay for her children educational fees and also to meet the daily requirements of her family.  She expresses her heartfelt gratitude towards WSDS and the funders for their great work and is looking forward for the loan.
Likewise the rest of the members are engage in other activities like selling clothes, small business and weaving and are eagerly waiting for the loan to start their respective income generating activities.

loans.use: to buy stock of items like toothpaste, sugar, detergent and other necessary items for changing her petty shop into a grocery store.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.en:
Mr. A. Kodjo is a dynamic young man born in Gapé in 1983. He has launched a business selling spare parts along the roadside. He restocks each week in Tsévié. Little by little, his clientele has grown, and he can now no longer finance his business to meet demand. In general, this is a very promising business for him. This is why he is seeking a loan of $1200 to meet the growing demand of his customers. This will allow him to build a consistent supply of parts and to avoid making trips to Tsévié each week.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Kodjo est un jeune actif et dynamique né en 1983 à Gapé. Pour se prendre en charge, il se lance dans la vente des pièces détachées au bord de la route. Il s’approvisionne toutes les semaines à Tsévié. Petit à petit, il arrive à avoir plus de clientèle qu’il n’arrive pas à satisfaire par manque de moyens financiers. D’une manière générale, cette activité est très prometteuse pour lui. C’est pourquoi, il sollicite un crédit de $1200 pour pouvoir répondre à la demande de plus en plus croissante de sa clientèle. Cela servira à constituer un stock consistant de pièces et l’évitera le trajet Gapé Tsévié qu’il fait toutes les semaines.

loans.use: purchase a resale of spare parts

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.en:
My name is Maria S. and I sell new clothing for men and women such as dresses, blouses, shirts, dress-shirts, underwear, bras, and socks. I have had my business for 3 years and I have a good clientel because they know I sell my products for a reasonable price. My goal is to increase my stock and to have higher sales and with the additional earnings I can help feed my family and to give a good education to my children who are ready to begin high school.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Maria S. me dedico a la venta de ropa nueva para dama y caballero como ser vestidos, blusas, camisetas, camisas de vestir, blumers, sostenes, calzoncillos, tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que vendo a un precio accesible para mi comunidad, mi meta es incrementar mis inventarios y tener mayores ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia y darles un buen estudio a mis hijos que estan por ingresar al colegio.

loans.use: To purchase dress clothing and underwear for men and women.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Mrs. Sim S. is a 38 year old widow living in Phnom Penh with her 2 children and her parents.  Mrs. Sim sells fried banana cake, and also grows crops on her small plantation.  This loan will be used to buy a water pump for her plantation.  The pump will help her to grow more crops, and also for her to get more from her existing crops.  In the future, she would like to build a concrete house for her family.

loans.use: To buy a water pump for her small plantation

loans.name: Narziboy

texts.en:
Narziboy works on a collective farm. As he has not been able to find a good job, Narziboy has to stay on the collective farm where the work is very hard and agricultural workers are paid very little. He is 32, married, and has a child.

Every day Narziboy goes to work early in the morning and comes back home late in the evening. Every year in July and August, the season of drying apricots comes. Narziboy and his family also dry apricots; it is the main source of income for the family.

The process of drying apricots consists in the following steps. Narziboy first buys apricots. At home he washes them, processes them with sulphur to maintain their color, and spreads them out under the sun for two days. Then all the apricots are separated from their pits (you can see this process in the picture) and spread out in the sun again.

After several days, the dried apricots are collected, put into bags, and stored till the moment when they can bring in a high price. The difference between the price he pays for the fresh apricots and what he receives for the dried apricots is Narziboy’s profit.

Narziboy already got one loan from MicroInvest to buy apricots. That loan helped him to buy more apricots and make more profit. Now Narziboy is requesting a loan of $500 to be repaid over a period of 8 months, so that he can further expand his micro-business.

loans.use: to expand his activities

loans.name: Goddey

texts.en: Goddey O. is 32 years old, and is married with 2 children. He sells baby things in his shop. This business is a source of income for the family. Goddey lives in Uromi, Edo State, and has been in business since 2003 and a member of LAPO for 4 years. Goddey hopes to receive a loan of US$550 so that he can buy more baby things for resale, improve his turnover, and thus his profits.

loans.use: To buy more baby things for sale

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia needed her own income in order to pay for the studies and expenses of her house, as she didn’t have work and the father of her children had abandoned them without giving any explanation. However, thanks to the strength her children give her, she started a business and two years ago she began to sell exercise books and pens in the entrance of a primary school and found someone who lent her money in order to establish her business. But this didn’t work out well, as the person who lent the money charged very high interest rates, and all that she earned selling products she had to repay to this person.

As a result, Claudia is asking for a credit of US $925 to be repaid in a six month period. This money will be used to expand the business and stock merchandise which you already find near a primary school and people are beginning to arrive to buy things. With your help Claudia will be able to provide the basic necessities of life to her sons, so they can survive without the need of their irresponsible father.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Claudia necesitaba de un ingreso propio para poder costear los estudios y los gastos de la casa ya que no tenia trabajo y el papa de sus hijos los abandonó sin dar una explicación. Sin embargo la fuerza que le dan sus hijos, la hizo comenzar un negocio y fue hace 2 años que empezó vendiendo sólo cuadernos y lápices en la entrada de una primaria y consiguió quién le prestara para poner su negocio pero no le fue bien con la persona que le prestó porque le cobraba intereses muy altos, y lo que ganaba vendiendo sus productos se le iban en pagarle a la persona.

Por eso Claudia está solicitando un crédito de US $925 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y este dinero le servirá para ampliar su negocio y surtir de mercancía ya que se encuentra cerca de una primaria y la gente comienza a llegar para comprarle cosas, Con tu ayuda Claudia podrá brindarles una vida con lo elemental para sobrevivir a sus hijos sin la necesidad de su padre irresponsible.

loans.use: Expand business and merchandise stock.

loans.name: Argentina 1 Group

texts.es:
Maria Magdalena is 24 years old. She has a general store in her home, with which she supports her parents with their living expenses. Each of the women in the group will use the loan to stock their respective business by buying merchandise wholesale to increase their sales and profit.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

MARIA MAGDALENA TIENE 24 AÑOS, TIENE INSTALADO EN SU CASA UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES CON LA CUAL APOYA A SUS PADRES CON EL GASTO FAMILIAR. AMBAS SURTIRAN SUS NEGOCIOS CON LA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA AL POR MAYOR PARA AUMENTAR LAS VENTAS Y LAS GANANCIAS.

loans.use: Investing in buying merchandise wholesale (INVETIR EN LA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA AL POR MAYOR)

loans.name: Irene

texts.pt:
Irene lives with the father of her 4 children. Their ages are 23, 21, 18 and 16. She lives in the village of Manjacaze, located in the district of the same name. She owns a tailoring business that offers services through special orders. She joined the credit program in 2004 as a group member but that group was dismantled and she decided to stay in the program solely. Her business has shown signs of growth: when she first started, she only had one sewing machine to work with. Now she has added a second machine and she has hired an assistant. With the loan amount, she will purchase a third machine and add a second helper to her staff because demand is expected to rise significantly once the school year starts and parents will be looking to purchase uniforms for their children. All of Irene's children are in secondary school and her dream is to be able to afford a college education for them. To accomplish this dream, which is also the whole family's dream, she will have to double her efforts. Irene's husband does not have a regular job, he makes his living by doing informal work and that is how he helps with the family's expenses. That is why she has to work extra hard so that her family does not lack anything. Irene travels once a month to purchase material in Maputo. She can get them there relatively cheaper than in Manjacaze, where she lives and does her work. She spends 340,00 Mt to travel back and forth from Maputo.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Irene e mdosta, solteira mas vive com um homem com quem tem 4 filhos de 23, 21, 18 e 16 anos de idade. Irene vive na vila de Manjacaze. Sede do distrito com o mesmo nome. Ela e proprietaria de uma alfaitaria, onde confecciona a roupa que vende sob encomenda. Ela entrou para o Programa de credito em 2004 como membro de um grupo. Mas o grupo com o tempo disfez-se e ela porque nao queria abandonar o programa optou por tomar o emprestimo individualmente. O negocio da Irene esta a desenvolver-se. Ela que quando comecou so tinha uma unica maquina que ela prorpia usava, agora ela tem amis uma maquina e ate conseguiu contratar uma trabalhadora para lhe ajudar na costura. Ela vai comprar uma terceira maquina o que o fara com o valor do emprestimo a tomar. e ira contratar o segundo trabalhador, pois que a demamda e muito grande principlmente no inico do ano em que muitos pais encomendam uniformes escolares para os seus filhos. Quando e asssim ela nao tem bracos a medir. Os filhos de Irener estao todos a estudar no ensino secundario. |O sonho de Irene e que os filhos entrem para a Universidade. Para isso ela tera que redobrar o esforco para que os filhos realizem este sonho deles e que tambem e o sonho de toda a familia. O marido de Irene nao trabalha vive de pequenos expedientes para poder sustentar sua familia, por isso ela tem de trabalhar a redobrar para que a sua familia nao passe por privacoes. Irene viaja uma vez por mes para adquirir tecidos em maputo onde sao mais baratos relativamente aos precos praticados em Manjacaze, onde ela vive e exerce a sua actividade.Para viajar a Maputo ela paga 340,00 Mts numa viagem de ida e volta de Manjacaze Maputo e vice-versa.

loans.use: Irene wants to use the money to purchase an additional sewingg machine.

loans.name: Guldeste

texts.en: Guldeste E. and her husband own and operate a clothing store in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. She is 45 years old and has three children. Guldeste is currently looking for funding so that she and her husband can purchase the inventory they will need for the spring and summer seasons that are rapidly approaching.

loans.use: To purchase new inventory for the spring and summer months

loans.name: Marietha

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 47-year-old Marietha M.. She is married with 4 children, aged 13, 17, 21, and 22.

In 2002 Marietha established a food stall and charcoal business. Working 9 to 12 hours a day, 6 days a week, she earns about $175 per month from this business. Marietha has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan from SELFINA, and she now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of fruit, vegetables, and charcoal in bulk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $260. In the future, Marietha also plans to employ more staff, renovate her shop, and increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of charcoal, fruits, and vegetables

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline A. is 43 years old, married, and has 6 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigerian. Mrs. A. sells provisions, cooked food and drinks in her local community. She has been in this business for several years. She is requesting a loan of $1200 so she can buy more provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs. With this she hopes to better serve her customers. She thanks you in advance for your help.

loans.use: To buy provisions, foodstuffs and drinks

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Magdalene A. is married with five children. She is 44 years old and sells timber in her community. She has been in this business for five years. She hails from Edo state, Nigeria.

Magdalene needs a loan of $700 to buy more timber for sale. This will help to boost her income.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: El Progreso (The Progress) Group 4

texts.en:
Marcia is the proud mother of four children, ages 5, 15, 18 and 20. She owns a business raising and selling cows. Esperanza has given Marcia five loans already and she has successfully paid back all of them. She is a very hard worker and her business continues to do well. With this next loan, Marcia hopes to continue progressing. She dreams that she can provide a good education for her children. She wants them to go to college and become professionals so that their lives will be even better than hers.

Note: This is a group loan for 5 people. In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: To grow her business and support her four children

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es:
Mrs. Silvia has worked selling staple grains and cleaning products for the past four years from a room in her home. When she started the business her inventory was minimal, but with time the business grew and now she needs a larger space where she can store her products.

For this reason she is requesting a loan, in order to remodel a bedroom to make it larger for storage of her products. With the income from this business and support from her husband, who works as a bricklayer, she is able to educate her two children ages 8 and 19 years old. She hopes to be able to have steady work so she can finish educating them and they can become people who will be useful to society, and above all, responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Silvia se dedica desde hace 4 años a la venta de granos básicos y productos de limpieza, este pequeño negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. Cuando empezó sus cantidades de inventario eran mínimias pero con el tiempo ha ido creciendo el negocio, y se hace necesario un lugar más amplio donde tener sus productos.

Es por eso que solicita el préstamo para la remodelación de la sala de habitación para así darle más espacio al lugar donde tiene su mercadería. Con los ingresos de este negocio y con el apoyo de su esposo que se desempeña como albañil es como han podido darle educación a sus 2 hijos de 8 y 19 años, y esperan poder contar siempre con trabajo para terminar de educarlos y hacerlos personas útiles a la sociedad y sobre todo responsables.

loans.use: Remodel a room in her home to have more space for her business

loans.name: Dora Maribel

texts.es:
Mrs. Dora is 36 years old, studied until 3rd grade in primary school, is marries and mother of one daughter and one son. They live in the area of M. in the Camicachi Center, Llave district, El Collao province, and Puno region. She decided to participate in the Communal Bank of M., September 22, due to lack of capital to generate income for her family. Starting with a loan of $115, she invested in 3 black-faced sheep to fatten. Since then, she has increased her flock of sheep. She also decided to invest in the business of food sales such as: white soup and pot roast, selling dishes Fridays at the weekly Fair in Camicachi.

With this loan of $175, she will purchase 3 heads of black-faced sheep to fatten and sell. With this business she is generating, little by little, better economic income She will repay this loan within 4 months. She is appreciative to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for approving her for a loan. Now women have learned to work, generating income, and in this way can cover their costs and save money. Her dream is to build a stable to raise cattle, save well for retirement in town, and that her children graduate from college.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Dora tiene 36 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado de primaria, casada es madre de una hija y un hijo. Actualmente viven en la parcialidad de M. del Centro de Camicachi, del distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y región de Puno. Ella decidió pertenecer al Banco Comunal 22 de Setiembre de la parcialidad de M. por falta de capital para generar ingresos económicos para su familia. Iniciando con un préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles invirtió en la compra 3 ovejas cara negras para el engorde, ya que ese negocio incremento la tenencia de ganado de ovino. Paralelo a ello decidió invertir en el negocio de venta de comida como: Caldo blanco y asado a la olla vendiendo los días viernes en la feria semanal del Centro Poblado de Camicachi. Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles comprará 3 cabezas de ovino de cara negra para el engorde y venta. Con este negocio esta generando poco a poco mayores ingresos económicos. Dicho crédito lo cancelará durante cuatros meses. Ella está agradecida, a Movimiento Manuela Ramos por permitir a acceder a crédito, ya las mujeres han aprendido a trabajar generando ganancias y de esa manera garantizar sus gastos y incrementar su capital. Su sueño más grande es construir un establo para el engorde de ganado vacuno, sacar una pensión grande en el Centro Poblado y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase of 3 head of sheep.

loans.name: Nuhu

texts.en:
Nuhu M. sells bread that he bakes himself at Ramblers in Cape Coast. Nuhu is married and has one child. He received a senior high school education. His wife is a food seller.

Nuhu has been a baker since 2002. He is responsible for taking care of his family's financial needs. His loan will be used to buy flour, margarine, sugar, and other ingredients for baking. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to build a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy flour, margarine, sugar, and other ingredients for baking.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru: Пак Татьяна жительница района Джиликуль. Возраст 26 лет.Образование средне-техническое.По специальности парикмахер.Клиентка имеет салон по прокату  свадебных платьев. Занимается этим бизнесом 2 года.На кредит хочет купить свадебные платья.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Tatyana P. is 26 and lives in Jilikul district. Ms. P. finished cosmetology school, where she was trained as a hairstylist. She owns a shop where she rents wedding dresses to brides. Tatyana has been in business for two years. She is applying for credit to purchase more wedding dresses and plans to repay the loan within a year.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase wedding dresses

loans.name: Xuan Thi

texts.vi: Chị Đinh Thị Xuân năm nay 48 tuổi.Gia đình chị có ba con đều đã trưởng thành. Năm 2000 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Hiện tại ngoài chăn nuôi gia đình chị Xuân còn đầu tư mua thêm máy cày  để phục vụ nhu cầu của bà con địa phương. Hàng tháng ngoài thu nhập từ chăn nuôi và làm máy cày gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ lương của chồng nên thu nhập rất ổn định. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua dầu chạy máy cày và đầu tư cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Xuan Thi D. is a 48 year old woman. She has 3 children who have grown up. In 2000, she joined the TYM fund and borrowed money to invest in livestock. Her husband is still working and contributing to the family’s income. Besides, the family also have a plough driving business, which also brings in some money, stabilizing the family’s finance. She plans to make the next loan of 10,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to buy oil for the plough and invest more in livestock.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and business

loans.name: Shabana M.asghar Group

texts.en:
Shabana baji is a 35-year-old lady and resides in a city named Vehari in Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 25 years. Her husband's name is M. A., and he is a wholesaler. He buys fruit wholesale and sells it to different fruit shops. He has been in this business for the past 8 years.

Shabana baji is the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her sons are in 3rd standard. Her daughter is in kindergarten. Shabana baji has a clothes-sewing business. She charges US$ 2 per item stitched. She is applying for a loan to buy an electric sewing machine so that she will be able to sew more clothes and earn more profit.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Najma baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Mukhtaran baji wants a loan to buy wood to re-sell. Riffat baji wants a loan to buy wood for her furniture-making business. Zainab baji wants a loan to buy material (cloth and colored thread) for her decorative embroidery business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine for sewing clothes

loans.name: Clementina

texts.en:
Clementina is a member of the Sumaqcha Village Bank.  “Sumaqcha” means “Beautiful” in Quechua.  Clementina is 56 years old and married with six children.  

Clementina buys dry goods and ice cream in bulk, then travels to different regional markets to sell them.  At the markets, she buys hens, guinea pigs (a Peruvian delicacy) and grains, then resells them in markets and to restaurants around Ayacucho.  

Clementina needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy hens and guinea pigs.  Clementina’s dreams are to build her own home and for her children to finish their studies.
 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Clementita es socia del Banco Comunal Sumaqcha que significa Hermoso en quechua.   
Clementina es casada, tiene 56 años y 6 hijos, Clementina viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región, actividad que realiza todos los días, en donD. venD. abarrotes y helados que compra por mayor y D. las ferias compra gallinas, cuy, cereales que luego venD. en los mercados y restaurantes.
Clementina necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. gallinas y cuy.
Los sueños D. Clementina son construir su casa y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.

loans.use: Buy hens and guinea pigs

loans.name: Nor Mohammad Qaleen Baf Group

texts.en:
Nor Mohammad is the group leader of Nor Mohammad Qaleen baf group. There are four members in this group. All of them would like to make a group loan for their businesses.

Bazally and Raza jan want to take a loan out for their business of tailoring. They want to buy a new machine for their business. Arozo wants a loan for her business of carpet weaving. She wants to buy supplies of basic materials for her business. Khier Begom would like the loan for her "in house bakery"  as she wants to increase her stock. Together, they are requesting a loan of 40000 Afghani for the term of 8 months.

With this loan they can increase the size of their businesses and support their families,  making a better future for themselves and there families.

loans.use: to buy supplies of basic materials for her business

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla A. est âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle tient depuis 7 ans, une boutique de produits de beauté à Lomé la capitale togolaise. cette activité est très prospère du fait de la demande très élevée. Avec ce crédit, Abla souhaite augmenter la taille de son commerce en alimenter sa boutique de nouveaux produits afin de mieux satisfaire aux exigences de la clientèle.
texts.en:
Abla A. is 40 years old, married, and has three children. For seven years she has run a cosmetics shop in Lomé, which is the capital of Togo. This business is very prosperous due to the very high demand. With this loan, Abla hopes to increase the size of her business by purchasing new products for her shop so she can meet customer demand.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics for retail

loans.name: Umriniso

texts.en:
Umriniso M. is 37 years old. She is married with 4 children. Umriniso sells foodstuffs and detergents. She rents a place for selling which is located in one of the local markets. Umriniso has been running her own small business together with her husband (pictured) for 4 years. The income she derives allows her to provide for family expenses. Umriniso works very hard to give her dearest children a good education and to make them happy. Thus, today she requests $ 600 USD. Umriniso thanks everyone for support and promises to pay the loan in time.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. Its history also includes famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others.

The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And even today it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History

 Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing foodstuffs to increase the range of goods.

loans.name: Haitham

texts.en:
Haitham A. is a 30-year-old man who lives with his wife and two children and also cares for his mother. He has a poultry business where he raises birds and sells both birds and eggs. As he is responsible for covering the entire family's expenses, he works hard every day.

His poultry business is growing, as are his customers' demands. Haitham has a chance to increase his income by selling more but he lacks the capital to increase sales. He has therefore decided to request a loan of $1,000 to purchase more chickens to sell. Help Haitham improve his family's quality of life by contributing to the growth of his business. They thank you sincerely.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens to sell

loans.name: Sabr

texts.en: Sabr Z. is a 38 year old trader who rents a store where he has sold different kind of goods for the last five years. Sabr is married and has two children. He trying his best to meet all the needs of his children and provide them with an excellent education. Sabr applied for a US $1200 loan to increase the number of goods he sells.

loans.use: To increase store inventory

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn M. lives in Katipunan, Guipos, Zamboanga Del Sur.  She is 43 years old, married and has 3 children, all of whom are in school.  Her husband works at a public market as a ticket collector in Pagadian City.  Jocelyn has a sari-sari store as her source of income, which started with initial capital of PHP 3,000.  She wanted to expand her sari-sari store, so she applied for a loan of PHP 7,000 payable over 6 months from Paglaum Co-op.  The loan will be used to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store.  Her sari-sari store income helps with their daily expenses.  She plans to purchase farmland as another source of income for the family.

loans.use: additional stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Zulaiho

texts.ru:
Зулайхо- женщина, которая  кредитуется с 2005 года на поддержку бизнеса продажи домашней обуви. Зулайхо начинала свой бизнес с ассортимента  детской обуви, а на сегодняшний день у неё во много увеличился и изменился. За товаром она ездит сама Зулайхо в Истаравшан, на оптовый рынок. Её товар в основном Китайского производства, различные домашние тапочки и шлёпанцы.
Она клиент с хорошим моральным обликом, которую удовлетворяют все условия фонда.
texts.en:
Zulaiho has been receiving loans since 2005 to support her business selling indoor shoes. She began the business with children's shoes but since then it has expanded and changed in many ways. To buy the goods Zulaiho travels by herself to the wholesale market in Istaravshan. The slippers and slip-on shoes she sells are mostly produced in China. She is a client with a strong moral character, who fulfills all of the program's criteria.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Indoor shoe sales

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị is a 28-year-old female living in the town of Sóc Sơn.  She is married and has two young children.  To making a living, T. owns and operates a service-based business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general services to local community members.  T. has been engaged in this business for more than five years and earns approximately 5,500,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2001, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to invest in renovating her business.  T. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND (US$1,175), which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the eighth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en:
Nhung Thị Phạm was born in 1970. She lives with her husband and two children. Her husband is a construction worker. 

Her family has economic difficulties because she needs to raise two children and one goes to school. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. She wants to borrow 5,886,000 VND (or 345 USD) to start a small business.

loans.use: To start a small business.

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mon S. is a rural villager of 45 years old, who lives in Siem Reap Province. Here, she makes a living raising pigs in a pig stall located near her house on her land. She raises pigs in order to raise their offspring and for meat. Since the beginning of 2001 up to the present, she has raised pigs. She wants to help be responsible for the family’s daily food needs; her husband works in construction.

Mon S. faces difficulties with her traveling needs because she always pays a lot of money to a taxi driver when she and her family want to go anywhere. Therefore, she hopes to reduce the amount she spends on transportation by using her loan to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
la señora Ana Julia P. Z. tiene 28 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y esta casada con el señor Adolfo Enrique Barahona quien labora como guardia de seguridad en almacenes el compadre.
ella se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas desde hace 05 años, su negocio esta ubicado en el barrio san jose y ademas trabaja en una clinica por la noche ya que ella es tambien enfermera
 
Ana necesita el prestamo para comprar 12 cargas de maiz 800 de leña, carnes, huevos, repollo, tomate etc porque ella esta vendiendo golosinas los fines de semana, con esta actividad acaba de empezar y le esta llendo muy bien.
 
su sueño es tener un taller de tortillas bien acondicionado.
texts.en:
Ana Julia P. Z. is 28, and she has two children. She is married to Adolfo Enrique Barahona. He works as a security guard in a friend’s establishment. She makes and sells tortillas. She has been doing this for five years. Her business is located in the San José neighborhood. She also works as a nurse in a clinic in the evening. Ana needs a loan to buy 12 loads of corn, 800 of wood, meat, eggs, cabbage, and tomatoes. She sells sweets on the week ends. She just started this activity, and it is going very well. Her dream is to have a well equipped tortilla shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood, lime, corn flour, water, meat, eggs, cabbage, and tomatoes

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Cristina es socia del Banco Comunal “Diana de Gales”, en el distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y es madre de 2 hijos, Tiene estudios de educación superior completa (profesora).  Vive en el jr. Leoncio Prado.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para la compra de juguetes.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar  juguetería, y ropa para niños, además también se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza Unique.

Su deseo es poner  una tienda bien surtida en perfumes y juguetes.

A ella le gusta la unión y el apoyo y aprendieron mucho a ser solidarias.
texts.en:
Cristina is a member of the Community Bank "Diana de Gales" located in the district and province of Puno. She is 36 years old and she is married, with two children. She has trained to be a teacher. She lives in Jr. Leoncio Prado. She has been with the Manuela Ramos movement (Kiva Field Partner) for the past 3 years. Her first loan was in the amount of S/.300 nuevos soles which was used as capital funds to purchase toys. Currently she requires an additional loan in the amount of S/.2000 nuevos soles. The loan will be used to purchase toys, children's clothing, and to supply her other business selling Unique beauty products. Her dream is to set up a store with a variety of toys and perfumes. She enjoys attending the meetings and the support, as well as learning to be independent.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase toys and children's clothing.

loans.name: Dalisay

texts.en: Managing a general store is the primary activity of Dalisay I.. According to her, she wanted to buy additional stocks of merchandise so that she could minimize her expense in going to and from the market. She observes that her merchandises can be sold immediately that’s why she is asking additional capital amounting to PHP5, 000 for her to be able to purchase additional merchandise. Dalisay and Roberto are blessed with six children but three of them are already married. Her three children left are still single: Precy-25 years old, high school graduate; Cory-23 years old and Jonie-21 years old and he is also a high school graduate.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a 20-year-old entrepreneur. She is a married mother of three children, two of whom are in school. She buys and sells new clothes to her regular clients, mostly in the local community. She has applied for Kshs 20,000 to expand her business.

loans.use: Business expansion.

loans.name: Victor Enrique

texts.en:
Victor Enrique R. has been selling chicken and sausage in his meat shop, “La Chelita”, for 20 years. Victor’s shop is in the Ivan Montenegro Market in Managua. In the market his shop has walls, a metal door, a window, and a zinc roof. Before moving to the market, his shop was open air with a dirt floor.

Victor will use his loan to buy chicken to sell. The loans will help his business continue. Victor is married and has no children.

loans.use: To buy chicken

loans.name: Agnès

texts.fr: K. Agnès est née en 1984 à Katagon au Bénin. Agnès vit depuis dix ans à Takon Aïdjèdo, un quartier de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Mariée à ZANMENOU Barthélémy un vendeur d'essence frelaté, Agnès est mère de quatre enfants. Les enfants en âge d'être scolarisés le sont. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Agnès n'a jamais été à l'école et mène depuis huit ans déjà comme activité, la transformation d'huile de palme et la préparation d'akassa (aliment local fait à base d'amidon de maïs) à son domicile. Agnès s'approvisionne à Takon et au marché Ouando à Porto-Novo, et vend ses produits au marché Ouando. Agnès est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. Pour augmenter le volume de son activité afin de capitaliser d'économies, Agnès sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Agnès ambitionne plus tard acheter sa propre parcelle grâce aux bénéfices qu'elle tirerait de ses ventes.
texts.en:
Agnès Kodga was born in 1984 in Katagon in Benin. For the past ten years, Agnès has been living in Takon Aïdjèdo, a district of Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Married to Barthélémy Zanmenou, who sells gasoline, Agnès is the mother of four children. The children are of school age and attend school. The couple supports their family together. Agnès has never gone to school and has for the last eight years been in the business of transforming palm oil and preparing akassa (a local food made from corn starch) from home. Agnès stocks up in Takon and at the Ouando market in Porto-Novo and sells her products at the Ouando market. Agnès is a former client of Alidé and has already benefitted from two loans, which she has repaid. In order to increase her business in order to save, Agnès is seeking a third loan with Alidé. Agnès hope to be able to buy a plot of land in the future with the profits she will make from her sales.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy palm nuts and bags of corn

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
“Do your best and God will do the rest.” This is the principle of life for Rose. She knows that God will help her with her business only if she will do her part as a businesswoman. Rose is 45 years old and married to Rey R., who has been working abroad for 10 years. They have four children. Two of their children are college graduates working in Manila. The last two of her children are still studying in college. Their family lives harmoniously in Barangay San Roque, Enrile, Cagayan. 

Rose has been engaged in the poultry business for two years. She buys dozens of chicks from Tuguegarao City and sells them after 45 days. She is now asking for the support of Kiva lenders for the maintenance of her business. For this, she would like to borrow 7,000 Philippines pesos to purchase more chicks, medicine and a food supply for their growth.

loans.use: Maintenance for her poultry business

loans.name: Rider

texts.es:
Rider tiene 37 años, es padre de 4 hijos, vive con su pareja desde hace 16 años en la casa una de sus tías.
Desde hace 2 años se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en su propio motocarro. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce a muchas personas con quien comparte muy amenas conversaciones, además es muy importante para él brindar un trato amable a sus clientes. 
Pero lo difícil es que este tipo de transporte es muy común en su ciudad, por lo que cada día tiene que lidiar con la competencia, por tal motivo trata de usar su tiempo para otros negocios como apoyar a su esposa en la venta de ropa, de esta manera puede compensar las ganancias y sostener los gastos familiares.
Para el futuro, a Rider le gustaría tener una tienda de comestibles, pues es un negocio tranquilo y rentable.

Este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, él es parte de un banco comunal llamado “Futuro Mejor” y lo que le gusta de su grupo es que todos son responsables y muy unidos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará algunos repuestos para mandar a repara su motocarro y con lo que le reste invertirá en el negocio de su esposa, comprando más prendas para la venta.
texts.en:
Rider is 37 years old, the father of four children, and he has been living with his partner for 16 years in one of his aunts' houses. For two years, he has been making a living by transporting passengers on his own motorcar. What he likes about his work is that he is able to meet many people and to have pleasant conversations. It is also very important to him that he treats his clients well. His biggest challenge is that this kind of work is very common in his city, so everyday he has to compete with others. For this reason, he is trying to dedicate his time to other businesses, like helping his wife sell clothes. This way, he can earn a profit and keep up with the family expenses. In the future, Rider would like to have a general store, because it would be a profitable and peaceful business. This is his second loan with MFP, he is part of the communal bank, “Futuro Mejor” and he likes that the members of his group are responsible and united. With the money he is now soliciting, he will buy a few replacement parts to get his motorcar fixed, and he will invest the rest in his wife's business, buying more clothes to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of replacement parts for his motorcar

loans.name: Kitoola Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
N. Ritah is 24 years old and is the leader of her group. She is a caterer in Kitoola. Before joining the catering business, she was a farmer and now farms on a small scale. She has offered catering services for a year now and she is grateful for her loans that have enabled her start this business. 

Ritah is married with three children aged 8 to 2 years and she also takes care of her parents. She would like to build a residential house for her children so that they can enjoy more comfort.

Ritah needs a loan to help buy more baking flour, sugar, yeast, and other items for her business. In future, she would also like to have a boutique which will bring in more income.

loans.use: To buy baking flour, sugar, yeast and other items for her business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther S. is married and has four children. Her husband is a seaman who goes to sea fishing. Esther has received senior high education.

Esther sells different kinds of clothes and bags of water and has been selling them for some time now. She sells them at Kotokoraba market in Abura, Cape Coast. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Esther’s loan will be used to buy more clothes for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Roeung

texts.en:
Mr. Roeung Y. is 64 years old and lives with his wife, Mrs. Thon Hai, in Chambak Trab village in Kandal province. He is shown with his wife in the photo. The couple has four children, two of whom are laborers in a garment factory while the other two are construction workers.

Mr. Roeung Y. and his wife are farmers who own a plot of land on which they cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation they earn less income than needed to support their family. Thus, Mr. Roeung Y. decided to apply for a second loan to buy a cow to use to plow his field to improve his rice yield. He hopes to increase his income and improve his family living with this loan.

loans.use: To buy a cow for plowing his field

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Курбоназаров Дилшод проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 36 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Растениеводством занимается более 10 лет. Работает на арендованном учаске земли. Курбоназаров Дилшод обрабатывает почву для посева. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Dilshod K. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 36 years old, married and has 6 children. He has been involved in agriculture for over 10 years. He works on a leased piece of land. Dilshod treats the ground to prepare it for the planting. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Penda

texts.fr:
Madame Penda F. fait du commerce des pagnes et des perles pour les femmes. Elle a atterri dans ce secteur par l’influence de ses parents qui faisaient le commerce. Membre d’U-IMCEC depuis 2 ans, Madame F. est à sa troisième demande de crédit pour mieux développer son activité. Cependant, elle demande un financement de 150 000 FCFA pour l’achat de pagnes et de perles qu’elle entend commercialiser dans les marchés hebdomadaires.  
Célibataire sans enfant s, Madame F. âgée de 38 ans s’investit dans la vente pour mieux subvenir à ses besoins et de trouver une certaine indépendance.
texts.en:
Ms. Penda F. does commerce in pagnes (colorful West African cloth) and in pearls for women.  She settled upon this sector due to the influence of her parents, who used to work in commerce.  A member of U-IMCEC for two years, she is on her third loan request for developing her business further.  However, she is asking for financing in the amount of 150,000 francs CFA to buy pagnes and some pearls, which she intends to sell at the weekly markets.  Ms. F., aged 38, is single with no children.  She invests herself in selling in order do better in providing for her needs and to achieve some independence.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cloth and pearls

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock and sell cereals

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van T. is 28 years old and is a resident of Siem Reap province. She was married but divorced her husband when her child was very young.

To operate her business, Van T. always wakes every day early in the morning to go to where there are many crops grown in order to buy vegetable from the farmers. She hurries to bring the vegetables to sell retail at the market and starts selling at 7:00 a.m., finishing at 5:00 p.m. She is able to generate at least $4 each day.

Up until now, Van T. needed to pay lot of money to hire a motor taxi to deliver her vegetable to the market. Now, she hopes to reduce this fee by asking for a loan from Kiva to buy a new motorcycle. With any remaining cash from the loan she will add to her business capital.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle to transport her vegetables

loans.name: Rukhsana Tufail's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana Tufail lives in a city named Borewala, Pakistan. She operates a sewing clothes business to meet the financial expenses of her family. Her business gives her earning approximately Pak Rs. 6,000 every month. 
Her husband name is M. W. who sells cosmetics on different shops in the market. He purchases cosmetics from city named Lahore because of its cheap rates and good quality items. Now he wants to diversify his business by selling some more items such as (hair dryer, hair colors etc) so that he reaches on more customers and generates good profit on it.

loans.use: To purchase more items for cosmetics selling business

loans.name: Nasir Wafa Group

texts.en:
Nasir Ahmad is the son of M. S. and the leader of Nasir Wafa group. He is married with 4 children and lives with his own family. He has a car wash shop and has been involved in this business for a long time. He got the first-cycle loan, used it for his business and has been advancing his business. Now he plans to enlarge his business and wants to take out his second-cycle loan.

Therefore, he has requested a loan to enlarge his shop, change its design, and complete his stock . He would love to be a good business dealer in the future.

loans.use: He wants to enlarge his shop

loans.name: Josette

texts.en:
36-year-old Josette S. is taking life the way she and her family can enjoy despite being poor in many respects. She and her husband are both hardworking and struggling to improve their lives and make their five sweet and loving children happy.  Jonel, their eldest son, is 15 years of age and is presently studying in a secondary education. He strives hard to perform well in his studies to compensate for his parent’s hard work. The rest of her children are young. (They range from three to seven years old.) To support their basic, everyday needs and to sustain the education of Jonel, Josette decided to put up her own small business, hog fattening. Profit from her hogs, which are sold after three to four months of raising, is used to purchase better kinds of food and other necessary things for her family to enjoy. Josette realized that her hog fattening business earns fairly well. Therefore she wants to raise more hogs and to sell them to the market either alive or slaughtered in a larger volume to increase her revenue. In this case, she is requesting a bigger loan through ASHI. 

Josette and her husband are excited to see her business grow and become stable. They are whimsical about having a better kind of life for their children through the success of their business.

loans.use: To purchase more hogs for fattening and selling business.

loans.name: Caleb Otieno

texts.en:
Caleb Otieno B. is a businessman who sells clothes in Migori, Kenya. It's a business he started in 2007, after having a Matatu (taxi) business, to help him generate income to support his family. With the nature of his business, Caleb travels to Nairobi every two weeks to buy his inventory. 

He wishes to expand his business to start selling clothes on wholesale, and it is for this reason that he is applying for a loan worth Ksh. 25,000 to increase his stock of clothing.

He is 30 years old, a husband and the father of three children.

loans.use: Increase inventory of clothing for sale

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 60-year-old borrower from Lebanon. He has 25 years of experience as a butcher. He is married and has one son who is 23 years old. He is proud of the high quality of products he sells. He sells different varieties of meat and chicken. He believes that his honesty with customers has been important to his success. He notes that the competition in his locA. area has presented some challenges to his work.  His main customers are friends and neighbors.

He is requesting a loan of US$ 1500 from Kiva partner, A. Majmoua. He plans to purchase more cows with this loan. He hopes to continue to improve his work in the coming year. This will be his first loan from A. Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase more cows to slaughter

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya est composé de six femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 45 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le chef lieu de commune rurale: Cinzana Gare, dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage dans le village. 
Les membres du groupe font le commerce de riz, d’arachide, des boites de concentrées de tomates, des boissons locales (le Dolo à base de mil) et des pagnes wax. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, elles ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
 Madame Rokia S. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 5 sacs d’arachide en gousses.  Elle se ravitaille en arachide à la foire du village. Avant de revendre son arachide, elle les trie pour avoir les bonnes gousses et les grille dans une marmite avec le feu. Elle les emballe dans des plastiques pour les revendre en détail, au comptant ou à crédit à la foire du village, à domicile et en ambulant dans les villages environnants à une clientèle composée d’hommes, de femmes et d’enfants. 
A l’instar des autres femmes du groupe, Madame Rokia S. espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The group Danaya is composed of six married women mostly in monogamous families.  The women average 45 years of age and five children each.  They all live in the seat of the rural community of Cinzana Gare, in the Ségou region (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They know one another through ties of community, kinship, and marriage in the village.  The group members do commerce in rice, peanuts, cans of tomato paste, local beverages (Dodo, made from millet), and wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth). With the goal of increasing their working capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan cycle.  Ms. Rokia S. intends to use her loan for buying five sacks of peanut.  She stocks up on peanuts at the village fair.  Before selling her peanuts, Rokia sorts them to obtain the good ones and then roasts them in a pot over a fire.  She wraps them in plastic for retail sale.  Cash or credit is accepted at the village fair, at the house, and door-to-door in the surrounding villages.  Her customer base is composed of women, men, and children.  Just like the other women in the group, Rokia hopes to make an average monthly profit of 22,000 francs CFA that will be use to reinvest in business and to ensure her children's health care. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying peanuts

loans.name: Eloy

texts.es:
El socio Eloy, tiene 44 años, es conviviente, tiene tres hijos y vive en la comunidad de Rumichaca de la Ciudad de Urubamba.  Eloy es carpintero y se dedica a fabricar muebles de madera como por ejemplo sillas, camas, roperos, puertas y ventanas, el tiene un pequeño taller de carpintería en su domicilio. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y que participa en el banco comunal, el requiere el préstamo para comprar madera y materiales como por ejemplo cola de carpintero, laca, clavos, etc.   
     
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The associate, Eloy, is 44 years old. He lives in a shared home. He has three children and lives in the Rumichaca community of the City of Urubamba. Eloy is a carpenter and he is dedicated to making wood furniture such as chairs, beds, wardrobes, doors and windows. He has a small carpentry workshop in his residence. He has already been dedicated to the business for many years and he participates in the communal bank. He requires the loan to buy wood and material, such as wood glue, shellac, nails, etc. The associate is thankful for the opportunity offered by means of the loan and promises to comply with the payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood, wood glue, shellac, nails and other materials for his carpentry shop

loans.name: Tita

texts.en: Tita G. is from the village of Minlasag, Sibutad. She is 48 years old and is married with three adult children. Tita owns and operates a business raising and selling pigs in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Tita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Tita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will again be used as additional working capital for her business. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her hog-raising business

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa L. is from the village of Poblacion. She is 40 years old and is married with six adult children. Elsa owns and operates a business selling coconuts in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Elsa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 10th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao.
