It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia R. is currently in the business of selling dried fish, tomatoes and onions at the market and is requesting a loan to stock jerrycans of cooking oil to sell. Lucia is 38 years old and is married with a husband that is a peasant. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: Stock jerrycans of cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma L., from the village of General Balao, Solana, Cagayan, is 41 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma owns and operates a business venture raising pigs for breeding. Engaged in her business for over 10 years, she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Gemma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan from ASKI, she is now requesting a new loan, her second, of 5000 PHP to open another business. Gemma plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To open another business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace B. is a married woman who lives in  Brgy. Nabulao, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She operates a balut-making business as one of her main source of income. Her husband Bartolome, who is 45 years old is a farmer but also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 2 teenage children who are still going to school. 

Grace joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 9 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Grace has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15000 which she added to her own capital helped her increase her monthly profit to PHP 25000,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 10th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 19000, which she intends to use to buy more duck's eggs which she will incubate to balut, cook and sell in the community so that she could continue to save up for future improvement of business and to send children to school. Grace B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund Operations

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia K. is 28 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has four children. All of her children are currently in school. Sophia has had a salon business for seven years.         

To help expand her business, Sophia has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase cosmetic lotions. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sophia hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, Sophia hopes to expand her business and own a house.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetic lotions

loans.name: Mariposas De San Juan Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada  en la casa de la señora Lidia Francisca P. E. integrante del grupo  Mariposas de San Juan  que está ubicada en el Estado de México. Ella se dedica a la cría y venta de pollos, actividad que inicio hace 20 años. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocio, específicamente en la compra de pollos.Sus clientes dicen que el producto que ofrece la señora es bueno, además argumentan que la señora los trata con amabilidad y buen carácter, es por eso que eligen comprar con ella. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente bien ya que sabe que es un dinero que le va servir para seguir manteniendo y creciendo su negocio. Tiene 56 años, estudio hasta el primero de primaria y tuvo 9 hijos. Este crédito lo quiere para fortalecer aun más su negocio.El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes.
texts.en: This photo was taken in Lidia Francisca P. E.'s house.  Lidia is one of the members of the group Mariposas de San Juan [Butterflies of San Juan], which is located in Mexico.  Lidia has dedicated herself to raising and selling chickens for the past 20 years.  She is requesting this loan to invest in her business, specifically in purchasing chickens.  Her clients say that the product that she offers is good.  They also argue that Lidia treats them with kindness and has a good character, and it is for these reasons that they buy from her.  At the time of requesting the loan, Lidia feels good since she knows that the money will help her to continue growing her business.  She is 56 years old, studied until primary school and had 9 children.  She is requesting this loan so that she can further strengthen her business.  The group is comprised of 10 members.

loans.use: To buy and raise chickens

loans.name: Maria Nicolasa

texts.es:
Doña María vive con su esposo y una hija que es casada tiene 24 años D. edad, todos trabajan, ella por su parte se dedica a la preparación y venta D. tortillas, doña María tiene 44 años D. edad y resiD. en Concepción Batres departamento D. Usulután,  este negocio fue iniciativa propia trabaja junto a su hija, D. 9:00am a 1:00pm, ellas ya tienen bastantes clientes por lo que en este momento su prioridad es invertir en materia prima para poder producir más tortillas.
Actualmente no cuentan con fondos para la compra D. maíz, gas, leña cal y papel, por  lo que solicita un préstamo para realizar la inversión, con esta ayuda ella podrá contar con los suficientes materiales para dar abasto a la demanda generada por sus clientes.
El propósito D. doña María es manejar bien este préstamo, pagarlo puntualmente y seguir progresando para tener una mejor solvencia económica en un futuro.
texts.en:
Dona Maria lives with her husband and a 24-year-old daughter who is married. They all work: for her part she prepares and sells tortillas. Dona Maria is 44 years old and lives in the Usulutan department of Concepción Batres.

She started this business on her own initiative. She works with her daughter from 9:00 am to 1:00 pm. At this point they already have enough customers so that her priority is to invest in raw materials to produce more tortillas.

Currently they lack funding to buy corn, gas, wood, lime and paper. For this reason she is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of enough materials to meet customer demand.

Dona Maria's objective is to handle this loan well, pay on time and make progress in the direction of future financial solvency.

loans.use: Buy corn, gas, wood and paper

loans.name: Jardin De Sueños Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Jardin de Sueños. Está ubicado en el Estado de México.  El grupo está conformado por  12  integrantes.
La señora Felipa M. es integrante del grupo. Es comerciante y tiene en total 7 hijos: 3 mujeres y 4 varones.  Ella vende Ropa y tiene una Papelería  que inició hace 10 años con un poco de ropa la cual empezó a vender en abonos y fue el producto de una caja de ahorros  realizada con sus vecinas, pero a la señora Felipa le fue bien con sus ventas, fue organizando sus gastos una parte para invertir y la otra principalmente para su comida, y gracias a esa buena organización pudo hacer crecer un poco más su negocio y como era una mujer muy responsable sus vecinas la invitaron a formar parte de su grupo.  Para ella fue dificil salir adelante pues su esposo estaba enfermo, pero ella salió a trabajar dejandole a él el cuidado de los hijos. Actual mente la señora felipa cuenta con un puesto de ropa en los dias de tiaguis y una papelería en su comunidad. Solicita el prestamo para poder acrecentar más su papeleria y poner un negocio fijo de ropa , para continuar dandole estudios a sus demás hijos y en un futuro abrir más  locales de ropa y papelerías para emplear a personas que lo necesiten no importando si tiene alguna enfermedad.
texts.en:
This 12-person group is called Jardin de Sueños (Garden of Dreams) and is from Mexico state.

Señora Felipa M. is a member of the group. She is a merchant and has seven children, three girls and four boys. She sells clothing and also runs a stationery store. She started ten years ago with a small amount of clothing; her customers paid in installments. The business was funded through a neighbourhood savings bank. Sales were good, and Felipa invested part of her income in the business, and part for food. Thanks to her business skills and responsible attitude, she was able to expand the business, and her neighbours invited her to form part of their group.

It was difficult for Felipa to make progress as her husband was sick; however, she left her husband in the care of her children and went to work. Nowadays she has a stall selling clothing in Los Dias de Tiaguis and a stationery store in her community. 

She is seeking a loan so she can expand the stationery store and move her clothing business into a permanent location. She also wants to provide the rest of her children with a good education. In the future she would like to open other clothing and stationery businesses to provide employment to people who need it. Even illness will not deter her.

loans.use: to invest in her business

loans.name: Akuvi

texts.fr: Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle fait le commerce des œufs pour participer au foyer.  Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et revend au marché local de Kegue.  Elle cumule dans cette activité près de 4 ans. Elle espère accroitre son commerce grâce à ce nouveau crédit.
texts.en: She is married and the mother of two. She sells eggs in order to contribute to the household budget. She stocks up at the big market in Lomé and resells at the local market of Kegue. She has almost four years of experience in this business. She hopes to expand her business thanks to this new loan.

loans.use: Purchasing eggs

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
doña Olga Z. tiene 49 años de edad vive en namasigue Choluteca y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion.
Olga es una mujer emprendedora y muy dedicada a su negocio.
nos comento que su familia es lo mas importante para ella, es madre de 5 hijos.
junto con su esposo trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
todos los dias se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para alistar a sus hijos y luego para abrir su pulperia y atender a sus clientes.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria, desea tener bien surtido su negocio para la navidad.
texts.en: Olga Z. is 49 years old and lives in Coluteca. She makes a living selling popular products at a convenience store she runs out of her home. Olga is an enterprising woman who is very dedicated to her business. She tells us that her family is the most important thing to her. She is a mother of five children. She and her husband work very hard to make headway for their children. She gets up every day at 5 a.m. to tend to her children and then opens up her store and tends to her customers. She plans to use the loan to purchase grocery items. She wants to have a well-stocked store for Christmas.

loans.use: Purchase chickens, pork, beef, rice, beans, coffee, bread, cookies, lard, oil, butter, soup, toilet paper, toothpaste, candles, matches, condiments, soap, churros

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora S., age 33, is a farmer, planting and harvesting bananas and offering them for sale. Flora has three years of experience in this business. Flora needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve and expand her business. She and her husband have five children.

In 2008, Flora joined SPBD. This is her third loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Flora's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: The Servants Of Jesus Group

texts.es:
LOS SIERVOS D. JESUS

María pertenece al grupo D. Alcancía Comunal “LOS SIERVOS D. JESUS” recientemente esta llevando el cargo D. presidenta del grupo esta conformado por 8 personas que viven en la misma calle y D. esa manera se unieron par poder crear La Alcancía Comunal.
María tiene 30 años D. edad y es madre casada tiene un hijo María tiene ya 2 años trabajando vendiendo productos naturales y medicinales y trabajando a podido pagar algunas deudas que tenia y tanbien cuidarse en lo que es su salud.
Si María tuviera un prestamos lo invertiría en agrandar el pedido D. sus productos.
Su sueño D. María es poner un puesto D. venta D. jugos en el mercado D. su localidad y con la ayuda D. Edaprospo-Prosperidad esperamos que lo logre.
texts.en:
The Servants of Jesus

Maria is a member of the communal bank named "The Servants of Jesus" and she has recently taken over as the leader of the group. The group is maD. up of 8 individuals who live along the same street, which is how the group was formed to make up this communal bank. 

Maria is 30 years old; she is married and the mother of one. Maria has been selling natural and medicinal products for two years and working in this business has allowed her to pay off some debts that she hand. She has also been able to cover some personal health expenses. 

Maria will invest her loan by placing larger orders for her products.

Maria's dream is to set up a stand in the market to sell juices. With the help of Edaprospo - Prosperidad she hopes to accomplish her goal.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 35 years old, married and a mother of three.  She runs a retail shop in Kiambu.  She has been running the business for over five years.  She is now hoping to expand the business into a wholesale business in the future.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her finances.  She has requested 50,000 KES to buy maize flour, sodas and ropes.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, sodas and ropes.

loans.name: Tweyambe Women's Group-Jinja

texts.en:
36-year-old K. Oliver makes common cause with Tweyambe Women's Group-Jinja.  She has been at the helm of her business selling used clothing at the Jinja market for 8 years. To take root in this trade, she banked on savings from her agro produce sales business.

This happily married mother of 2 says running her business has been worthwhile in many ways. She points to the improving standards of living of her family as a case in point. She makes 180,000 shillings in profits weekly from her business.

K. Oliver requests this loan to purchase a new sewing machine that she plans to use to sew clothes herself, which she will sell at a higher price.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Ulviyye

texts.ru: Ulviyye ne zamujem i ne imeyet detey. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom, pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey materyu. Ulviyye A. rodilas v 1977 qodu. Ona vo vsem pomoqayet materi svoyey tak kak ona boleyet. Ulviyye seychas nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit noviy kompyuter dlya raboti. Ulviyye uje 9 let kak rabotayet laborantkoy, tak je ona zanimayetsya narodnoy medicinoy lecheniye pocientov raznimi poleznimi travami.
texts.en: Ulviyye is single and childless.  She is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with her mother.  Ulviyye A. was born in 1977.  She helps her ailing mother.  Ulviyye now needs 2300 AZN to buy a new computer for work.  Ulviyye has been working as a laboratory assistant for nine years now.  She also practices traditional medicine, treating patients with different beneficial herbs.

loans.use: buying a computer

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio L. is from the city of Gala Ozamiz City. He is 37 years old. Rogelio is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Rogelio  operates motor transport services. Rogelio has been engaged in his business for more than a year and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Rogelio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rogelio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from GDMPC. Rogelio is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Rogelio from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 57 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora. Vive en su casa propia, con sus hijas. Con quienes se esfuerzan por salir adelante. 

En este negocio,  Rosa trabaja algunos días de la semana, de la cual le pagan un sueldo. Pero, en su casa tiene su propio negocio, en la que sus hijas se dedican, mientras ella trabaja. Su negocio consiste en la venta de comidas rápidas, consistentes (en pollos y papas fritas) que los vende a media mañana a los alumnos del colegio aledaño a su casa. De esta manera, sola educó a sus hijas, de las que hoy se siente orgullosa. Los trabajos relacionado a la comida, le gusta mucho, por ello a pesar de llagar cansada de su trabajo, siempre termina ayudando a sus hijas porque no le resulta nada dificultoso hacerlas. Es por eso, que quiere tener su stock  de aceite, en  vista que los precios van subiendo. Sabe que trabajando arduamente con sus hijas,  está emprendedora mujer mas adelante logrará alquilar un puesto de comidas en algún mercado y, de ese modo captar mayores utilidades. 

Es su 26avo crédito que tiene con MFP, y se compromete pagar todas sus cuotas de manera puntual,  como lo venia haciendo durante este tiempo. Para así continuar juntas con las integrantes de su grupo.

Con el dinero del crédito comprará, sus bidones de aceites, y proveerse el resto de los insumos, para continuar realizando su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 57, is the mother in a very hardworking family. She lives in her own house with her daughters, and they make great efforts to get ahead.

Rosa works several days a week in another business for which she is paid a salary, but she also has her own business in her house which her daughters run while she works. Her business involves the sale of quick meals consisting of chicken and fried potatoes. She sells these at mid-morning to the students of a high school next to her house. In this way, she was able to provide an education to her daughters, something she feels proud of.

She likes the work of preparing meals a lot. That’s why, in spite of being tired from her job, she always finishes by helping her daughters because she doesn’t find it difficult to do so.

She wants to add to her stock of cooking oil in view of the fact that the prices are going to rise. This enterprising woman knows that, working hard with her daughters, she will, in the future, be able to rent a food stall in a market and in this way obtain greater profits.

This is her 26th loan with MFP and she promises to pay all her installments on time, just as she has always done, in order to stay with the members of her group. With the loan she will buy drums of cooking oil and provide herself with the rest of the materials she needs in order to continue running her business.

loans.use: to purchase drums of cooking oil and obtain other materials for her business.

loans.name: Claudia Milena

texts.es:
A sus 22 años y como madre soltera, Claudia Milena, de origen campesino y sin la oportunidad de estudiar o encontrar un trabajo que le permitiera sacar adelante a su hija de 3 años de edad, esta joven se vio en la necesidad de emprender su propio negocio, un criadero de cerdos que sus padres le permitieron tener al lado de su casa. 

Esta es la manera como Claudia se gana la vida, cubre sus gastos, los de su hija y aporta a los gastos de su familia. Su sueño es crecer con este negocio pues así considera que su hija tendrá más oportunidades para salir adelante. Actualmente necesita de un préstamo para comprar 12 cerdos y cuido de engorde y así aumentar sus ingresos e ir creciendo poco a poco en la medida de sus posibilidades.
texts.en:
At the age of 22 and as a single mother, Claudia Milena -- who is from the countryside and did not have the opportunity to study or find a job that would permit her to provide a better future for her 3-year-old daughter -- saw the need to start her own business: raising pigs in a stall that her parents allowed her to set up beside their house. 

This is the way in which Claudia earns a living and covers her expenses and those of her daughter; she also contributes to her family's expenses. Her dream is to expand this business, since she thinks it will help her give her daughter better opportunities to get ahead. Currently, she needs a loan to buy 12 pigs and supplies to fatten them up, so that she can increase her income and expand little by little to the extent of her ability.

loans.use: to buy pigs and supplies to fatten them up

loans.name: Mirna Patricia

texts.es: Mirna Patricia A.. ella se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles de primera nececidad, ella nos cuenta que lleva ya barios años de dedicarse a esta actividad, y que gracias a Dios le a ido bien porque a lobrado aumentar su ganacia ella nos cuenta que nececita mas capital para trabajar ya que tiene mucha demanda de sus clientes y quiere surtir mas su negocio para satisfacer la nececidad de sus clientes ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles de primera nececidad,como, jabon,azucar,arroz,frijol,aceite,etc. su sueño es agrandar mas su negocio y estar bien economicamente.
texts.en:
Mirna Patricia A. makes her living selling basic necessity products. She has been in this business for several years, and thanks to God the business has been going well, and she was able to increase her earnings. 

Mirna needs additional working capital because she has a lot of demand from her clients and would like to better supply her business to ensure she can satisfy their needs. Mirna is seeking a loan to purchase inventory items such as rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, soap and so on. Her dream is to grow her business and to do well economically.

loans.use: to purchase grocery store supplies

loans.name: Michel

texts.es:
la sra. Michel tiene 55 años de edad, vive en la colonia Bello Horizonte en el Triunfo Choluteca y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion.
doña Michel tiene 2 hijos los cuales ya estan casados y viven con sus familias, Michel vive solo con su esposo, se turnan para atender a los clientes.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia al por mayor para surtir su negocio.
sus tiempos libres lo dedica a visitar la iglesia.
texts.en:
Michel is 55 years old and lives in Bello Horizonte neighborhood, in El Triunfo, Choluteca.  She sells essential household products in her grocery store which is located in her home.

Michel has two children who are already married and live with their families.  Michel lives alone with her husband.  They take turns serving their customers in the store.  Michel will use her loan to buy merchandise wholesale with which she will stock her business.

In her spare time, Michel goes to church.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, sugar, butter, toilet paper, candles, matches, coffee, bread, juice, churros, salt and seasonings.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis de 38 años de edad, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (llamado así porque en su originalidad había muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil. Esta casado y tienen 2 niños una bebe 8 meses y un niño de 10 años que estudian en escuela fiscal. Se dedica la venta de churros(comida chatarra).

Desde que era niño le gustaba es actividad que inicio desde muy poso y luego se caso e invirtió en una carreta para sus ventas de churros. Se levanta desde muy temprano con su esposas haciendo la preparación de la masa y luego le manda a uno de sus ayudante a vender. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar materiales con quintales de harinas $700 e ingredientes para su preparación $100 y así aumentar sus ingresos. En un futuro desea adecuar su vivienda para darle lo mejor a a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luis, 38, lives on the outskirts of Guayaquil in a neighborhood called Orquideas (so called because of the many orchids that used to grow there).  He is married and has two children: a 10-year old son who is in elementary school and an 8-month old baby.  Luis operates a business making and selling churros (a pretzel-like snack).  

Luis started making churros for a living when he was a young man.  After he married, he bought a food cart to help him grow the business.  He and his wife get up very early to make the churros and have them ready for the street vendors who help with sales.  He will spend $700 of this loan to buy bulk supplies of flour and $100 to buy other supplies that he needs for his business.  For the future, he wants to make improvements to his house so that he can give his children a decent place to grow up.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his food sales business.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 29 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school. She owns a general store in which she sells different kinds of foodstuffs, such as beans and rice, together with other items. She has been doing this for five years and it is going  well.  The income she earns has enabled her meet her needs. Vestine is requesting a loan to buy rice and beans. With the profits she plans to save some of her earnings and continue feeding her children.

loans.use: To purchase rice and beans to sell.

loans.name: Asiya

texts.en:
Asiya lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has 4 children, none of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her grandchildren). Asiya lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

Asiya has a retail shop business. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Asiya sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.

Asiya has requested a loan in the amount of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more items for her shop, including bags of sugar, cartons of salt and boxes of soap. One of her main business challenges is transportation. Her business goal and aspiration is to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise like bags of sugar, cartons of salt and boxes of soap

loans.name: Pompeyo Esau

texts.es:
Pompeyo es soltero, tiene 23 años de edad, cursó los 9 años de educación primaria, se dedica a la atención de un auto hotel como receptor, y hasta el momento lleva 1 año de experiencia, actualmente vive son sus padre y recibe el apoyo de ellos.

Solicita un préstamo que le servirá para cubrir gastos personales, ya que quiere comprar una computadora que será para uso personal, ya que es muy importante para él contar con lo necesario para realizar sus tareas etc. Espera mejorar su condición de vida con este préstamo.
texts.en:
Pompeyo is single.  He is 23 years old and completed nine years at elementary school.  He works in a motel as a receptionist and has one year's experience.  He currently lives with his parents and receives support from them.

Pompeyo is requesting a loan to cover some personal expenses as he would like to buy a computer which would be for his own personal use.  It is very important for him to have what he needs to carry out his work, etc.  He hopes to improve his living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Covacine  Ide  Ju-Ju

texts.fr:
Femme âgée de 38ans, mariée avec deux enfants dont l’âge varie de 2ans à 18ans. Elle est dans ce commerce de vente de divers et des poissons salés depuis l'an 1993 avec un capital de 130.000frs. Ses recettes journalières  varient de 30.000 à 60.000frs. 

Ce prêt lui permettra d'améliorer la qualité de son activité en achetant 5 cartons de poissons salés soles, 3 cartons de poissons thons, 1 cartons morues et de la tomate fraiche.

Pour la croissance de son commerce, elle vend aux prix hors concurrence afin de mieux attirer la clientèle. 

Elle aimerait etre grossiste , effectuer des voyages afin d’importer le poisson sale du Portugal et de l'Espagne et avec ses benefices  s’acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
This lady is married, 38 years old and has 2 children aged 2 and 18. She has been selling various items and salted fish since 1993, with a capital of 130,000 CFA francs. Her daily revenue varies between 30,000 and 60,000 francs.

This loan will allow her to improve the quality of her business by buying 5 boxes of salted sole fish, 3 boxes of tuna, 1 box of cod and fresh tomatoes. To increase business, she sells at prices that cannot be beat in order to attract customers. She would like to be a wholesaler, to travel in order to buy salted fish from Spain and Portugal, and buy a piece of land with her profits.

loans.use: to buy 5 boxes of salted sole fish and 3 boxes of tuna fish.

loans.name: Nimol

texts.en:
Nimol (in the photo) is 48 years old, and her husband, Sothea, is 50 years old. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two sons.  

Nimol runs a grocery store at home, while her husband is a teacher and runs a business of a water utility service. 

Nimol is asking for a loan of $1,000 to fill in the land behind her house. Because the land behind her house floods during the rainy season, she needs to fill it in.

loans.use: To fill in the land behind her house.

loans.name: Serigne Bara Mbacke Group

texts.fr:
LE groupe de solidarité Serigne Bara est crée le 14 décembre 2008. Il regroupe 20 femmes. Les membres habitent le même quartier et entretiennent d'excellentes relations. Leurs activités principales est le petit commerce et l'embouche.

La présidente Mame Daro est âgée de 43 ans, mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle est vendeuse de poisson au marché central de poisson de la ville. Dés fois elle vend des habits.
Avec son Prêt elle veut acheter des marchandises. C'est son mari et elle qui gèrent la maison.  

Sur la photo elle est tout à fait à droite la main levée.
texts.en:
The Serigne Bara Mbacke solidarity group was created on December 14, 2008. It consists of 20 women from the same neighborhood. The relationship between them is very cordial. They mainly conduct small trade and cattle rearing.

Mrs Daro is 43 years old, married and the mother of six children. She sells fish at the main fish market in town. Sometimes she sells clothes. She will use her loan to buy goods for resale. She and her husband provide together for the household. Mrs Daro is standing on the far right-hand side of the photo and raising her hand.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is 45 years old and lives in West Point and is married and her husband is a Tailor. They have four children ages 12 to 22, all of whom are in school and live with their parents. For the past five years she has been operating a bar & restaurant where she sells drink and food. She has a lot of customers but she normally closes very late. Caroline is requesting a loan to purchase soda, rice and other food items for her business, and she hopes to improve her restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase soda, rice and other food items for her business

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 56 years old and lives in the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines.  She is widowed with five children. 

To earn a living, Juanita has a business selling a variety of vegetables and dry goods in the local market. Her children help her attend to customers' needs when they have no classes or work. She has been working in the noisy, crowded, and messy place of business for over 21 years, but has learned to love the market over the years.  She earns about PHP 8,800 each month.  Juanita has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 at GDMPC to purchase additional products for sale.

Juanita has been a member of GDMPC since 2009.  This is Juanita's sixth loan cycle at GDMPC.  She has repaid in full, all the previous loans.  In the future, Juanita would like to expand her business and improve it even more, to earn enough to meet the family's needs and wants.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a charcoal selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her charcoal business in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is a twenty-eight-year-old married woman with four children, and she rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling secondhand clothes for four years. She got capital to start the business from her husband's savings. Her hardship is high transport charges and her vision is owning a boutique and a plot with a good house.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Ofelia Maribel

texts.es:
Ofelia, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, esto se debe al deseo de seguir incrementando la mercadería en el negocio, este será utilizado en la compra de jugos, agua y frutas para la venta, con este tipo de inversiones su negocio crece cada vez que las realiza, permitiéndole mejorar su economía y tener disponible para pagar estas cuotas.
Su condición familiar ha mejorado, los miembros sigue siendo los mismos y con muchas ganas de superarse cada día más.
texts.en:
Ofelia has decided on a new loan because she wishes to continue increasing the merchandise in her business.  The loan will be used to buy juices, water, and fruit to sell.

With this type of investment her business will grow every time she invests in it.  This will allow her to improve financially and to have money available to make these payments.

Her family condition has improved.  The members continue being the same, and they have a great desire to improve themselves more each day.

loans.use: to buy juices, water, and fruit to sell.

loans.name: Kleber Joel

texts.es:
Kleber de 42 años, un hombre trabajador que tiene aspiraciones de crecimiento de negocio.
Su negocio es una panadería que está ubicada en la parte delantera de su vivienda,  esta actividad la realizo hace tres años, ya que por su sector no había este negocio él decidió ponerse uno.
Su actividad la realiza desde las 5:00am con la elaboración de su productos y cierra a las 21:00pm, el vive solo y lo administra solo su negocio.
El solicita el préstamo para la compra de bebidas, harina, levadura, esencias y para el incremento de su negocio.
Su sueño es agrandar su negocio y que poder construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Kleber, age 42, is a hardworking gentleman who has aspirations of growing his business. He operates a bakery in the front part of his home. Kleber has been in business for three years. He decided to establish this business because there was no other one that existed in the area.

Kleber begins making his products at 5am and he closes his business at 9pm. He lives alone and manages this business by himself. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy beverages, flour, yeast, and essences so that he can increase his business.

His dream is to expand his business and build a house.

loans.use: to buy beverages, flour, yeast, and essences.

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Lenie has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Lenie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lenie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Artesanas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ARTESANAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa donde la señora Maria es la tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: artesanía en yeso, comerciante de embutidos, tejido de polainas, producción de ladrillos, tejido de cama e hilado de vicuña, producción de calzados, venta de comida. 

La señora Maria indica que es la primera ves que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de una promotora que llego a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración de calzados que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su esposo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el crecimiento de su negocio (compra de cuero) que adquirirá de La Paz y posterior a la elaboración lo comercializa a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta salud y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
The “ARTESANAS” community association is in its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Villa Exaltación.  It’s made up of eight members and directed by a board where Maria serves as the treasure.  The members work in various businesses including sausage making, knitting, brickmaking, spinning thread, shoemaking, and food sales.

Maria says that this is her first time working with Pro Mujer and was invited by a promoter who went to her home.  She has a shoemaking business that she has been working for several years, having learned from her husband.

She will use the money from this loan to grow her business (buy leather in La Paz and make shoes on request).  This type of work allows her to generate income in order to support her family as much as possible.  She is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health and the training benefits.

loans.use: to buy leather.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica nació en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo pero vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 36 años de edad y es separada  pero tiene tres hijos. (Ederson de 17 años, Angy de 11 años, Jly de 4 años).  

Jessica desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo, ella se dedica a diferentes actividades como por ejemplo alquila maquinaria y también vende comida en su restaurante. Ya son cuatro años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Su sueño de  Jessica es que sus hijos se han profesionales.   

Jessica requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y otras cosas más.  
 
Jessica se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Jessica pertenece al banco comunal “Pinkulluna” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Jessica was born in the town of Ollantaytambo, and lives in the same town where she was born. She is 36, separated, and has three children. Ederson is 17, Angy is 11, and Jly is 4. 

Jessica carries out her daily activities, and has her livelihood in the town of Ollantaytambo. She does various activities such as renting machinery, and also serves meals in her restaurant. She has been working in this business for four years now, and it is going very well, thanks to the effort she puts into her work. 

Jessica's dream is for her children to become professionals. Jessica needs the loan to buy ingredients, such as sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, and other things. Jessica is thankful for the opportunity she has been provided through the loan, so she is committed to making her scheduled payments. 

Jessica belongs to the "Pinkulluna" communal bank, of the Associación Arariwa in the town of Ollantaytambo.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, and other things.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, él se dedica a sembrar granos básicos: frijoles y maíz,este oficio lo aprendió de su padre hace quince años y trabaja de lunes a domingo de 7:00 am a 3:00 pm.
El préstamo lo necesita para la recolección de la cosecha ya que tiene que pagar personas para que le ayuden y de esa forma poder venderla y dejar una parte para el consumo de su familia.
El objetivo de Juan es siempre tener mejores cosechas todos los años y seguir trabajando con la institución para que de esa forma poder darle lo necesario a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his wife and their two children. He is a farmer and he grows basic grains such as beans and maize. He learned this activity from his parents fifteen years ago, and he works Mondays to Sundays from 7 am to 3 pm.
The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for laborers that will help him harvesting his crops, a part of which will be sold while he will keep another part to for his family to consume.
Juan’s goals are to get better crops every year, and to keep on working with the institution to be able to provide his family with the basic necessities.

loans.use: To pay for laborer that will help him harvest his crops.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
El comité Primavera nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de un grupo de mujeres todas vecinas que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar. El grupo es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo, son 17 integrantes, ellas se fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal.
Delia es una de las miembros, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, nos dice que gracias a las ventas que hace puede darle a su familia todo lo necesario para una vida digna y decorosa, sin privaciones. Una de sus metas es tener una gran tienda donde pueda tener muchos productos a la venta. A la vez dice que se encuentra muy a gusto dentro del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de verano, con lo cual podrá tener más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que esta les da.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Primavera" was set up through the management and support of a group of women who are all neighbors and work in the same city.  The group is located in the city of San Lorenzo and comprised of 17 members.  The main goal they established was for each one to grow not only economically but also personally.

Delia is one of the members.  She sells all kinds of clothing and claims that because of her sales she is able to give her family everything they need to lead a decent lifestyle and not be deprived of anything.  One of her goals is to have a large shop with many products to sell.

She is very happy participating in the Foundation's women entrepreneur program.  The loan she is requesting is to buy summer clothing so she can offer her customers more variety.  She is grateful to the Foundation and Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Khatia

texts.en:
Khatia is 27 years old. She lives in the village Dirbi with her family: Her husband – Davit, her 7 year old son, and her parent-in-laws. Khatia and Davit earn a living through agricultural activities. They have a milk cow and sell on average 15 kg of cheese per month.  Also they have one hectare of land, where potatoes, strawberries, barley, haricot and maize are grown. Harvested products are sold locally. Khatia’s father in law owns a mini-bus. He works on the Dirbi – Gori line. The family's total average monthly income is 1200 Laris. 

Khatia requested credit to purchase potatoes to plant in her plot. Khatia hopes that after sowing high-quality potatoes, the family will get a good harvest, which will be sold for a convenient price and the family will get the income they planned for. Khatia plans to use the income to purchase necessary household goods and to improve the family member's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes for planting.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: El sr. Eduardo vive en la zona de la Villa 1ro. De mayo. Es la casa de sus suegros, vive  junto con su esposa y sus dos hijos pequeños, el sr. Eduardo se dedica a la crianza y  venta de animales, chanchos, patos, gallinas, vacas y chivas las cuales vende por la zona y en la localidad de el Torno, esta es su segunda secuencia, no tubo ningún problema con el pago de sus cuotas, el crédito lo esta solicitando es para la compra de animales para engordarlos ya que por las fiestas de fin de año hay mucha demanda de chancho y carne de vaca  ya que tiene muchos clientes  que le hicieron varios pedidos,  El sr. Eduardo  es una persona responsable, trabajadora ya que esta es su única fuente de ingresos para que el mantenga a su familia, por este motivo le hecha muchas ganas y esfuerzo a su trabajo.
texts.en:
Eduardo lives in Villa 1ro. de mayo at his in-laws’ house. He lives there with his wife and their two small children. Eduardo fattens and sells animals such as pigs, ducks, hens, cows and goats, which he sells around his community and in neighboring El Torno. 
This is Eduardo's second cycle. He did not have any problem repaying his first loan and is asking for this one in order to purchase animals to fatten, taking into account that the demand for pig and cow meat raises during the end of the year festivities. He has many clients that have already placed their orders. Eduardo is a responsible, hard working person because this is the only source of income to support his family. This is why he puts a lot of energy and effort to his work.

loans.use: to purchase animals for fattening

loans.name: Khanum

texts.en: Khanum is 37 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. He is a responsible mother of four children.her husband owns a butcher shop in the market. He has been running his butcher shop for the last eleven years. He buys calves, cows and goats and sells meat from his shop to the customers.His number of clients increases due to his good attitude towards his customers. Moreover, her husband is the sole earner of the family. So he wants to increase his income. In this way he would be able to meet his family requirements. He is a very honest shop keeper. He behaves politely to people. He wants to offer chicken also to his customers. Therefore he wants to buy broilers to sell over butcher shop to improve his standard of living. For the development of his business, his wife khanum applied for the loan. So he contacted BRAC Pakistan who issued him a loan for his butcher shop. Khanum is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: investing  in her husband's butcher shop.

loans.name: Kingbédé

texts.en:
Mrs. Kingbédé TOMEGA is a young woman of 25 years born in Vodougbé in he prefecture of les Lacs. Married to a municipal tax collector, she is the mother of two (02) children, with a sister in her care. Obliged to help her husband, whose small income cannot cover the family’s needs, she runs some small business activities such as the sale of loincloths and trade in primary need goods thanks to two successive loans of $250 and $400, obtained and repaid without incident.

Today, Mrs. T. has opened for herself a shop to sell loincloths and alocholic beverages in the grand market of Hédzranawoé. To stock her store with loincloths of superior quality, she is asking for a loan of $1200. Given the effort provided by this illiterate woman and especially by the rigourous management she has demonstrated in her business, there is no doubt that these new finances will also be well managed and repaid without any difficulty. This will give her a second wind on the economic front and will contribute enormously to the improvement of her living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame T. Kingbédé est une jeune femme de 25 ans née à Vodougbé dans la préfecture des Lacs. Mariée à un collecteur des taxes municipales, elle est mère de deux (02) enfants avec une sœur à charge. Obligée de venir en aide à son mari dont le salaire insignifiant n’arrive pas à couvrir les besoins de la famille, elle mena de petites activités commerciales telles que la vente des pagnes et le commerce de produits de première nécessité sur table grâce à deux crédits successifs de $200 et 450 obtenus et parfaitement remboursés.

Aujourd’hui, Madame T. a ouvert pour son propre compte une boutique de vente de pagne et de boissons liqueurs au grand marché de Hédzranawoé. Pour l’approvisionnement de sa boutique en pagnes de qualité supérieure, elle sollicite un crédit de $1200. Vu l’effort fourni par cette femme analphabète et surtout par la gestion rigoureuse dont elle fait preuve dans son commerce, il n’y a aucun doute que ce nouveau financement soit aussi bien géré et remboursé sans difficulté aucune. Ce qui lui redonnera son second souffle sur le plan économique et contribuera énormément à l’amélioration de ses conditions de vie.

loans.use: To buy and resell loincloths and alcoholic beverages

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Mrs Hoa is married to Hung. He was wounded during the war and cannot do any hard work. He only can earn money as a day laborer, and he finds work about 6 days per month. They have only a small hut and 2000 square meters for growing rice. They have two children of 9 and 5.

So much depends on Hoa selling fruits at the village market. She has already repaid 3 loans in full and this improved their income by $1.6/person/month. Hoa wants to borrow again for expanding her sales and to buy fertilizer for her paddy field.

loans.use: Buy fruit and fertilizer

loans.name: Ralah

texts.en: Ralah lives in district 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a widow and lives with her children and her mother. She is a tailor and she has good work experience. She wants to take a group loan to buy new sewing machines and also open a new shop with new tailoring designs. She hopes to have good relations with people and to make a good monthly income and help her mother and her children. She is very happy that, with this loan, she can support her family.

loans.use: To buy new sewing machines

loans.name: So

texts.en: Mr. So S. is a 63 year old teacher who earns $1/day.  He lives in Kampong Cham Province with his wife (pictured here) and their 7 children.  His wife is a farmer and earns $0.80/day, two of his children are hairdressers, one is a policeman, and the rest are students.  This loan will be used to purchase tools for the hairdressing shop.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his children's hairdressing shop

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca, 41, is married, without children.  Her husband owns a Moto Concho (motorbike taxi) and is working as a ‘taxi’ driver in the township.  She runs a small cafeteria that she started two years ago.  Spaghetti, fried fish, fruit juice, tostones (flattened fried plantains) are some of the things that can be found at her stand.  She opens the business early in the morning to attend to people that are going to work or going to school.  As a result of this activity, she has been able to help her husband face the housing problems.  However, since demand is growing, she is oftenin short supply.   She would like to be able to supply a larger amount of goods and sell more so that it will be easier for her to attend to her growing client base.  For that purpose, she is requesting an US $375.00 loan that she’ll repay in six months.

loans.use: To buy larger amounts of goods to prepare more food and sell more to clients.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene is a hardworking woman; during the years she has overcome many economic scarce circumstances, although this was never something that let her down. Since 13 years ago she has been working really hard to ensure the well being of the people in her household, they all make a real integrated and supportive team. Currently she is working to overcome the challenges that she has pit on to herself: being able to grow economically and cover the needs of her children, who everyday have more plans to continue their studies. Her youngest son is newborn, so she currently just feeds the animals in her house and takes care of her children in the company of her husband, who takes care of taking them to the field. Now, Marlene is thinking about continuing to take care of her animals and she will invest it in the forage of her cattle, and she needs your help to achieve her plans.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva volunteer

Marlene, es una mujer trabajadora, a lo largo de los años ella enfrentó muchas circunstancias de escasez económica y esto no fue motivo para que se dejara derrotar y desde hace 13 años que ha trabajado arduamente para procurarles bienestar a los miembros de su hogar en el que todos conforman un equipo bien engranado y solidario.Actualmente trabaja para seguir adelante con los retos que ella misma se ha propuesto, el de poder crecer económicamente y poder cubrir aún más las necesidades de sus hijos que cada día tienen nuevos planes de estudio, el último de sus hijos es apenas un recién nacido por lo que ahora sólo se dedica a alimentar a sus animales en su casa y sus hijos en compañía de su esposo se encargan de llevarlos al campo.Ahora Marlene piensa seguir dedicándose a la venta de los animales y para ello invertirá en la compra de forraje y necesita la ayuda de vosotros para llevar a cabo sus planes.

loans.use: Compra de forraje para alimentar a sus animalitos.

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
Rosa Argentina is an enterprising woman who, 30 years ago, used savings to start her business, selling fresh bread on the streets of Leon, Nicaragua. Because her customer base was growing rapidly and because she was a single mother with a growing son, she decided to rent a stand at the La Terminal market. She began selling soft drinks, water and, little by little, other refreshments and even telephone cards.

Thanks to the persistence and dedication of this exemplary woman, her business has grown with the help of CEPRODEL's loans. She now has a record 24 loans; the current loan is for a new project to improve her house and her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Rosa Argentina es una mujer esforzada y emprendedora que a partir de sus ahorros inició su negocio hace 30 años vendiendo pan fresco por las calles de la ciudad de LEÓN. Como su clientela crecia rapidamente y además por la necesidad de mantener a su hijo por ser madre soltera,necesita brindandole alimentacion, ropa y estudios, se decidió a alquilar un local al aire libre dentro del mercado LA TERMINAL. Empezó vendiendo gaseosas, agua y poco a poco algo de refrescos hasta la venta de tarjetas telefónicas.

Gracias a la perseverancia y dedicación de esta mujer ejemplar, su negocio ha crecido con la ayuda de los Créditos otorgados por CEPRODEL. Actualmente ella tiene un record de 24 créditos y el que pide actualmente es para su nuevo proyecto de mejorar la infraestructra de su casa y su negocio.

loans.use: Buy materials for improving residence.

loans.name: Thi Hong

texts.vi:
Ms Hồng is 27 years old. She has 2 school age children. She sells fruits and grocery items at the market near her house. She buys her fruits & grocery from a distributor and resells to make a profit. Her husband is a woodworker, he makes all kind of wood furniture. Ms Hồng has never borrowed money from a fund before, only from friends and family. This time she is determined to apply for a loan from Binh Minh cdc (SEDA) because the loan term is favorable, easy to qualify for and it's available where she lives so it is convenient.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hồng, 27 tuổi, đã có 2 con đang học cấp I. Chị đi chợ bán hoa quả. Chị thường đi mua ở các chợ trung tâm và bán lẻ ở chợ gần nhà. Chồng chị làm mộc, chuyên đóng các đồ nội thất. Chị chưa từng tham gia vay vốn ở tổ chức chính thức nào mà chỉ vay chị em, họ hàng. Lần này, chị mạnh dạn vay vốn của chương trình tài chính vi mô Bình Minh vì thủ tục vay mượn đơn giản, được làm ngay tại thôn không phải đi đâu xa, rất thuận tiện.

loans.use: Buy fruits and grocery for resales

loans.name: Hilaria Ayda's Group

texts.en:
Hilaria, Martha, and Esther are members of the “Nueva Vida” community bank . Hilaria has been a member for two years, while Martha and Esther joined less than one year ago. In that time, they have learned the importance of saving, responsibility, and how to treat their children.

Hilaria is 35 years old. She is married and has four children. Hilaria has owned a grocery store for several years.

Martha is 39 years old. She is a single mother and has one three-year-old daughter. Martha is has a degree in electrical engineering, but is unable to find work in that field. Currently, she has a business selling natural health products.

Esther is twenty. She is currently preparing for entrance exams to the local university. There, she plans to study accounting. Esther helps her sister, who owns a clothing store, and will invest the money from the loan her sister’s business.

Hilaria, Martha, and Esther need loans of 450, 1000, and 300 soles respectively (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy a piece of land, a new line of vitamins, and a variety of clothing items.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account that each associate has. Hilaria, Martha, and Esther plan to use their savings combines with their loan to buy land, buy a car, and to pay for school. Their dreams are to see their children become professionals, to start an electric engineering firm, and become a professional.

loans.use: Hilaria, Martha, and Esther need loans of 450, 1000, and 300 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy a piece of land, a new line of vitamins, and a variety of clothing items.

loans.name: Namayemba Central A Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Rose A..  She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand and become a wholesale seller.  Rose is 48 years old and is married with a husband who is a caterer for work.  She has 3 children ranging from age 16 to 26.  Each week, Rose makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to re-invest in her business.  Rose is joined in her small group by Rehema W., Edith A., Zaituni K., and Rebecca A..  Rehema W. has a business selling bed sheets and wants to boost business.  Edith A. is currently operating a business selling suitcases and wants a loan to add to the business.  Zaituni K. operates a retail shop business and wants to purchase a fridge.  Rebecca A. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and firewood and is requesting a loan to increase inventory.

loans.use: To add to charcoal business

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is married with 2 sons. She and her family live in Novomoskovsk where Nadezhda runs a small business selling fresh meat and sausages at the central city market. This type of inventory always sells well as Ukrainian women love to cook and the cuisine in Ukraine offers many nourishing meals made with different meats. Nadezhda’s trade has been characterized by stability over the last 5 years. Presently, her business brings in about $300 a month in income.

Nadezhda has requested a loan to purchase new inventory items so she can continue developing her trade and feed her family. Additional financial assistance will help her to consistently build and manage her venture. We think Nadezhda, with her strong personality, high motivation, and passion to make a difference, will achieve success and repay the current loan promptly.

loans.use: Purchase new inventory

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Mrs. Stella F. is 52 years of age and lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She is married with 6 children.  She sells general provisions including cooking oil, a business that she learnt from her sister and started on her own in 1998.  Now she is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy more inventory. She is a LAPO member.  She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr:
Monsieur Kodzo S. is 45 years old, married with three children. He lives and works in Adéta, a village about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. To meet the needs of his family he sells construction materials. With this loan, Kodzo wants to expand his business by purchasing planks and cement to sell. As a result of the profit made from these sales, he will be able to improve his family’s standard of living and participate in the development of his community.

Translated from French by Alison Dent,Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur Kodzo S. est âgé de 45 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. Il habite et travaille à Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, il vend les matériaux de construction. Avec ce crédit, Kodzo espère élargir la capacité de son commerce en achetant les planches et du ciment pour revendre. Avec les profits qu’il va dégager dans ses ventes, il peut améliorer les conditions de sa famille et participer ainsi au développement de sa communauté.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
Rodolfo is 25 years old and lives at family member's house that is located in the first ring. Rodolfo has more than two years of experience en the business of selling fragrance oils and incense. He has a fixed client base owing to the age of his and, above all, the quality of service that he provides to his clients. Rodolfo will use the loan as operating capital and thus increase his stock of fragrance oils, since he has various orders pending. Rodolfo is always increasing his product line which is why he takes out loans to be able to rotate his merchandise. He has demonstrated good prior credit payment.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Rodolfo tiene 25 años de edad, vive en el domicilio de un familiar que se encuentra ubicado por el primer anillo. Rodolfo tiene más de dos años de experiencia en el negocio de la comercialización de escencias y sahomerios. Ya cuenta con clientes fijos debido a la antiguedad de su actividad y sobre todo a la calidad de atención que brinda a sus clientes, cueta con clientes fijos a los cuales les deja la mercadería. rodolfo destinará el crédito para capital de operación y así aumentará su stock de escencias, esto debido a que tiene varios pedidos. Rodolfo siempre está incrementando sus productos por lo que saca sus préstamos para el continuo rotamiento de su mercadería. Tiene un buen comportamiento crediticio.

loans.use: Increase in operating capital

loans.name: Picaflor Group

texts.es:
The Picaflor group is maD. up of 14 people, among them 13 women and one man, Zeñon, who works selling household gadgets on the plaza "16 D. julio" . Apart from that work, Zeñon is also a carpenter who sells furniture on the same plaza on fair days. Doña Blanca, the founder of the group, returns in this third loan cycle with an excellent payment history earned in the two previous cycles. She travels to the Desguadero River transporting merchandise back and forth. The other members of the group work handcrafting sweaters and shawls. Most of the group's members have stable businesses and average earnings. Mary sells essential and convenience store items, Elena sells CDs, Adriana and Venancio weave blankets, Rosalia has a general store, Magdalena sells clothing for infants, Nancy has a grocery store, Leocadia sells stockings, Jimena sells lingerie, Filomena makes sweaters, Carolina sells shoes and finally, Carolina tends to her own grocery stand.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Grupo conformado por 14 personas entre el grupo D. mujeres existe un varón, Zenón, que se dedica a la venta D. artefactos en la 16 D. julio, a parte D. esa actividad es carpintero que en días D. feria va a vender muebles en la 16 D. julio. Doña Blanca fundadora del grupo Picaflor ingresa como nueva en este tercer ciclo con un antecedente muy bueno que se gano en los dos ciclos anteriores. Esta señora se dedica a la venta D. artefactos y general. Ella viaja al desaguadero llevando y trayendo mercadería. Las otras socias se dedican al tejido D. chompas y mantillas. La mayoría tiene negocios estables y con ingresos medios. Mary tiene una venta D. viveres, Elena venD. CDs, Adriana y Venancio tejen mantas, Rosalia se dedica al comercio general, Magdalena venD. ropa D. bebe, Nancy tiene su tienda D. abarrotes, Leocadia venD. medias, Jimena venD. lencería, Filomena teje chompas, Carolina venD. calzados y por último Carolina atienD. en su puesto D. abarrotes.

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
La señora Marisol pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Moralinas”, vive en la Región y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Morales. Se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de chupetes de frutas regionales y gelatinas de diferentes sabores. El negocio está ubicado en su propio domicilio en Jr. Sucre N° 132, desde donde ella sale a recorrer las calles de la ciudad y lugares donde se realizan diferentes tipos de eventos sociales. 

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,500, el cual pagará en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de frutas, coco, maní, leche, gelatinas y flan en paquetes, azúcar en saco blanca y rubia, bolsas, vasos, cucharitas descartables en millares, para satisfacer el gusto de los clientes. Le va bien gracias a la higiene y el buen trato que da a los clientes. Marisol refiere que en estos últimos tiempos las ventas han aumentado y piensa que se debe al clima caluroso. 

Marisol es una mujer optimista, trabajadora y emprendedora, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos que la apoyan en la preparación y venta de los productos. Su meta es distribuir los chupetes y gelatinas a las bodegas y estudiar repostería.
texts.en:
Señora Marisol belongs to the community bank "Las Moralinas." She lived in the region and province of San Martín, district of Morales. For ten years she has sold popsicles in regional fruit flavors and gelatin snacks. Her business is located out of her own house on the street Sucre No. 132, where she leaves to sell in the city streets and at places where there are different types of social events. With the $500 loan, to be paid in six months, she will invest in buying fruits, coconuts, peanuts, milk, gelatin and flan in packets, refined and unrefined sugar, bags, cups, plastic spoons in bags of thousands--all to be able to satisfy her clients. She's doing well thanks to the cleanliness and good service that she provides for her clients. Marisol says that lately her sales have increased and she thinks that's due to the heat. Marisol is an optimistic, hard-working and enterprising woman. She lives with her husband and her three children who help her with the preparation and sales of her goods. Her goal is to start distributing the popsicles and gelatin treats to stores and start studying to become a pastry chef.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan Paluck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruit, coconuts, peanuts, milk, gelatin, flan, sugar, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Nao

texts.en: Mrs. Nao O. is a villager in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province. She owns a small store where she sells dried fish. Because this business is going well, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more dried fish to meet her customers' demand. Her husband, Mr. Sieng Koem Yean, is a constructiO. worker who can make less income to support his family. Mrs. Nao O. is 56 years old and the mother of five children – four of whom are employed in different businesses, while the youngest one is attending the local school. Her husband is O. the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish to meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi: Chị Trần Thị Trúc năm nay  41 tuổi . Chị Tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1999n Với 500.000đ được vay ở vòng vốn đầu chị sử dụng để dầu tư cho chăn nuôi, sau 3 tháng công việc chăn nuôi đã đem lại cho chị thu nhập 1.000.000đ. Hiện tại ngoài chăn nuôi chị Trúc còn đi làm thuê hàng tháng cho thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 12.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm một con bò và 1 con bê về nuôi.n
texts.en:
Mrs. T. Thi Tran, 41 years old, has been participating in the Fund since 1999. With the 500,000 VND that she borrowed in the first round of funding, she invested in raising livestock. After 3 months, the livestock business had brought her an income in the amount of 1,000,000 VND. Besides livestock, Mrs. Tran also works as labor for hire with an income of 2,000,000 VND/month. In this round of funding she would like to borrow 12,000,000 VND to invest in buying a cow and a sheep to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cow, sheep

loans.name: Asociacion Yunguyo Group

texts.es: El grupo Asociacion Yunguyo esta representada por la señora Celia quien direge a un grupo D. 15 personas las cuales son conocidas entre si ya que residen en el mismo barrio. En su mayoria las(os) integrantes son mujeres trabajadoras que dejan el hogar para buscar mejores oportunidades para sacar adelante a su familia. Ellas(os) se dedica a diferentes cactividades como a la confeccion y elavoracion D. prendas D. vestir y calzados, al transporte publico, servicio , contruccion y comercio D. ropa, coca, comida y abarrotes. son gente responsable y con ganas D. progresar como lo demostraron en anteriores grupos en los que trabajaron con la fundacion ahora cursan su cuarto ciclo con gente nueva en el grupo pero saben que son gente responsable y que responderan a las espectativas del resto del grupo antiguo. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. insumos, materiales y herramientas para sus pequemas micro empresas asi como para el incremento D. materiales para la venta y a la mejora D. alguno D. sus productos e especial para le época naviD.ña que es cuando mas productos se venden.
texts.en:
Yunguyo Association group is represented by Mrs. Celia. She leads a group of 15 members who know each other because they live in the same neighborhood. The majority of the members are working women who leave their homes to seek out better opportunities to help their families get ahead. They work in different sectors, such as baking, clothing sales, footwear sales, public transport, service sector, construction, coca sales, food sales, and grocery sales. They are responsible people with the desire to progress, as demonstrated in past work with the foundation. This is their fourth loan cycle, and they've added new people to the group. However they know that these people are responsible and they meet the expectations of the experienced members. The loan will go toward supplies, materials, and tools for these small businesses. For example, the money will buy more materials to sell and will improve some of the products, especially during the Christmas season when sales are higher.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Iris Lanao Group

texts.en:
The Iris Lanao Village Bank (named for FINCA’s Executive Director) is maD. up of 23 members, who are beginning their fourth loan cycle. All of the group members are from the Chiara District, located one hour outsiD. of the city of Ayacucho. Most of the local community members are farmers or raise animals. The group members are involved in a variety of different business activities. Some sell dry goods, small animals, food, sweets, grains, or firewood, while others are farmers.

Gabriela is 33 years old and married with two children. Gabriela has a store where she sells dry goods and vegetables. She also grows corn and potatoes, which she sells in the markets in the city of Ayacucho. Rosa is 36 years old and married with six children. Rosa has a store in the Kishuar community, located 30 minutes outsiD. of Chiara. She also farms and raises animals. Luzmila is 26 years old and lives with her partner and their three children. Luzmila raises guinea pigs (a Peruvian delicacy) and also buys guinea pigs from other farmers, selling them in the city of Ayacucho.

The group members are requesting different loan amounts, like 300 (US$ 100), 450 (US$ 150), 600 (US$ 200) or 900 (US$ 300) soles. "Iris Lanao" is requesting a total of 14,500 soles in loans. The loans will be used to buy animals, rice, sugar, sweets, firewood, clothing and grains. Some of the group members dreams are for their children to get an education, to expand their businesses, to get ahead in life and to have all the basic necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

El Banco Comunal Iris Lanao inicia su cuarto ciclo con 23 socias. Todas las socias son del distrito D. Chiara que se encuentra a 1 hora D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, la población se dedican a la agricultura y crianza D. animales. Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. abarrotes, animales menores, comida, ropa, golosinas, cereales, leña y la agricultura.

Como es el caso D. Gabriela que es casada, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, Gabriela tiene una tienda en donD. venD. abarrotes, verduras, además se dedica a la agricultura D. maíz, papa que venD. en los mercados D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Por otro lado Rosa es casada, tiene 36 años y 6 hijos, Rosa tiene una tienda en la comunidad D. Kishuar que se encuentra a 30 minutos del distrito, además se dedica a la crianza D. animales y agricultura.

Mientras que Luzmila es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 3 hijos, Luzmila se dedica a la crianza D. cuy, y también compra D. los diferentes pueblos y los venD. en la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 600 soles y 900 soles, haciendo un total D. 14,500 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal. Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra D. animales, arroz, azúcar, leña, golosinas, ropa y cereales. Los sueños D. las socias son que sus hijos estudien, ampliar su negocio, salir adelante y tener todo lo necesario.

loans.use: Buy animals, rice, sugar, sweets, firewood, clothing, and grains

loans.name: Sylvie

texts.fr: Sylvie K. est une célibataire de 29 ans, résidant à Lomé, la capitale togolaise où elle tient une boutique de produits de beauté. Pour fidéliser sa clientèle, Sylvie espère avec ce crédit augmenter la capacité de son commerce en alimentant sa boutique. Elle compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer les conditions de sa vie.
texts.en:
Sylvie K. is a 29-year-old unmarried woman residing in Lomé, the Togolese capital, where she has a shop selling beauty products. To earn the loyalty of her customers, Sylvie hopes to use this loan to increase the capacity of her commerce by supplying her shop. She is counting on this opportunity to improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products for resale

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Kossi K. est âgé de 45 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. Il est soudeur à Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Il exerce ce métier depuis 7ans et arrive à subvenir difficilement aux besoins de sa famille. Pour attirer d’avantage la clientèle et leur rendre un service de qualité, il désire, avec ce crédit acquérir les outils de travail nécessaire et aussi aménager son atelier. Il espère avec cette chance améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kossi K., 45, is married and the father of 4 children. He is a welder in Lomé, the capital of Togo. He has been working at this trade for 7 years and has a hard time supporting his family. To attract more customers and give them quality service, he would like to use this loan to buy necessary tools and also to refurbish his workshop. He hopes that this opportunity will allow him to improve living conditions for his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: acquire necessary tools and refurbish his workshop

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea N. is 49 years old and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province. She works as a farmer and typically makes US$ 3 per day. Her husband is a moto-taxi driver and earns about US$ 2 every day in profit. This couple has five children, four of whom are married and live separately.

Mrs. Chea N. would like to take out a loan to hire farm workers to plant bananas.

loans.use: hiring workers to plant bananas

loans.name: Imuetinyan
