texts.en: Imuetinyan sells bags and shoes. She is 27 years old and single. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more shoes and bags to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Baby

texts.fr: Née à Bassar en 1970, Mme Baby K. est mariée et mère d’un (01) enfant. C’est grâce à son petit commerce de vente de louga (biscuit d’arachide grillé et du sucre), bonbons, arachide grillée qu’elle arrive à subvenir aux charges de sa famille. Aujourd’hui, elle veut agrandir son étalage et faire augmenter son chiffre d’affaires mais n’a pas les moyens financiers nécessaires. Elle sollicite un financement pour louer une petite boutique, élargir son stock et augmenter ses revenus. Ainsi, elle pourra avec l’aide de son mari contribuer à l’émancipation de toute la famille.
texts.en:
Born in Bassar in 1970, Mrs. Baby K. is married and the mother of one child. It is thanks to her little business selling "louga" (sweet biscuits made of grilled peanuts and sugar), candy, and grilled peanuts that she manages to support her family. Today she would like to expand her display space and grow her turnover, but she does not have the necessary financial means. She is requesting a loan to rent a little store, expand her inventory, and increase her revenue. Thus she will be able, with the help of her husband, to contribute to freeing up the whole family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: production and sale of snacks

loans.name: Ni Putu Sri Wiriani

texts.en:
Ni Putu Sri Wiriani - (DNR.M-0652) is a 27 year-old female living in the town of Tukadaya - Melaya. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, Ni Putu Sri Wiriani owns & operates a business making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fried foods in the local community. Ni Putu Sri Wiriani has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 500,000 IDR (~USD 45) per month from these activities.

In 2008, Ni Putu Sri Wiriani joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and have the ability to engage in business activities. Ni Putu Sri Wiriani has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. Ni Putu Sri Wiriani is requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from DINARI.  Ni Putu Sri Wiriani plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ni Putu Sri Wiriani - (DNR.M-0652) merupakan 27 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Tukadaya - Melaya.  Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia sekolah.  Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Putu Sri Wiriani memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pangan.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah membuat & menjual makanan.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari menjual makanan kering di tengah masyarakat setempat.  Ni Putu Sri Wiriani sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 3 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Putu Sri Wiriani menghasilkan sekitar 500,000 IDR sebulan.

Dalam 2008, Ni Putu Sri Wiriani bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Putu Sri Wiriani meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli kendaraan pengangkut untuk meningkatkan bisnis.  Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 5,000,000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli produk tambahan untuk dijual.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.  Ni Putu Sri Wiriani berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk meningkatkan kondisi kehidupan secara umum keluarga peminjam.

Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. .  Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam  Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional food products to sell

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.ru:
Абдурахим Исмоилов добрый и многоуважаемый человек в своем кишлаке. Он уже 30 лет занимается животноводческой деятельностью. Дома у Абдурахима 7 голов крупнорогатого скота, которых он откармливает и перепродает.
Животноводство это не единственный источник дохода в его семье, так как Абдурахим параллельно занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур, а так же он мастер-плотник.
Абдурахим живет со своей женой Тутти Исмоиловой и детьми. У них 3 дочерей, которые вышли замуж и проживают в доме своих мужей, и два сына, которые живут с родителями, то есть с Абдурахимом и Тутти.
Старший сын Абдурахима сотрудник Аэропорта, а младший помогает отцу в откорме и продаже скота.
Абдурахим запрашивает сумму в размере 1000 сомони на 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Abdurahim I. is a good man and well-respected in his village. He has practiced animal husbandry for the past 30 years. He has 7 head of cattle at home, for fattening and reselling. Animal husbandry is not his family's sole source of income, since Abdurahim also raises crops, as well as being a master carpenter. Abdurahim lives with his wife Tutti Ismoilova and their children. They have three daughters who have married and live in the house with their husbands, and two sons who live with their parents (Abdurahim and Tutti). Abdurahim's eldest son works at the airport and the younger helps his father feed and sell livestock. Abdurahim is requesting 1000 somoni for 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding livestock

loans.name: Seth

texts.en:
Seth O. is thirty-two years old, married, and has three children: two sons and a daughter who are all currently in the junior high and primary schools. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a town in Ghana called Suhum. Suhum is a busy business centre in the Eastern Region. The majority of the inhabitants are into one particular type of business activity or another. His wife runs a provision store to support him financially.

Seth runs a pharmacy in his community. He buys his drugs from the distributers who come round to supply in vans. He has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to procure drugs in bulk to increase his stock. He is hopeful to give his children the best education.

loans.use: To procure drugs in bulk

loans.name: Agnes Nakazi's Group

texts.en:
Teopista is the leader of a five-member group. She is a 43-year-old divorcee with five children aged between 16 and 29 years old, three of whom are still in school. Teopista resides and works in a semi-urban area, which is on the outskirts of Kampala. She owns a three-roomed house, with electricity but no piped water, where she lives with four other people. Her family get three meals a day, and she doesn’t take care of any additional family members. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for business premises, and food for her family.

For seven years Teopista has run a restaurant in Kamwokya market in one of Kampala's suburbs. She serves an average of 30 customers a day, six days a week. Her business doesn’t incur any transport costs as she buys at her place of work from suppliers who obtain food from villages. Teopista has been with Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, for over ten years and is servicing her twentieth loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more food, charcoal and cutlery. Teopista aspires to see her business grow bigger and hopes to own permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy more food, charcoal and cutlery

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea D. is 21 years old, single and committed to help her parents by running her own store in the village of Paddad in Alicia, Isabela. Lea has been in business for three years, and went into direct sales when she had to stop her studies because of a lack of funds. 

Over the last three years, Lea has invested her income in a sari-sari (or general) store. At present she is generating an average daily income of PHP 3,000. She is grateful that her business is doing well, and she wants to expand it. To make this possible, she has applied for a $325  loan from Kiva to buy more products to sell from her store.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Alfayo

texts.en:
Alfayo is a 25 year-old father of one who sells charcoal in the Mukuru slums of Nairobi. Previously, Alfayo worked as a security guard for two years before starting his own business with one sack of charcoal. Today, Alfayo has grown to own a stock of 8 sacks of charcoal. He has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings in order to purchase a new business premises and add stock. This will be Alfayo’s third loan, and he has seen his business grow immensely since becoming a Faulu Kenya client. He hopes to one day diversify his business to also sell cereals.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Buy a new business premises and add stock

loans.name: Madres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
ALCOM  MADRES EMPRENDEDORAS	

Ofelia Soledad F. Enriques tiene 38 años vive en Marquez Callao, pertenece a L. agencia Olivos, elL. es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos D. los cuales uno es pequeño.
L. señora Ofelia integra el grupo MADRES EMPRENDEDORAS  conformado por  12 socias elL. lleva dentro del grupo 3 años y tiene el cargo D. presidenta.
Nos cuenta que al mudarse D. casa formo otro grupo  el nombre lo eligieron debido a que las madres tenían mucho deseo D. seguir progresando.
Ofelia se dedica actualmente a L. venta D. ropa en sus inicios nos cuenta que empezó vendiendo comida, pero debido a un problema D. visión decidió descansar y es por ello que empieza con L. venta D. zapatos y ropa. Con todo esto ha logrado ser mas responsable también aprendió a contabilizar su dinero y lograr ser independiente, ayuda a su esposo en L. economía del hogar  y lo mas importante es que sus ingresos le sirven para el tratamiento D. su vista ya que es costoso. en el futuro desea poner su salón D. belleza y ayudar a que sus hijos sean profesionales el préstamo que le otorgara EDAPROSPO lo invertirá en adquirir mercadería para su negocio.

* L. señora Ofelia aparece sentada en medio del grupo
texts.en:
Ofelia Soledad F. Enriques is a 38-year-old woman who is a member of the Olivos agency. She has a live-in partner and 3 children, one of whom is still young.

Ofelia is a member of the MADRES EMPRENDEDORAS (Enterprising Mothers) Group, which is comprised of 12 members. She has been in the group for 3 years and is the group president.

She states that upon moving to another house, she formed another group. This name was chosen because these mothers really wanted to keep making progress. Ofelia currently sells clothing. She states that she started out selling fast food, but she decided to rest due to a problem with her vision. For this reason, she started selling shoes and clothing. With this business, she has managed to become more responsible and independent, and she has learned to administer her finances. She helps her husband with the household income, and the most important thing is that these earnings help her get treatment for her eye problem, which is very costly. In the future, she would like to set up her own beauty salon and help her children become professionals. She will invest this EDAPROSPO loan in obtaining merchandise for her business.

*Ms. F. is pictured sitting in the middle of the group.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en:
Arthur E. is a hardworking father and he lives with his family in a rural place located at Barangay Sto. Domingo, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. His wife is Jane and they are blessed with three children namely: Catherine, Arjay and Lory.

Being responsible parents, and through their sacrifices in tilling their rice field to provide their children’s educational needs, two of their children are already finished a nursing course and they are presently working abroad, while at the moment, their youngest child is still studying in college, taking Information Technology.

Arthur is the one who cultivates their farm lot for a crop twice a year. He plants rice and vegetables while his wife manages a piggery. Because according to him, they don’t have enough capital to acquire the needed agricultural supplies for their rice field and feeds needed for their hog raising business, he wants to request a loan of PHP 15,000 as additional business capital for their agriculture business, both farming and pig raising.

Arthur is hoping that, someday, his youngest child will also finish college like their two eldest children because, according to him, it is the only wealth that he is able to give them.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus S. is from the village of Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga del sur. She is 37 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Venus owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income comes from selling daily use products such as shampoos, soaps and toothpastes to the local community. Venus is just starting this business.

In 2008, Venus joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation, and her ability to engage in business. Venus has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC, which was invested in renovating the business. This loan will be Venus's third loan from GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business, to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for sale.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Mrs. Eng L., age 39, and her husband, Mr. Vanna Doung, age 34, were married in 1995. They have two sons and two daughters. Three of the children are in school and another one is still young. The family lives along National Road Number Six about ten kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Eng has been selling meat and vegetables for about six years. Her husband has been operating a water utility service in his village for more than five years. Eng hopes to expand her business so that she will be able to generate more income for supporting her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Mrangirangi Group

texts.en:
Frederick M., age 30, is married and has two children, both girls. His daughers’ names are Fidelis and Felix, and they are both under two years old. Frederick has an electrical goods shop where he sells and repairs second-hand TVs and radios. He also installs electricity in homes. He has had this business since 2006, and works from 8 am until 6 pm daily. He is able to earn a monthly profit of around $90.

This will be Frederick’s fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. With his previous loans, Frederick was able to expand his business from one office to two, and he has repaid all previous loans successfully.  He hopes to use this loan to invest in new TVs to sell at his business, and also to buy more used TVs and radios from Zanzibar. He travels to Zanzibar two times a year to buy more items to sell. Frederick hopes to use his extra profits from this expansion in his business to help his family with the household expenses and to save for the future. Frederick says his life has changed a lot because of micro-loans from Tujijenge. Where he used to only be able to buy one or two parts for a TV at a time, he can now invest in several at one time.
	
Frederick will share this loan with his loan group, Mrangirangi (meaning “many colors” in Swahili), which totals 17 members. The members of the group will receive loans for a variety of businesses that include tailoring shops, carpentry services, food vending, and “table top” stands where fresh fruit and vegetables are sold. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. In the picture, Frederick is front and center wearing a white shirt.

loans.use: New TVs to expand his electronics store

loans.name: Elmira's Group

texts.en:
Elmira, a 42-year-old woman, is the leader of this group. Elmira and her husband are raising three children. Their eldest son is 19.  He has already got on his feet and he lives and works in Bishkek. The middle son is a college student. And the little daughter goes to elementary school. Elmira and her husband always strive to give their children a good upbringing, so that their children grow up hardworking and diligent. To provide for the family and pay for the children’s education, Elmira’s husband works as a builder. As for Elmira, she manufactures traditional handicrafts. She wants to get herself a spot at the market and start selling the articles at the market. She got this idea after consulting her relatives, who believe in Elmira’s skill and the profitability of this business. When Elmira first started sewing national articles, she invested 350$. Her expense was worth it, as in a very short time Elmira began receiving orders. Her success has encouraged her to expand her business and start selling the articles in a shop. Since then, she has been nurturing this idea in her soul and making preparations. Now everything is ready. She just needs some funds to purchase fabric. Therefore, Elmira has applied for this loan to start her business, steadily grow and become an independent entrepreneur. She also says that this business would let her give a better education to her daughter.

Elmira’s partners are Batima, Cholponbai and Elnura.

Batima, 46, is divorced. She is a mother of five children. Only her little daughter and son live with Batima. For a living, Batima sells potatoes. She hopes to obtain this loan and invest it in purchasing potatoes. 

Cholponbai, 23, married very early and now has a six-year old son. His wife trades in socks at the market. Cholponbai trades in cattle. He needs a loan to invest in increasing the turnover.

Elnura, 25, is single. After graduating from college, Elnura decided to start trading in cattle. Now, she has a stable income and needs a loan to purchase calves.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Women Of Substance Group

texts.en:
Mama P.'s business is the sale of dry fish. She is 40 years old and married with five children between the ages of 8 and 25 years old and in Grades 4 to 12. She is a 1st grade drop-out herself due to poverty but decided to go into business. She started with 3000 Liberian dollars that were given to her by her husband. Mama lives and works in the Fiamah community – a very crowded community that is south of the Liberian capital, Monrovia.

Mama buys fish from the fishermen, dries them and sells them retail to residents of Fiamah. She sells good fish and speaks well to her customers in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. She has been running her business for 15 years and is hoping to switch to the sale of cloth in the future. Mama needs this loan to purchase more fish for her customers to improve her business. She dreams of giving her children a better education and of completing their unfinished house.

Mama P. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called "Women of Substance".

loans.use: To purchase more fish

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is Aminata S.. She is 54 years old and married. She comes from Tombo, an area within Waterloo. She has four children: two boys and two girls. One is in secondary school and the rest have grown up.

Aminata has been a LAPOSL client for some time now and has taken two previous loans. She is a member of a LAPOSL union (a credit group that acts as a collective collateral and guarantor). This the first loan she will be receiving with the help of Kiva lenders.

Aminata sells palm oil and bananas by walking in the street at Tombo town. With her previous loans she expanded her business by purchasing additional inventory. With her new loan she hopes to increase her business again in the same way.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil and bananas

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.en: Ms. E. works in various markets throughout Lomé selling a variety of grains. She has been running her business since 2003. She is a single mother with one child. This will be her first loan with WAGES, which she will use to buy ten bags of beans for resale. The profits from her business will help support both her and her child.

loans.use: To purchase beans.

loans.name: Ibrahim Abdalah

texts.en: Ibrahim Abdalah is 29 years old and married with five children who are in primary school. He is looking after three dependents, two of whom attend school. He has had a grocery store business for more than nine years now. He will use the loan to purchase and stock more items, such as rice, posho (maize flour), beans and cooking oil for sale. He is an ambitious business man whose dream is to expand his business so that he may be able to obtain better monthly profits.

loans.use: To purchase and stock rice, maize flour, beans and cooking oil

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan B. is from the town of Taggappan Echague. She is 34 years old. Joan is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Joan owns and operates a gown for rent business. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing rentals for gowns and barongs in the local community. Aside from that, she is also managing a catering business. Joan has been engaged in her businesses for over 14 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Joan joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joan is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Joan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Tusitukire Wamu Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
N. Jamila is 52 years old and the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is a hardworking, married woman with four children aged between 7 and 30. She also takes care of some orphans.
Jamila is a farmer in Buikwe. She says that her business is doing well due to her good customer care and the loans that enable her to sell good quality produce. Although her business is doing well, she is faced with a scarcity of water for her plantations. Jamila has a dream of becoming a wholesaler of produce as well as educating all of her children to the highest levels of education. She is requesting a loan to help pay for her children’s education as well as buy more produce for resale.

loans.use: To buy more produce and pay her children's school fees

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is a blacksmith. He’s 27 years old and still unmarried. He went to school and passed the intermediate-level exam. 

He needs this loan to enlarge his shop, to hire more employees, and to raise his income, and to get as many clients as possible. He is known to a reputable person among his peers. He gained a lot of experience in his field. 

He will use this loan to purchase materials, such as an iron welder, a generator and the other necessities of blacksmithing.

loans.use: To buy an iron welder and a generator

loans.name: Mornica

texts.en:
Mornica is married and has children who depend on her. She grows and sells farm products such as cereals, milk and fruit to wholesalers, friends and neighbors from her farm. Her husband is a mason. He works hard to take care of his family and support his wife’s business.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Mornica has been saving her money and she has been able to buy a cow. Her wish is to offer higher and better education to her children. She has requested a loan of Kes 25,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of three bags of rice, two cans of peanut oil and a box of spaghetti

loans.name: Chalwe

texts.en: Chalwe C., a married businesswoman, sells both new and second hand clothes at Kigamboni ward in Dar es Salaam. Purchasing her goods from the wholesale shops in Karume city market and Kariakoo city shopping center, she retails them to her customers. Chalwe has been in the business for four years, supporting both her family and business from her proceeds. She now needs a loan of T.shs 1,000,000 to buy more business goods

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Khim

texts.en: Mr. V. is 27 years old and lives in a rural commune of Phnom Penh City, where he works as a security guard in a garment factory. He started his job when he was single, but is now married to Theavy, who is 25 years old and a seamstress. The couple has two children who are both enrolled in school. V. currently faces a problem: he does not have an electricity line for use at home. Therefore, V. is applying for a loan in order to pay a bill for connecting a new electricity line for his family's use.

loans.use: To pay a bill for connecting a new electricity line for his family's use

loans.name: Sol Radiante Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal SOL RADIANTE está conformado por 9 personas, 8 mujeres y 1 varón, la mayoría D. las socias pertenecen a la Zona D. Villa Armonía. La mayoría D. las socias se dedican a la venta D. material escolar y otros artículos varios en librerías y bazares también a la venta D. ropa, calzados, venta D. cosméticos y una socia que es odontóloga y tiene su propio consultorio. Realizaron la capacitación en 4 reuniones asistiendo en un 100% todas las socias el lugar D. capacitación fue en zona siendo el desembolso en la oficina Emprender Pampahasi en cuanto a su historial crediticio D. las socias ninguna se encuentra con malos antecedentes.

La Sra. Pepita  Es la representante, líder del grupo la cual reunió a las demás, toma el cargo D. la presidenta del banco, tiene su librería bazar, también cuenta con dos maquinas fotocopiadoras y una cabina telefónica, con esta actividad hace 20 años empezando solo con material escolar, el préstamo será destinado a incrementar su mercadería para la variedad. Casada con el señor Williams, que trabaja como chofer, tiene 2 hijos los cuales son independientes.  
DesD. el inicio D. las reuniones las convoco a una sola voz y todas las respondieron, fue ella quien elidió a sus acompañantes D. directiva y la base respaldó por que conoce bien a cada una D. ellas y la actividad que realizan, con el dinero del credito comprara material escolar para su libreria.

La Sra. Elizabeth socia que asume el cargo D. tesorera del banco, también tiene su librería bazar con cabina telefónica y dos heladeras, cuenta con  esta actividad hace 8  años D. profesión odontóloga pero no ejerce su profesión y prefiere dedicarse al comercio que según ella es mas rentable, el préstamo esta destinado al incremento D. capital para la variedad D. sus productos.  
Es una D. las socias que también ha sido representante en otros bancos comunales teniendo experiencia en manejo D. grupos crediticios.
La Sra. Lourdes, es elegida como secretaria, siempre alegre en las reuniones    es odontóloga, tiene su propio consultorio con su esposo en la zona D. villa Armonía hace 15 años tiene un buen historial D. créditos en grupos D. otras entidades financieras, es una persona muy responsable que cumple y hace cumplir las reglas.

Todas las socias estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion dle credito.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Sol Radiante” (Radiant Sun) consists of nine individuals, eight women and one man, most of whom are from the district of Villa Armonía. Most of the members sell school supplies and other items found in bookstores and bazaars. The members also sell clothing, shoes, and cosmetics. One member is a dentist who has her own office. They completed four training sessions at the Emprender office in Pampahasi with 100% attendance. With regard to their credit history, none of the members have bad records.

Sra. Pepita is representing the group and was just elected to the position of Communal Bank President. She manages a bookstore and bazaar. In addition, she has two photocopy machines and a phone booth. Pepita began her business 20 years ago selling only school supplies. Her loan will be used to increase her inventory by purchasing a variety of merchandise. She is married to Sr. Williams, who works as a chauffeur, and they have two adult children. At the start of their meetings, the voice of one member initiates discussion and the others respond in return. In this instance, she was responsible for starting the meeting. The members of the board know each other well and are familiar with one another’s businesses. Pepita will use the money from her loan to buy school supplies for her bookstore.

Sra. Elizabeth was elected to the position of Communal Bank Treasurer. She also has a bookstore, a bazaar, a phone booth, as well as two refrigerators. Elizabeth worked as a dentist for eight years but she decided to quit the profession so that she could pursue a more profitable line of business. Her loan will be used to increase her operating capital so that she can acquire a variety of products. She is one of the members who has served as a representative for other Communal Banks, so she has experience managing group loans.

Sra. Lourdes was elected to the position of Communal Bank Secretary and is always happy to attend the meetings. She is a dentist and has her own office, along with her husband, in the district of Villa Armonía. For the past 15 years, she has maintained a good credit history at other financial institutions. Lourdes is a very responsible person, since she must comply with and enforce the rules.

All of the members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in them by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school supplies to sell

loans.name: Rosette

texts.fr: B. Rosette est née en 1979 au Bénin. Mariée à DOHOUNGO Jean un agent au Port Autonome de Cotonou, Rosette est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. La famille vit depuis dix ans au quartier Fidjrossè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Rosette vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les différentes charges de la famille. Rosette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de sept ans que Rosette vend des tissus par le système de distribution. C’est à Dantokpa grand marché du Bénin, que Rosette achète ses produits. Après avoir bénéficié d’un premier prêt auprès de ALIDé avec un remboursement sans difficulté, Rosette sollicite un second prêt pour augmenter son stock de produits afin de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle toujours existants.
texts.en:
Rosette B. was born in 1979 in Benin. Married to Jean DOHOUNGO, an agent at the Autonomous Port of Cotonou, Rosette is the mother of two children, both attending (or having attended) school. The family settled ten years ago in the Fidjrossé borough of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Rosette helps her husband deal with the various family expenses. Rosette has not attended school herself. For the past seven years she has been selling clothing fabric through the distribution system. She buys her products in Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. Having been granted a first loan from ALIDé, which was reimbursed without problems, Rosette is now requesting a second loan to increase her stock supply and satisfy the constant needs of her customers.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy lengths of clothing fabric

loans.name: Kadia

texts.fr:
Madame Kadia Koné est âgée de 56 ans,  veuve et mère de 6 enfants. Elle vit chez son feu époux avec ses enfants au quartier Bagadadji près de la mosquée de Guidjo Almamy de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas été scolarisée, elle a commencé tôt le commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait des gâteaux à base de mil ou de riz (appelé le Takoula). Après avoir passé plusieurs années auprès de cette dernière, elle commença à s’introduire petit à petit dans la vente de céréales jusqu’à acquérir des expériences dans ce domaine. Elle jouit d’une grande clientèle  et réputation dans son quartier. Parallèlement à cette activité qu’elle mène depuis maintenant 9 ans, elle vend également des bois  de construction.
Afin de constituer du stock pour la saison pluvieuse où il y aurait une pénurie du mil, elle décide de solliciter un nouveau prêt à Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est en relation depuis  54 mois  et eût   3 prêts solidaires et 3 prêts individuels, tous correctement bien remboursés. 
Ce quatrième prêt individuel sera utiliser pour acheter, 10 sacs de mil. Elle s’approvisionne sur place.
Madame Kadia Koné vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel  de 100 000FCFA, ce bénéfice  lui permettra de se prendre en charge surtout qu’elle est veuve et d’honorer à ses engagements avec Soro Yiriwaso. 
Son ambition est de pérenniser son activité si possible d’ouvrir un magasin de stockage.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kadia Koné is a 56-year-old widowed mother of six. She lives in her late husband’s home with her children in the Bagadadji area, near the Guidjo Almamy mosque in Ségou (fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali). Not having gone to school, she started selling things early on with her mother, who sold millet and rice cakes (called Takoula). After having done this for many years, she started little by little selling grains to gain experience in this domain. She enjoys a large clientele and good reputation in her neighborhood. In addition to this business, which she has been in for 9 years, she also sells construction wood. In order to build up her stock for the rainy season, when there will be a millet shortage, she has decided to seek a new loan from Soro Yiriwaso, with whom she has had a relationship for 54 months and has had 3 group loans and 3 individual loans, all of which were repaid. This fourth individual loan will be used to buy ten bags of millet. She stocks up on the premises. Mrs. Kadia Koné sells for cash and credit to a clientele composed of men and women. She hopes to earn 100,000 FCFA each month, which will allow her to take care of her family, especially since she is widowed, and to repay her loan to Soro Yiriwaso. She aspires to continue her business, and if possible, to open a store.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy millet

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Al visitar al banco comunal “Nueva Visión de Rumichaca” entrevistamos a la  señora Dora. 

Dora tiene 55 años, es viuda y vive en la comunidad de Rumichaca de la Ciudad de Urubamba.  Su principal actividad económica de Dora es la venta de verduras y tubérculos. Ya son veinte años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Dora participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien porque es una persona responsable y puntual al momento de pagar sus cuotas, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas, abono, etc.  
     
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
We interviewed Señora Dora during our visit to the community bank "Nueva Vision (new vision) de Rumichaca." Dora is 55 years old and is a widow. She lives in the community of Rumichaca in the city of Urubanba. Her principal economic activity is the sale of vegetables and root corps. She has already worked at this business for twenty years and it is going very well for her, thanks to the effort that she puts inot her work. Dora participates in her community bank, and it is going very well for her because she is a responsible person and is punctual in paying her bills. She needs the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, etc. This community bank member is thankful for the opportunity offered through this means and also promises to make her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet L. is from the village of Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 28 years old and married with five small children. To make a living, Janet owns  a sari-sari (variety) shop selling both food and daily use products. Janet has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Janet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Janet is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Janet from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Rosavilla

texts.en: Rosavilla S. is from the village of Katipa. She is 51 years old and is married with two school-aged children.Rosavilla owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2001, Rosavilla joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Rosavilla is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 17th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Monika

texts.en: Monika D. is currently in the business of selling tea and local Sudanese bread (tamia and legemat) in an iron-sheet-built restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock foodstuff such as beans, rice, and maize to cook and sell. Monika is 51 years old and is widowed. She has seven children, three of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her restaurant by building a permanent large room that can accommodate many chairs and tables for customer service.

loans.use: To stock foodstuff such as beans, rice, and maize to cook and sell

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely C. is from the village of Luz Banzon, Jasaan, in Misamis Oriental. She is 30 years old. Fely is separated from her spouse and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Fely owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Fely has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010 Fely joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services in order to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fely is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Fely from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional food and daily use products to sell

loans.name: Fozil

texts.en:
U. Fozil has always been hard-working man, who has made sure from his young age that his family never goes without their daily bread. He is married with 3 children. 

He has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuff. With a starting capital of $200, and thanks to his perseverance and dedication, Fozil began this enterprise many years ago. Over time he expanded his business and today his whole family is engaged in the business. 

Today Fozil needs to buy additional foodstuff for increasing the range of his selling goods. With this purpose he is requesting a loan of $3,000. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once and awhile to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.     
      
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the foodstuff for increasing the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of flour, sugar and beans

loans.name: Primo

texts.es: El Sr. Primo vive en la localidad de el Torno, es nacido en el departamento de Cochabamba, su actividad es la producción de escoba, hace 3 año que se dedica a este negocio, es separado de su esposa, por tal motivo vive en la casa de su hermano, esta rehaciendo su vida ya que su primer matrimonio no funciono, el destino del crédito es para la construcción de un galpón para desarrollar su actividad ya que el que tiene le quedo pequeño necesita mas espacio ya que su actividad lo requiere, es muy trabajador, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Primo lives in El Torno.  He was born in the Cochababa department.  His business is the production of brooms.  He has had this business for three years.  He is separated from his wife, so he lives in his brother’s house.  He is remaking his life because his first marriage did not work.

The loan is to build a shed for his business.  The one that he has is too small, and he needs more space.  He is very hard-working.  He is grateful to the institution for the support given to him by granting the loan.

loans.use: To build a shed

loans.name: Yaritza Del Carmen

texts.es: Yaritza Del Carmen tiene 32 años, su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 8 años que tiene este negocio, inicio desde muy joven pues a ella siempre le ha gustado sacar a su familia adelante a ella le ha gustado trabajar e independizarse de esa manera. La mayoría de sus cliente le solicitan los encargos varios días antes, porque tiene que buscar lo que le piden ella viaja a los departamentos para conseguir la mercadería más accesible. El crédito es para la compra de tratamientos, cremas, calzado ropa y otros productos.
texts.en: Yaritza Del Carmen is 32 years old.  Her business activity is selling general merchandise.  She has been in this business for more than 8 years.  She started when she was very young since she has always liked getting her family ahead and she has liked working and becoming independent in this way.  Most of her customers order goods with her several days in advance because she has to go and search for what they order.  She travels to different areas to find the most affordable merchandise.  Her loan will be used to buy skin care products, creams, footwear, clothes and other products.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Julia Angelica

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal “Azangarinas Valientes”  ubicado en el distrito Azángaro,  provincia de Azángaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 43 años de edad, de estado civil  conviviente y tiene 01 hijo, realizó estudios de educación superior.

Viene  trabajando con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 02 años, su   primer préstamo  fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  utilizó para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de quesos.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por S/. 700.00 nuevos soles, este dinero lo  invertirá para comprar quesos al por mayor.

Su sueño para el futuro  es mejorar su negocio y así generarse más ingresos.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la puntualidad y la organización.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the “Azangarinas Valientes” community bank which is located in Azángaro district, Azángaro province, in the department of Puno.  She is 43 years old and lives with her partner.  She has one child.  She completed her higher education.

Julia has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 2 years.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles and she used that money to increase the working capital of her business selling cheese.

She is requesting a new loan for 700 nuevos soles which she will use to buy cheese wholesale.

Her dream for the future is to improve her business and thereby make more profits.

What she likes most about her community bank is the punctuality and the organization.

loans.use: To buy cheese wholesale

loans.name: Sarr

texts.fr: MONSIEUR A. SARR EST COMMERÇANT SPÉCIALISE DANS L'ÉLEVAGE ET LA VENTE DE MOUTON.IL A EU A FAIRE CETTE ACTIVITÉ DES LE BAS AGE.FACE A UNE FORTE DEMANDE DE SES CLIENTS IL SOLLICITE CE MONTANT POUR POUVOIR LES SATISFAIRE.
texts.en: Mr. A. Sarr is an entrepreneur who raises sheep for sale. He has been doing this  line of work since an early age. Facing an increased customer demand, he is seeking this loan so as to satisfy his customers’ needs.

loans.use: Bolstering business capital

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia Pérez S. vive en la comunidad de Tlayecac, Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México, ella tiene 40 años de edad, estudio hasta el 6º. Grado de primaria tiene su certificado, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos de ella con su esposo y 1 hija adoptiva que es hija de su esposo, sus hijos son Jorge de 11 años de edad está estudiando la primaria, Esli de 6 años de edad está estudiando la primaria, Gabriel tiene 3 años y su hija adoptiva Azucena de 17 años de edad es casada y tiene un niño.
La señora Antonia tiene su taller de costura y solicitó su préstamo para invertir en el taller en materia prima va a comprar hilos, ahujas, aceite, cierres, resorte, refacciones, deshiladores, tijeras, tela, encaje, listón, ella ofrece a sus clientes mandiles de 4 modelos diferentes, los fabrica, los vende y a veces maquila pans, uniformes para la primaria, uniformes deportivos de básquet bol, también tiene servicio de serigrafía y estampados, elabora servilletas para quince años, bautizos, 3 años, primera comunión, ella inicio su negocio hace 11 años, primero estuvo trabajando de empleada en un taller de costura elaboraba artículos para bebé como pañaleras, velo para cunas, forros para portabebés, estos productor eran para Liverpool.
El lugar donde tiene su taller se lo heredo su papá un espacio de 50 metros cuadrados, la fincada lo fue construyendo con los préstamos y las maquinas industriales y de serigrafía las compró con su liquidación que le dieron en el taller de costura donde trabajaba, su negocio se localiza en su casa en Tlayecac, la señora Antonia participó en un concurso estatal de costura donde participaron de varios lugares fueron 31 participantes y se ganó el primer lugar con su premio se compró 2 maquinas industriales.  Su negocio es importante y especial porque de ahí se sostiene económicamente, se mantiene, es una fuente de trabajo para su familia ya que su esposo sale a vender los mandiles que la señora Antonia fabrica y su hija adoptiva también trabaja con ella y se siente orgullosa de elaborar sus mandiles, ella comenzó con 8 mandiles de plástico que se utilizan para lavar y no se mojen. Los elaboró con trozos de plástico que eran desperdicios que la señora donde trabajaba le regaló y su esposo salió a venderlos y los termino muy rápido, con lo que obtuvo de la venta compró mas plástico y fueron creciendo sus clientes, sus clientes son varios. 
Ella fabrica mandiles por mayoreo a las tortillerías, las carnicerías, los taqueros. Los desafíos que enfrenta el negocio son el clima entra ya que el polvo entra al taller, pues no está terminado aún y sus telas se le ensucian, también le falta la herrería, la puerta, los vidrios. 
Las ganancias del negocio las vuelve a invertir, para la alimentación, para pagar el préstamo, para los gastos de la casa, ella está planeando ampliar su taller quiere comprar una maquina bordadora computarizada y una maquina ojaleadora y lo piensa logara ahorrando y con el préstamo va a completar, las mejorías que desea hacer a su vivienda son la herrería del taller, en el segundo piso: repellar, poner los vidrio, azulejo al baño para ampliar el taller.
A veces les da trabajo a más personas en el mes de diciembre pues es una temporada en la que ella vende mas.
Ella sueña con un taller completo y dar empleo a más personas, ella está muy emocionada con este préstamo que le proporcionan porque si lo sabe administrar le va mejor.
Las metas que tiene son lograr que hijos estudien una carrera u oficio y si les gusta la costura les va a enseñar su oficio de costura. A ella le gusta Tlayecac porque ahí nació y creció, la gente es muy tranquila, en tiempo de lluvias el cerro reverdece, la barranca crece y la vegetación crece hay pipiscas, hongos y se puede ir al campo a la tranquilidad. Ella quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “Gracias por el préstamo que me dan porque  por medio de este voy a ampliar mi negocio, trabajo en mi casa y estoy empleada y he podido atender a mis hijos en mi propio negocio, muchas gracias.”
texts.en:
Señora Antonia Pérez S. lives in the community of Tlayecac, Ayala, in Morelos state in Mexico.  She is 40 years old, she studies until the 6th grade, she is married and has 3 kids that are her own and 1 adopted kid. Her children are named Jorge, Esli and Gabriel. Jorge is 11 years old,  Esli is 6 years old and Gabriel is 3 years old. Jorge and Esli are  both currently in elementary school. Antonia's adopted daughter, Azucena, is 17 years old, is married and has a son.

Señora Antonia has a sewing workshop and requests the loan to invest in raw materials for the workshop.  She will buy yarn, needles, oil, closures, springs, parts, fringe, scissors, fabric, lace, ribbon.  She offers her customers aprons in 4 different styles which she makes and sells.  She sometimes makes uniforms for the elementary school and sports uniforms for basketball.  She also has silk screen and printing services.  She prepares napkins for quinceañeros (girls' 15th birthday parties), baptisms, and first communions.  She started her business 11 years ago, before which she used to work in a sewing workshop making decorative baby items, like diaper bags, crib veils, and linings for baby carriers, which were produced for Liverpool department store.  She inherited a small space of 50 square meters from her father, which is where she has her workshop.  She started with loans and the industrial machines and silk-screen printing were bought from the liquidation of the sewing workshop where she had worked.   Her business is located at her home in Tlayecac.  Señora Antonia participated in a statewide sewing contest where there were 31 participants from several places.  She won first prize, and with it bought 2 industrial machines. 

Her business is important and special as she is able to sustain herself financially.  It is a source of work for her family as her husband sells the aprons that Antonia manufactures, and her adopted daughter also works with her.  She is proud to make the aprons. She started with 8 plastic aprons that could be used for doing the washing without getting wet.  She made these with pieces of left-over plastic that the lady where she worked gave her.  Her husband went to sell them, and they wound up going very fast.  With what she made from the sale she bought more plastic and was able to grow her customers.  Her customers are varied, and she makes aprons in bulk for the tortilla makers, the butchers, the taco makers. 

A challenge facing the business is the climate, as dust enters because the workshop is not finished.   It lacks ironwork, a door, and glass in the windows. The business profits are reinvested, used for food, for repaying the loan and for household expenses. She is planning to expand her workshop.  She wants to buy a computerized embroidery machine and a machine for making buttonholes, and she thinks that with saving and the loan she will be  able to complete this.  The improvements she wants to make to her home are ironwork for her workshop, plastering and putting in glass on the second floor, and tiling the bathroom to expand the workshop.  She sometimes employs more people in the month of December, when she has more work.  She dreams of a having a full workshop and employing more people.  She is very excited about this loan that will be provided, because if she knows how to manage it things will go better for her and she can grow her workshop.  What she wants for the future of her children is that they consider a career or job, and if they like sewing, she will teach them her craft. 

She likes Tlayecac because it was where she was born and raised and the people are very pleasant.  During the rainy season the hill becomes green and the gully grows vegetation.  There are small birds and fungi, and you can go to the countryside for some peace and quiet. 

She wants to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad, "Thank you for giving me the loan because through this I will expand my business, work in my home and be employed.  I can tend to my children with my own business  Thank you very much."

loans.use: Buying raw materials, yarn, needles, oil, closures, springs, parts, fringes, scissors, fabric, lace, ribbon

loans.name: Khana Naira Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “KHANA NAIRA” ( en idioma aymara “ojos claros”) iniciará el ciclo número  uno en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes.  Está compuesta por once integrantes, la banca comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva compuesta por una presidenta, una tesorera y una secretaria de actas.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la banca comunal llevan adelante son variados: taller de carpintería, venta de ropa, servicio de filmación, confección de chamarra, repostería, tienda, confección de chamarras, tejido de mantas, promotora de ventas de productos de Yanbal, venta de detergentes, producción de pitas.

La señora  Dora,  presidenta de la banca comunal esta casada y es madre de dos hijos.  Desde hace diez años tiene como negocio la filmación de eventos sociales, recibe el apoyo de su marido y cuando la demanda es mayor les colabora un amigo de la familia.  El esposo trabaja como camarógrafo de prensa, ese conocimiento dio lugar a la inciativa del negocio que ahora tiene, realiza filmaciones de eventos sociales como matrimonios, bautizos, ch´allas, también viaja a poblaciones cercanas a la ciudad de El Alto.  El crédito que ahora  está solicitando será destinado para la compra de una cámara fotográfica y una impresora de fotos.

La señora Dora está contenta de haber encontrado a Pro Mujer, pues logrará el crédito que necesita con pocos requisitos, siente que hay confianza entre las integrantes del grupo y Pro Mujer.
texts.en: The Khana Naira (in the Aymara language, "blue eyes") group has started its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes office. It is made up of eleven members and directed by a board made up of a president, treasurer and a secretary. The members have various businesses: a carpentry workshop, clothing sales, a filming service, jacket-making, dessert sales, a store, jacket-making, rug making, Yanbal products promoter and salesperson, detergent sales, and pita-making. Dora, the community bank president, is a married mother of two children. She has had a business where she films social events. Her husband supports her, and when there is great demand a family friend helps out. Her husband works as a news cameraman, and his knowledge led to this business. They film social events such as marriages, baptisms and ch'allas. They also travel to villages near to the El Alto city. The loan that she is now requesting will be used for the purchase of a camera and a photo printer. Dora is happy to have encountered Pro Mujer, as she has obtained this loan with few requirements. She feels that there is confidence between the members of the group and Pro Mujer.

loans.use: the purchase of a camera and photo printer

loans.name: Neyler

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Neyler; el tiene 41 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa americana, el socio tiene dos tiendas en la provincia de Urubamba, el socio atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar la tienda de ropa americana. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa americana como pantalones, polos, casacas y zapatos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "Señor de Torrechayoc". The bank is located in the district of Urubamba which belongs to the province of Urumbaba and the department of Cusco.

The member is Neyler. He is 41 years old, is married and has two children. He alternates his daily activities with his business of selling american clothing. He has two stores in the province of Urubamba which he attends to from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm. He wants to expand and improve his business of selling american clothing. He is requesting this loan to purchase american clothing such as pants, polo shirts, coats and shoes. 

The member is happy for this loan and promises to make his loan payments.

loans.use: Purchase american clothing such as pants, polo shirts, coats and shoes.

loans.name: Venera

texts.en:
Venera I. is a 38-year-old villager who lives in the northern part of Kyrgyzstan. She has one daughter. Venera was born into a low-income family, and from early childhood she had to help her parents around the house. After finishing school, in order to find means of subsistence, she started to work as a babysitter. When she got married in 2006, Venera and her husband went to Russia in search of making a living and returned in two years. Using money they had earned there, Venera started a business of selling fruits and vegetables at the local market. Unfortunately, in 2010 a tragedy changed their family plans – Venera’s husband died in an accident. 

When Venera became the only breadwinner for her daughter, she decided to find an additional means of subsistence for her small family. In her local area, cattle breeding is one of the main business activities. Using an initial amount of 5,000 KGS, she bought one milk cow, whose milk she sold to the dairy factory. Now, Venera has two milk cows and one calf at her farm.
 
Venera requests a loan of 60,000 KGS to buy one more milk cow and a bull calf for fattening and reselling. That will allow further development of her household and business. With the revenues, she plans to give a good education to her daughter. 


Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable members of the population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading micro-finance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, it contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro-finance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She own a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanarusi has been operating a café business for the past two years.  She operates at the market, where market goers and school-going children are her potential customers. Mwanarusi faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, Mwanarusi  wants to purchase sacks of sugar, maize flour, wheat flour, vegetables and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, maize flour, wheat flour, vegetables and cooking oil

loans.name: Badengna (La Parente) Group

texts.fr:
Badengna est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Hamdallaye de la ville Koutiala qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans, sont toutes mariées et mères d’au moins  3 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tel, les condiments alimentaires de toutes sortes (les concentrées de tomates, du maggi, ails, épices, du sel, oignon, piments, Sounbala  etc.), les habillements : des pagnes wax, des bazins et brodés ainsi que des habits pour enfants.
 Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a 2 ans. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents  ont été bien remboursés. 
Assan Samaké est un membre du groupe Badengna qui vend exclusivement des condiments.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des condiments de toutes sortes, à Sincina auprès des jardiniers et au grand marché de Koutiala. Elle revend  en détail et au comptant au marché de Hamdallaye à une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Tandis que Les membres du groupe Badengna comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 120 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Assan Samaké compte réaliser 130 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Badengna ("kinship") is a group of women from the Hamdallaye district of the town of Koutiala. They live in traditional extened families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They are on the average 35 years old, are all married and have at least three children each. The group members sell diverse items. such as food condiments of all kinds (tomato concentrate, Maggi bouillion cubes, garlic, spices, salt, onion, peppers, Sounbala [traditional spicy seasoning from fermented seeds or beans]), clothing, wax “pagnes” [traditional colorful fabrics], “basins” [damask-type fabric] and embroidered fabrics as well as children’s outfits. In order to expand their business, two years ago the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program. They are on their fourth group loan, having duly repaid all prior loans. 

Assan Samaké is a member of the Badengna group who sells exclusively condiments. She plans to use her loan in order to purchase different condiments from gardeners in Sincina as well as at the big market of Koutiala. She retails her goods for cash at the Hamdallaye market to a highly diverse customer base. While other members of the Badengna group plan to achieve a monthly income of 120,000 West African francs each at the end of the loan cycle, Assan Samaké plans to earn 130,000. Apart from repaying their loan, the group members use part of the revenue to pay for everyday family needs and to build up their working capital.

loans.use: Purchasing condiments

loans.name: Leab's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of six members. Mrs. Leab was born in 1976, and she is the village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. Each member of this group will use their money to support their different purpose. 
She and her husband, Mr. Mey, are farmers who own a 2.50-hectare plot of land which they use to grow rice. This couple has three children: two attend the local school and the youngest one is 5 years old and not in school yet.  They want to cultivate rice in the dry season, but they do not have enough money to grow it. Thus, Leab would like to ask for a loan to support her farming.

loans.use: to support farming

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
Yanet tiene 25 años de edad,  nació en la ciudad de Urubamba y ahora vive en la misma ciudad donde nació.

Yanet es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia, ella se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía y trabaja en la Asociación Girasoles. Ya son cuatro años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. También Yanet tiene un pequeña carpintería donde trabaja su esposo. Yanet en esta oportunidad requiere el micro crédito para comprar madera.

Yanet pertenece al banco comunal “Kuska Llankasun de Rumichaca” de la Asociación Arariwa  y trabaja con sus compañeras del banco comunal desde hace varios años. (La comunidad Cotowincho se encuentra ubicada a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Urubamba donde los socios se reúnen cada treinta días para realizar sus actividades correspondientes.)
texts.en:
Yanet is 25 years old. She was born in the city of Urubamba and today lives in the same city where she was born.

Yanet is a hardworking and enterprising mother who helps her family move ahead. She works making handcrafts in Asociación Girasoles. She has been working in this business for four years, and it is going very well for her. Yanet also has a small carpentry shop where her husband works. Yanet needs this microloan to buy wood.

Yanet belongs to the “Kuska Llankasun de Rumichaca” communal bank of Asociación Arariwa and has worked with her partners in the communal bank for several years. (The community of Cotowincho is located 10 minutes from Urubamba where the bank members meet every 30 days to carry out their bank activities.)

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Nohemi

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; Este banco está ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac,  provincia de Cusco y  departamento de Cusco.

La Sra. Nohemi, es soltera y tiene 18 años de edad, La socia trabaja junto a su amiga en la tienda de venta de productos de herbalife, ella atiende por las mañanas y por las tardes ella realiza llamadas a celulares para lo cual cuenta con teléfonos celulares y presta el servicio de llamadas a 0.50 céntimos el minuto. La socia solicita el préstamo para poder invertir junto a su amiga en los productos de herbalife y así poder hacerse socios.

 La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "SAN RAFAEL" communal bank which is in the district of Huanchac, in the province and department of Cusco.

Miss Nohemi is single, 18 years old and works with a girlfriend at a store that sells Herbalife products.  She works at the store in the mornings and in the afternoons has a cell phone calling business, charging 0.50 cents a minute to make calls.  She plans to use the loan to buy Herbalife products and set up business with her friend.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy Herbalife products and set up business with a friend

loans.name: Rumbidzai Group

texts.en:
Portia N. is the leader of the Rumbidzai Group. She is 35 years old and married with two children, aged 7 and 14.  Both children are still attending school. She also has two other dependants to support. She trades clothing and grocery items in Donga-Shurugwi, a remote area that is about 35 km from the town of Gweru. She has three years of business experience. She gets additional income from her husband, who is a cross-border trader. 

Portia requested this loan through MicroKing to buy clothes for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help improve her business prospects, opportunities and profits. She hopes to see her business grow and become fully mature. 

Note: Portia N. is the lady with a head scarf in the picture’s front row.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: Irene, de 33 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 4 queridos hijos y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro, para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El puesto de venta de ropa de Irene, esta ubicado en uno de los mercados más importantes del distrito de Ventanilla en Lima, ella vende ropa americana y es muy buena vendedora, puesto que siempre convence a sus clientes de comprarle más de un prenda de vestir. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta sin poder salir a la calle. En adelante, espera poder juntar el dinero necesario para poner una tienda de ropa, por lo que espera de su ayuda para concretar sus objetivos. Este es el primer préstamo con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo, para no meter en problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ropa, ya que desea implementar mejor su puesto de ventas.
texts.en: Irene is 33 years old and is a very friendly and hardworking woman.  She lives in a house that she owns with her four children and what she wants most is to work hard in order to provide them with a better quality of life.  Irene’s clothing stand is located in one of the most important markets in the District of Ventanilla in Lima.  She sells clothing from the United States and is a very good saleswoman, as she always convinces her customers to buy more than one item.  What she likes most about her work is talking with the neighboring saleswomen.  She has been in this business for eight years and considers the most difficult part to be having to stay at her sales stand for the entire day without leaving.  In the future, she hopes to be able to gather enough money to set up a clothing store, which is why she seeks your help to reach her goals.  This is her first loan with MFP and she knows that she has to make her payments on time in order to not cause problems for the other members of her communal bank, where she is very well-liked.  With the 1,500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) requested, she will buy more clothing, as she wants to improve her clothing stand.

loans.use: to buy more clothing items.

loans.name: Laura Margoth

texts.es:
Laura de 50 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución). Su esposo es chofer de un bus y tiene dos hijos uno ya es independiente y el otro todavía esta en colegio particular. Su actividad es la venta de comida.

Comenzó hace un tiempo atrás viendo que no tenia competencia y ningún restaurante por el sector lo abrió en su casa, lo realiza con una ayudante de 9H00 am a 3H00 pm. Le dificulta la inseguridad en el sector por la delincuencia. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar mas mercadería para la preparación de los almuerzos. Ella anhela tener un restaurante mas grande y poder comprarse su propio vehículo.
texts.en:
Laura, 50, lives in the Primavera de Duran (city outskirts that used to be undeveloped, with some hills, creeks, and lagoons that still seem like a decaying natural area). Her husband is a bus driver and they have two children, one living on his own, and the other  in a private school.  Her business is selling food.

She began a while ago since she had noticed that there weren‘t any restaurants in her area, so no competition.  She opened one in her house and she works every day with a helper from 9 am to 3 pm.  What is hard for her is the lack of safety in the area due to the crime there.  She will use the loan to buy supplies to make lunches and her goal is to have a bigger restaurant and to buy her own vehicle.

loans.use: To buy restaurant supplies such as rice, sugar, and meat

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a thirty-seven-year-old hardworking married man with two children, living in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. For six years he has been brewing alcohol and is also in the transport sector after diverting from bricklaying, which he had practiced for ten years.
