Her credit history qualifies her as a Level 1 client, which means she has an excellent payment record and is eligible to access this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics, perfumes, and other types of beauty products

loans.name: Ol

texts.en: Mrs. Ol H. is a 27 year old married woman and she is a villager who lives in Tuol Kandal Tonle village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Pen Keo, are farmers who own 2-hectares of land to cultivate rice and they are also farmers who work very hard to support their family living. With the farm, they face a problem because they do not have enough money to support it. Thus, Mrs. Ol H. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer, rice see, and to pay for hire laborers to plow the farm and to pay for hirer farming laborers to cultivate rice. Aside from farmer, Mr. Pen Keo is also construction worker who is able to receive a little salary to hold up his family.  This couple has two children, one in a student and another one is 5 years old. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, rice see, and to pay for hire laborers to plow the farm and to pay for hirer farming laborers to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Evelyn Anyango

texts.en:
Evelyn Anyango is a 30 year old lady from Kisumu City who is married to Norbert Oduor. They have two daughters, Sylivia, nine years old and Grace, three years old. They live at Brilliant estate in the heart of Kisumu city.

Evelyn runs a water business, whereby she sells water to residents within her estate. Selling water in Kisumu city is big business due to a scarcity of the commodity in the area. Due to this fact, Evelyn has a ready market for her business. She makes a monthly income of KES 12,000 ($152). She is taking her first loan from Kadet Limited and she plans to use this money to buy better water pipes for her business. Evelyn will also use part of the money to expand her other business, second hand clothing.

Evelyn describes herself as an ambitious lady and her great ambition in the future is to buy water tanks for water storage during dry season. She also wants her two daughters to have access to better education.

loans.use: To buy better water pipes for the business.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob J., age 51, is a farmer. He sells his farm produce in order to earn a living. He is applying for a loan from Kadet Ltd. in order to buy a "My Sunshine Box," an electrical product that will help him to light his home more efficiently. At present, Jacob’s family uses lantern lamps for lighting, and this is highly cumbersome for them. The children struggle considerably when doing their homework at night. He is eager for the day when electricity will be installed in his rural home. 

Jacob has serviced a loan before with Kadet Ltd., and he paid it off promptly and without any difficulties.

Jacob is married to Margaret Odongo and they have four children, all of whom are under 18 years of age and all of whom attend school. The family lives in a rural area called Ngiya.

loans.use: To buy a "My Sunshine Box" for home lighting purposes

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr:
Madame ROSE G. est une femme de 82 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants majeurs. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NGASCOP depuis son inauguration il y a de cela 14 ans. Elle a 28 fois de suite reçu de crédit et a toujours remboursé sans difficulté. 

Elle est éleveuse de porcs. A cause de son âge avancé, elle est aidée par ses enfants pour bien mener cette activité qu'elle pratique depuis plus de 20 ans

Avec son crédit elle va acheter 30 pourceaux à raison de 15.000 francs cfa, et de la nourriture pour leurs alimentation.

Son objectif est de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels, renforcer son épargne et participer à la prise en charge financière de la famille.
texts.en:
Rose G. is an 82 year old woman. She is married and she is the mother of 6 grown children. She has been a member of the Community Bank NGASCOP (Kiva field Partner) since its inception 14 years ago. She has attained 28 past loans and she always repaid the funds without any trouble. She is a pig farmer. Because she is an elderly person she gets help from her children in running the business, one that she has had for more than 20 years. With the help of this loan she will purchase 30 piglets at 15 francs and she will also purchase feed for them. Her goal is to be able to provide for her own needs, to save money, and contribute to the family's finances.

Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 30 piglets.

loans.name: Cheang

texts.en:
Mrs. Cheang S., age 36, has established a small family home located in Kompong Tom province where she lives with other family members. Her family has four kids, two of whom are employed and the other two attend school.

To share responsibility for her family, Cheang S. owns a cart that she uses to sell bean juice in and around her community. She is able to make $4 of profit a day to be used to control the financial problems of her family. She always gets help from her husband in producing the bean juice.

Cheang S. wants to own a motorbike to connect with her existing cart so that she can sell to people farther away. As she doesn’t have the money to buy one, she needs a loan in the amount of $900 to buy a used motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle for her business

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor es soltero, vive en el barrio Obrero de la ciudad de Pilar.
Vive en casa de sus padres, donde se refleja que poseen con todas las comodidades para una familia trabajadora.
El mismo es comerciante, cuenta con una  empresa de ventas de todos tipos de mercaderías en general, ropas, accesorios , juegos de azar en  general, su rubro es comprar las mercaderias y los comercializa en la ciudad de pilar y ciudades vecinas, dicho trabajo lo realiza en su motocicleta recorriendo la zona, a cada unas de sus clientes.
Solicita el crédito para compras de mercaderías para su negocio como: ropas, calzados,  juguetes y otros.
Cuenta con una antigüedad en el ramo más de 15 años, brindando sus buenos servicios a sus clientelas.
Cliente manifiesta que con la ayuda del crédito se ha fortalecido  mas su microempresa y  agradece por los buenos servicios que les brinda la fundación paraguaya y kiva.
texts.en:
He is single and lives in the Obrero neighborhood in the city of Pilar in his parents’ house where they have all the comforts typical of a hard working family.

He is a merchant.  He has a company where he sells all kinds of general merchandise:  clothing, accessories, games of chance in general.  He operates buying merchandise and then reselling it in the city of Pilar and adjoining cities.  He does this work moving from place to place on his motorcycle to visit his customers.

He is requesting funds to buy merchandise like: clothes, footwear, toys and others.

He has 15 years experience in this line of work providing his customers with good service.

He states that with help from the loan he has strengthened his micro business and he is grateful for the services that Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva provide.

loans.use: To buy merchandise like: clothes, footwear and toys.

loans.name: Digna Isabel

texts.es:
Digna de 52 años, tiene una pequeña papelería en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos.  

Ella comenzó como comerciante informal hace dos años atrás con poco capital y mercadería con los ingresos que tenia construyo un local en la parte delantera de su casa para un mejor venta de su mercadería. Compro vitrinas, papelería, bebidas para vender a sus vecinos. En la actualidad por la buena acogida que tubo su negocio trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar ropa para impletar vender en su local y papeleria. En el futuro quiere tener su negocio mas grande para tener mas ingresos y que su hija de 17 años pueda ingresar a la Universidad con éxito.
texts.en:
Digna is 52 years old.  She owns a small stationery shop on the outer part of her house.  She lives in a canton called Playas, one of the tourist stops in Ecuador with a diverse variety of seafood.  

She started as an informal business woman two years ago with a small amount of capital and merchandise. With her earnings, she placed her shop at the front of her house in order to increase her sales.  She bought display cabinets, stationery, and drinks to sell to her neighbors.  Nowadays, due to her well-known reputation in the area, she works every day from 8am until 8pm.  

With this loan, she wants to purchase clothes to sell at her shop.  In the future, she hopes to successfully expand her business in order to increase her earnings and be able to pay for her 17 year-old daughter to attend university.

loans.use: Clothes & Stationery items.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” ubicado en la provincia de Azángaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 63 años de edad, de estado civil  casada y tiene 02 hijos independientes, la señora estudió solo hasta primero de educación primaria.

Viene  trabajando con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos  desde hace 03 años, su  primer   préstamo  fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio de venta de abarrotes.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar arroz, azúcar y fideos para su tienda.

Su sueño para el futuro  es mejorar su tienda y sobre todo sus ingresos.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la facilidad del préstamo y lo que gana por sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Adriana is a member of the “Punta Sahuacasi” community bank which is located in Azángaro province, in the department of Puno.  She is 63 years old, married and has 2 grown-up children.  She only studied up to the first year of her primary education.

Adriana has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Rosa for 3 years.  Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles which she used to increase her working capital for her business selling groceries.

She is requesting a new loan for 2,000 nuevos soles.  She will use the money to buy rice, sugar and noodles for her store.

Her dream for the future is to improve her store and, above all, her income.

What she most likes about her community bank is the ease with which she can obtain loans and what she earns in her savings.

loans.use: To buy sugar, noodles and other groceries

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es la Sr. Rosendo; el tiene 58 años de edad, soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de cereales como lentejas, maíz, entre otros. El socio viaja hasta la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado a distribuir su mercadería a sus clientes, el permanece por allá de dos a tres días. 

El  socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de más insumos para su negocio y asi poder distribuir a todos sus clientes.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Rosendo is a member of the “Vamos Juntos” [Let’s Go Together] communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, province of Cusco, and department of Cusco.

Rosendo is 58 years old and single. His daily activities alternate between the buying and selling of lentils, corn, and other cereal grains. He travels to the city of Puerto Maldonado to distribute to his clients and may stay there for two to three days.

Rosendo is seeking a loan to purchase more grains to sell to his clients. He is grateful to all those who make this dream possible and promises to make his payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: Purchase cereal grains to sell.

loans.name: Lorena Jesenia

texts.es:
Lorena de 32 años, vende formulario del SRI (servicios de rentas internas del Ecuador). Vive en una casa de caña con sus dos hijos en una zona periurbana caracterizada por caminos de tierra y lomas llamada Fortín.   

Por la falta de empleo y la desesperante idea de mantener a sus dos hijos ella comenzó a recorrer las calles de Guayaquil buscando trabajo. Un día paso por el SRI y vio que muchas personas no sabían llenar formularios de impuesto, ella tuvo la idea de aprender todos los detalles de los formularios y comenzar a enseñarle a las personas llenándolos y vendiendo los formularios que compraba a un barato costo. Poco a poco fue conocida por las personas. En la actualidad ella vende y llena los formularios desde las 09h00am. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar formularios de declaración de impuestos. En el futuro quiere tener un local establecido ya que ahora solo lo hace ambulantemente.
texts.en:
Lorena, 32, sells SRI (Ecuadorean Internal Revenue Service) forms.  She lives in a house made from sugar cane stalks with her two children in a hilly periurban area known for its unpaved streets called Fortín.   

Due to lack of employment and the desperate need to support her children she started to traverse Guayaquil’s streets looking for work.  One day she passed in front of the SRI office and saw that many people did not know how to fill out their tax forms.  She got the idea to learn all the details about the forms and to start teaching people how to fill them out and selling the forms that she bought at low cost.  Gradually she became known by the people.  She currently sells and fills out the forms starting at 9am.

She will use the loan to buy tax declaration forms.  In the future she’d like to have an established locale because she currently has no fixed place to work.

loans.use: For forms.

loans.name: Sayda Silvia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “OLLANTAY II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sayda Silvia; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza, ella vende en forma independiente llevando a diferentes lugares como instituciones, ella vende perfumes, lápiz labiales, polvos y esmaltes, la socia quiere tener una tienda donde vender los cosméticos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de belleza al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This associate is a member of the OLLANTAY II communal bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

Sayda Silvia is 39 years old, married, and has three children.  She sells beauty products by taking them to different points of sale, such as offices.  She sells perfumes, lipsticks, powders, and nail polish.  Some day she would like to have her own store where she can sell her products.  She is asking for this loan in order to buy beauty products in quantity.

She is grateful for this loan and is committed to making all of her payments.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Lourdesita

texts.en: Lourdesita N.'s main source of income comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in her community. She is 52 years old, married and has eight grown-up children. She is from the village of Punta, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. Lourdesita has been in her fishing business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Lourdesita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lourdesita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. This will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Adela Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Adela tiene 60 años con  2 hijos menores de edad que está a su cargo. Ella se dedica a una pulpería en su casa de habitación, Allí vende desde granos básicos hasta golosinas para llamar la atención de los clientes que habitan cerca. Esta no es la primera vez que tiene financiamientos para su negocio. Ella ya tiene 14 años de dedicarse a este negocio, empezó vendiendo solamente golosinas, el negocio ha podido ir prosperando y así convertirlo en una pulpería más grande. Este crédito será invertido en la compra de granos básicos tal como arroz, fríjol, azúcar y aceite principalmente. Su sueño es llegar a ver su negocio con más productos, más surtido con productos que demanda la población, para brindar más facilidades económicas a sus hijos y que puedan prepararse en la universidad.
texts.en:
Adela is 60 and has 2 young children under her care. She has a general store in her home. There she sells everything from basic grains to candies, in order to capture the attention of the customers who live nearby. This is not her first loan for her business. She has had this business for 14 years. She started off only selling candies. Her business prospered, and so she was able to convert it into a larger general store. 

This loan will be invested mainly in the purchase of basic grains such as rice, and beans, sugar and oil. Her dream is to see her business stocked with more products that are in demand in order to offer her children more economic benefits. She hopes that they will be able to attend university.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Magarita

texts.es: Margarita se dedica al destace de cerdo. Tiene más 60 años, la ubicación de su negocio es en las afueras del mercado. Ella tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación y se siente muy contenta de ser una buena cliente. La mayoría de sus clientes saben que ofrece un buen servicio con sus productos y que la calidad es muy buena. Este crédito es para la compra de cerdos, pues actualmente no tiene mucho capital.
texts.en: Margarita is a pig butcher.  She is more than 60 years old.  Her business is located on the outskirts of the market.  She has worked with the Foundation for a long time and is very happy about being a good client.  The majority of her customers know that she offers a good service with her products and that her quality is very good.  This loan is to buy pigs, since she does not currently have much capital.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Saf Nieup Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité SAF NIEUP est créé depuis un an et demi. Il est composé de 29 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de THIO ADI

Madame Khady S. debout au milieu du groupe sur la photo et mise en médaillon est responsable du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. elle a aussi la charge de deux autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des proches. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de lait caillé. Trois fois par semaine elle se rend dans les grandes villes telles que Rufisque pour vendre du lait caillé. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de 20 ans.

Elle soutient son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille: par exemple le payement des fournitures scolaires pour les enfants. Elle participe également aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille
texts.en:
The SAF NIEUP solidarity group was created a year and a half ago. It consists of 29 women, all from the same village. The group is part of the Banc Villageois of THIO ADI.

Mrs. Khady S. is the head of the group. She appears in the photo standing in the center of the group, and also inset. She is married with five children, and also looks after two other children who have been entrusted to her care.  

She has a small business selling milk curd. Three times a week, she travels to large cities such as Rufisque to sell milk curd. She has been doing this for over 20 years. 

She assists her husband with the family responsibilities including the payment of school supplies for the children. She also helps with the daily expenses.

loans.use: To sustain her small business of milk curd sales

loans.name: Grace Wambui

texts.en:
Grace Wambui is a 58-year-old widow with seven children between the ages of 35 and 21. She has worked a horticulture farm for a period of about ten years with an income of about $38 per month.

This is her 4th loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous loans well and on time. She intends to use the loan to buy fertilizers such as manure. She hopes to be a leading horticulture farmer and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en:
This loan is for a group of ten people. Miss San has been selected by the group members as the leader of the group. Each member of this group will use his/her portion of the loan to support a different purpose. 

San was born in 1968. She is a widow with five children: one is a farmer, two are laborers, and the others two are students who also support their mother's farming activities.

San is a farmer who owns a 3-hectare plot of land, on which she cultivates rice and corn for a living. She does not have enough money to cover the operational expenses associated with this farming. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and gasoline to support her farming business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, and gasoline

loans.name: Las Hijas De Dios Group

texts.es:
El Grupo las Hijas de Dios lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoas ellas son Maria Elena Z. B.,Gissel de La Cruz S. R. y Veronica Sereaphia M. O.. Este es su primer credito en Adim el cual invertiran en sus negocios con el firme propocito de crecer.

La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Z. quien se dedica al comercio de ropa desde hace varios años, ella inicio con una doce actualmente vende un poco más de camisas, pantalones, blusas. Con el credito invertirá en ropa para la temporada de verano.

Las otras integrantes del grupo doña Gissel La Cruz S. R. vende bisuteria de todo tipo y  Veronica Sereaphia M. O. vende cosméticos y perfumes.
texts.en:
The Grupo Las Hijas de Dios (God’s Daughters Group) is composed of three hardworking women: Maria Elena Z. B., Gissel De La Cruz S. R. and Veronica Sereaphia M. O.. This is their first loans with Adim, and they will invest it in their activities with the firm intent to make them grow.

Ms. Z. is the coordinator of the group and she has been engaging in clothes sales for many years. When she started her activity, her stall had only a dozen items, but nowadays she has a few more  shirts, pants and blouses to sell. With the loan, she will invest in clothing for the summer season.

As for the other members of the group, Silvia sells costume jewelry of every fashion and Ms. M. sells cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.use: to buy shirts, trousers, blouses and other items of clothing.

loans.name: Constance

texts.fr:
Agée de 46ans, Constance est mère de 5enfants qui sont âgée entre 8 et 17ans.
La vente dans la friperie est une question familiale chez elle car sa défunte grand-mère et mère ont exercées ce commerce .Elle a commence en 2005 avec un capital de 80.000.
 Elle est toujours vendeuse des friperies et a bénéficier des deux premier prêt de Hope Congo qu’elle a  remboursée sans défauts de payement. Ses ventes journalières sont de 100.000F à 150.000F.
Avec ce troisième prêt, elle va acheter 1ballot de serviette fin de série, 1ballot de draps non utilisés, 1ballot de sac à main, 1ballot de grands rideaux.
Son souhait, croitre son commerce, vendre les articles de qualités satisfaisants, faire plus de bénéfice et réalisée ses projets de devenir grossiste ou fournisseur de ballots de friperie un jour.
L’éducation de ses enfants lui préoccupé et veut les soutenir jusqu’au niveau d’études supérieurs.
texts.en:
Constance is 46 years old and the mother of five children ranging from 8 to 17 years old. She sells second-hand clothing, just as her late grandmother and her mother also used to do. She started her activity in 2005 with a capital of 80,000F.

She previously obtained two loans from Hope Congo, which she repaid without difficulty. Her daily sales range from 100,000F to 150,000F.

With this third loan, she will buy one bale of discontinued towels, one bale of unused sheets, one bale of handbags, and one bale of large curtains. 

She wishes to expand her business, sell good quality merchandise, increase her profits, and achieve her goal of becoming a wholesaler or a supplier of bales of used clothing. 

She cares about her children’s education and plans to support them in pursuing advanced studies.

loans.use: to buy bales of curtains, handbags, sheets, towels

loans.name: Katleen

texts.es: Katleen, de 21 años, es una mujer muy humilde y trabajadora, vive en casa de su hermana junto a su esposo Robert de 23 años y su querida hija Said de 2 meses a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Katleen tiene una pequeña librería en la Zona del Zapallal del Distrito de Puente Piedra, ella vende cuadernos, lapiceros, plumones, etc. Ahora se encuentra vendiendo lo último en útiles escolares, ya que quiere aprovechar el inicio de clases en los distintos centros educativos de la ciudad. Para ella los más difícil de su trabajo, es saber que producto se venderá más, aun así disfruta mucho de ofrecer a sus clientes las cosas que tiene en su librería, tiene ya 2 años en esta actividad y anhela ver crecer su librería y que se vuelva la principal de su barrio, ya que así podrá mejorar sus ingresos económicos y cambiar su vida para bien. Es el tercer crédito con MFP, ella ha pagado puntualmente sus anteriores créditos y este último espera pagarlo a tiempo también, en su banco comunal es muy participativa. Con los setecientos nuevos soles solicitados, implementará mejor su librería, para así tener más productos que ofrecerles a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Katleen, 21, is a humble and hardworking woman. She and her husband Robert, 23, and their darling daughter Said, 2 months, live together in her sister's home. She wants to give them a better quality of life. Katleen has a small bookstore in the zone of Zapallal in the district of Puente Piedra. She sells notebooks, pens, markers, etc. Now she is selling the latest in school supplies, since she wants to take advantage of the beginning of classes in the different educational centers of the city. 

For her, the hardest part of her job is knowing which product will sell better. Even so, she enjoys offering her customers the items that she has in the bookstore. She has been doing this for two years now and wants to grow the store and become the main one in her neighborhood so that she can improve her income and change her life for the better. This is her third credit with MFP. She has paid the other loans punctually and expects to do so with this one as well. She is very participative in her village bank. With the 700 nuevos soles that she has requested, she will improve her bookstore so that she can have more products to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy products to improve her bookstore.

loans.name: Fernando Antonio

texts.es: EL SEÑOR FERNANDO LABORA COMO COLECTOR, ES ACOMPAÑADO, TIENE CUATRO  PERSONA A SU CARGO, ES EL SEPTIMO CREDITO QUE CEPRODEL LE OTORGA, LO NECESITA PARA INVERTIRLO EN MEJORA DE SU VIVIENDA EN CONSTRUIR UN ANEXO PARA LA COCINA, EN COMPRA DE ARENA, BLOQUE, CEMENTO, HIERRO, ESTRIBO, EL PAGO DE LA MANO DE OBRA, AGRADECE EL APOYO QUE  ESTA INSTITUCION LE BRINDA.
texts.en: Mr. Fernando works as a collector, is accompanied and in charge of four people. This is the seventh loan that CEPRODEL offers him. He needs it to improve his home by building an attachment to his kitchen therefore will need to buy sand, cement, iron, buttresses, and pay for manual work. He is thankful for the support being offered by the institution.

loans.use: buy sand, cement, iron, buttresses, and pay for manual work for house improvements.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es: Luis Fernando de 33 años es el propietario de la Tienda las Tres Ave Marías, ubicada en el barrio que lleva este mismo nombre, donde vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en las edades de 2 a 13 años; él es oriundo del sector rural,  específicamente de OIBA en el departamento de Santander y hace 7 años se radicó en la ciudad de Barranquilla con su familia y para generar ingresos alquiló una tienda y con el producto de sus ahorros,  logró comprarla y también estructurar una  clientela acreditada, mientras él  goza de gran aprecio en el sector.  Su meta más adelante es convertir su tienda en un autoservicio y comprar el local donde funciona y aunque su mayor desafío es la competencia, pues hay varias tiendas en el sector, él se esmera por ser el mejor empresario y  con  un buen servicio lograr el sostenimiento de su clientela;  mientras  Luis Fernando le aporta a su sueño,  continua trabajando con un margen de utilidad no menor del 18%, que planea continuar aumentando con sus esfuerzos y comenzando con éste, su primer financiamiento   a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará víveres para mejorar el surtido y aumentar las ventas
texts.en: Luis Fernando is 33 years old and the owner of the “Tres Ave Marias” store located in the neighborhood that has the same name. His wife and three children live there. The children are from 2 to 13 years old. Luis Fernando is from a rural area, specifically from OIBA in the Satandar Department. Seven years ago he moved to Baranquilla City with his family. In order to generate income he rented a store and with his savings he was able to buy the location. He has a customer base that buys on credit. The real estate in this area has appreciated. His future goals are to convert his store into a fast food market and buy the location of the store. His major challenge is the competition. There are many stores in the area. He struggles to be the best business and with his good service he has maintained his customer base. While Luis Fernando supports his dreams, he continues working with a profit margin of 18 percent. He plans to continue growing his business, and, beginning with this loan from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, he will buy food supplies in order to provide a wider assortment of goods and increase his sales.

loans.use: to buy food supplies in order to expand his offerings.

loans.name: Fazli

texts.en: Fazli is a 41-year-old woman. She is married and has two children. Fazli sells men's breeches, shorts and underwear in the local market of Isfara. She purchases her goods from Khujand and Istaravshan cities. Her husband and son help her trade when she goes for the purchase of goods. Fazli would like to get a loan of 6,000 TJS for purchasing a new assortment of goods in order to expand her business and improve her living conditions. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of clothes

loans.name: Muteleu

texts.en:
Muteleu  is 35 years old. He is married and supports four people in the family. He is a farmer and he does maize farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last four years.

He learned about KADET through another registered client. He has been a good client and this will be his third loan which he is planning to use to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers, seeds and farming tools. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming and also to pay school fees for his children.

His dream is do large-scale farming and attain financial independence. He is a conscientious man who is determined to achieve his set goals in life.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers, seeds and farming tools

loans.name: Felipa Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Felipa Jesus es casada, tiene  30 años de edad, curso sus estudios de educación primaria, tiene 5 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a los oficios domésticos como también a la reventa de canastillas de plásticos, lleva 1 años de experiencia en este trabajo, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo quien se dedica a la venta de madera.

Solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de canastillas ara volver a venderlos y obtener mejores ganancias, ya que espera que este negocio crezca y mejores por medio de sus ganancias, su condición de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Felipa Jesus is married and she is 30 years old. She attended primary school. She has 5 children, all of whom are studying. She is a homemaker, and she also sells plastic baskets. She has 1 year of experience in this work. Her husband helps out; he works in selling wood.

She is requesting a loan that will help her to buy baskets so she can sell them and have improved income. She hopes this business will grow and that the income from it will improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy baskets for re-sale.

loans.name: Jean Seraphin

texts.fr:
Homme de 45ans, marié et père d’un enfant  âgé de 14ans, ayant quitté ses études universitaires après l’obtention de sa licence, il se lance dans la vente des poulets, des cotes de porcs, cartons de tripes, ailes de dindes et en  2009 il ouvre une boucherie. Son revenu journalier est de 30000 à 45000 frs par jour. 

Avec ce  prêt il  aimera agrandir son activité en achetant de 10 cartons de cuisse de poulets, 5 cartons de tripes 2 cartons de ailes de poulets.

Sa stratégie est de faire des promotions de ses produits, faire des prix abordables, et ceux en dépit de la concurrence des vendeurs sur le marché. 

Son ambition est d’épargner et  s’autofinancer afin d’étendre dans la ville et elargir ses affaires . Il veut beaucoup epargner et a la longue  aimerait aussi s'inscrire au cours de promotion, faire des hautes études de gestion  pour un bon emploi afin de mieux subvenir au besoin de sa famille.
texts.en:
This man is 45 years old, and is married with one 14 year-old child. He left university after receiving his diploma and became a butcher in 2009, selling chicken, pork ribs, tripe and turkey wings. He generates sales between 30,000 and 45,000 FRS a day. 

He would use this loan to purchase 10 boxes of chicken thighs, 5 boxes of tripe and 2 boxes of chicken wings. 

His business strategy is to offer these goods at reasonable, promotional prices to beat competitors at the local market. 

His goal is to put savings aside and fund the expansion of his business in his local town. His longer-term goal is to enrol in a marketing course and to study for a business degree in preparation for a good job that will enable him to see to his family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase five boxes of tripe, 10 boxes of pork ribs, 5 boxes of turkey wings, and 10 boxes of chickens

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy is married with no children. She is 33 years old and lives in Tangub City. For the past ten years, Daisy has operated a general store to earn a living. Each month, she earns 8,000 PHP from her business. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more inventory for her general store. Daisy has been a member of PMPC since earlier this year. In the future, Daisy hopes that she will be able to expand her little general store.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her general store

loans.name: Melecio

texts.en:
This is Melecio, 22, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. He is single and manages his own home while operating a business. He works hard to sustain himself and continually provide income for his everyday expenses.

Melecio is a fish vendor. He buys different kinds of fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. His store is located in a temporary fish market. There are many patrons who prefer Melecio’s products since they are assured of its freshness and cleanliness; they regularly anticipate his fish. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of PHP 400 in sales every day. To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000. He will be using the loan to buy more fish to sell every day. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Melecio hopes that his business will continue to be successful. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week, and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional fish

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
Karla, es originaria de Santa Rosa del Peñón municipio de León, tiene 33 años de edad, esta casada, madre de tres hijos, ella es comerciante tiene una tienda de ropa. Inicio su negocio hace un año pero anteriormente ya se dedicaba a la comercialización de ropa, pero de manera ambulante al no colocar alguna mercadería la distribuía en su casa y se dio cuenta que la podía vender en su propio vecindario, entonces compro de vitrinas, luego 2 estantes y cuando se dio cuenta ya tenia una mini tienda de ropa siendo este su primer negocio y medio de subsistencia. 
Solicito el préstamo para comprar mercadería en general como camisas sport de hombre  de mujer, pantalones, carteras, bolsos y maniquíes para dar una mejor presentación a su negocio. Con esta inversión  quiere amplia su mercadería, hacerla mas atractiva al ofrecer variedad de ropa. Su meta es ampliar mas su tienda y ofrecer calidad y variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Karla, originally from Santa Rosa del Peñón municipality of León, is 33 years old, married, and mother of three children.  She owns a clothing store.  She started her business a year ago, although before that she used to sell clothing as a street vendor and also sold from her home.  She realized that she could sell in her own neighborhood so she bought display windows and later two racks. Before she realized she had a mini store which was her first business and her way of making a living.
She is requesting the loan to buy general merchandise such as sport shirts for men and women, pants, wallets, bags and mannequins to give a better appearance to her business.  With this investment she wants to increase her merchandise, and make it more attractive with the offer of a larger variety of clothing.  Her goal is to expand her store and offer better quality and variety of products.

loans.use: to purchase general merchandise such as sport shirts for men and women, pants, wallets, bags and mannequins.

loans.name: Mame

texts.en: Mame is a single parent taking care of 2 children. She has been through junior high school. Mame sells varieties of items such as raw rice, beans, cooking oil, tomatoes and clothing at Kukwa, which she has done for 10 years. Demand for her clothing has increased and she needs a loan to buy other types of clothing to resell. Her future plan towards her business is to build a shop one day. Any profit that will be realized from the business will be reinvested back into the business and to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy other types of clothing to resell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy, 35, is married and has one child who is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Mercy has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years.

Mercy requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her stall.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Japaraly

texts.ru:
Жапаралы родился в городе Букара (Чуйская область, Кыргызская республика). Женат и воспитывает четверых детей. 
Жапаралы родился в простой и многодетной семье фермера. С детства Жапаралы помогал отцу по уходу за большим хозяйством, так как отец параллельно  работал водителем в местном колхозе, и поэтому ему нужна была помощь по уходу за скотом.
Окончив школу, Жапаралы отправляется служить в армию. В 1989 году, отслужив, Жапаралы женился и в этом же году поступил в торговый техникум. Отучившись два года, он устраивается на работу продавцом в универмаг, а затем в мясокомбинат охранником. В то время Жапаралы с женой жили с родителями. В 1993 году было решено отделиться от родителей и Жапаралы со своей семьёй переезжает в кошару родственников в село Сарго (Панфиловский  район, Кыргызстан). К тому времени у него уже было двое детей. Он ухаживал за скотом родственника, а так же приумножал свой скот в этой же кошаре, так как там были благоприятные условия для их содержания и разведения. Прожив в кошаре 6 лет и приумножив поголовье собственного скота, Жапаралы решает вернуться жить к родителям, так как он был младшим сыном, а по традициям кыргызов младший сын обязан ухаживать за престарелыми родителями. На тот момент у него уже было несколько дойных коров и телят. В 2009 году Жапаралы, распродав часть скота, купил однокомнатную квартиру в городе Карабалта.
 В данное время, благодаря предприимчивости и упорству Жапаралы в хозяйстве насчитывается 2 дойные коровы, 7 быков и 15 овец. Для дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, Жапаралы обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. В бизнес - планах у Жапаралы -  увеличение своей фермы.
texts.en: Japaraly was born in the town of Bukara (Chuysk region, Kyrgyz Republic).  He is married and is raising four children.  Japaraly was born into a simple and large family of a farmer.  Since childhood, he helped his father to take care of a large farm, especially because his father also worked as a driver at the local collective farm and needed help to take care of livestock.  After graduating from school, Japaraly went to serve in the army.  In 1989, Japaraly got married after returning from the army and also started attending a retail college that same year.  He spent two years in college and then got a job as a salesperson at a department store, and then as a security guard at a meat processing plant.  At that time, Japaraly and his wife lived with the parents.  They decided to move out of the parents' home in 1993, and Japaraly and his family moved to their relatives' farm in the Sargo village (Panfilovsk district, Kyrgyzstan).  At that time, they already had two children.  Japaraly took care of his relatives' livestock and also increased the quantity of his own livestock at this same farm because it had suitable conditions for keeping and breeding livestock.  Having lived on this farm for six years and increasing the quantity of his own livestock, Japaraly decided to return to live with the parents because he was their youngest son.  According to Kyrgyz traditions, the youngest son has to take care of his aging parents.  At that time, he had several dairy cows and calves.  In 2009, having sold some of the livestock, Japaraly bought a one-bedroom apartment in the town of Karabalta.  Currently, thanks to his entrepreneurship and persistence, Japaraly has two dairy cows, seven bulls and fifteen sheep.  In order to further expand his business, Japaraly requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy livestock.  Japaraly plans to expand his farm.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: Solomon wants a loan to buy a motorcycle. He is a 28-year-old married man with three children living in Masindi, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family rests on him. His desire is to educate his children up to university level. For three years now, he has provided motorcycle transportation. This has enabled him to provide the basics for his family. His challenge is having to remit 70% of his daily income to the motorcycle owner. His dream is to buy his own motorcycle and to construct a commercial house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase both cheese and meat.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en: Winfred is a 43 year old businesswoman. She is married to Paul, who is a farmer. They are blessed with 6 adult children. Winfred has been selling cereals for the past seven years, and earns a monthly income of KES 8,000, which she uses to support her family. She is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD after being introduced to KADET by a staff member. She will use the money to buy dry maize and beans to add to her stock. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hope is to buy some commercial land.

loans.use: To buy dry maize and beans to add to her stock

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica, de 20 años, es una joven mujer, amable, trabajadora y emprendedora, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene un niño de dos años. Vive en una casa propia a lado de su pareja y su menor hijo, todos los días trabaja mucho para poder brindarle lo mejor a su menor hijo además de brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
El trabajo de Jessica consiste ene la preparación y venta de cebiche (plato típico), es socia de una cebichería de la ciudad, junto a su madre quien es la dueña de la cebichería en un 70%, trabajan todos los días. El local esta en casa de su madre en donde ella va a diario para trabajar desde muy temprano ya que debe ir al puerto de la ciudad en busca de los pescados más frescos y con mejores condiciones. Se inicio con este trabajo siendo la ayudante de su madre, pero en base a mucho esfuerzo fue teniendo mas responsabilidades y así pudo obtener un porcentaje del negocio. Lleva cinco años trabajando así y le esta yendo muy bien, tanto así que pudo comprar su casa y tiene muchas cosas logradas con su trabajo. Al principio le fue complicado en este negocio pero ahora le va muy bien y tiene muchas proyecciones a seguir creciendo, ella como toda joven mujer con ganas de superación, desea mas adelante poner una ferretería en su casa, pero sabe que necesita mucha inversión así que por ahora solo se dedicará a seguir trabajando mucho todos los días y así seguir juntando el capital suficiente para poder iniciar y concretar su sueño. Este será el segundo préstamo con la institución MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete una vez más a seguir siendo una socia muy puntual en sus cuotas ya que no desea defraudar a sus compañeras del banco comunal quienes confían mucho en ella y le dieron el respaldo para poder acceder a un crédito. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará ingredientes e insumos para seguir con su trabajo y así seguir agradando a sus clientes con mayor variedad de platos a ofrecer.
texts.en: Jessica is 20 years old. She is a friendly, hard-working and enterprising young woman. She is married to her husband, with whom she has a 2-year-old son. They live together in a home they own, working hard every day to provide the best for their young son and give the family a better quality of life. Jessica's job consists of preparing and selling ceviche (a traditional dish). She is co-owner of a ceviche restaurant in the city along with her mother, who owns 70 percent of the business. They work every day. The restaurant is run out of her mother's home, and Jessica leaves for work very early every day because she has to go to city's port in search of the freshest and highest quality fish. She started out as an assistant to her mother, but thanks to a lot of hard work she was able to take on more responsibilities and was given a percentage of the business. She has been working there for five years and it is going very well, enough for her to buy her home and accomplish many things. At first, things were complicated with the business, but now it's going very well and she has big plans for it to keep growing. Jessica, like every young woman, desires to move up in life. In the future she hopes to set up a hardware store in her home, but she knows it requires a much bigger investment. So for now she is dedicated to working hard every day and raising enough capital for her to be able to carry out her dream. This will be her second loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she is very content in knowing she will have financial support because she feels it will help her make strides with her work. She also promises once again to be very punctual with her payments, since she doesn't want to let down her fellow members of her community bank who but their trust in her and gave her support for the loan. With the loan she is requesting, Jessica plans to purchase ingredients and supplies to keep working and keep her customers satisfied by offering a wider variety of meals.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and supplies to prepare her meals.

loans.name: Dairon Ezequiel

texts.es:
Dairon Esequiel tiene 24 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene un hijo, vive con la esposa,  padres y el hijo en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.
La VRC JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto El caimito, Perteneciente a la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo Corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol Gandul.
Dairon se dedica a la Agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz hace 10 años las compras y las ventas los realiza en Ventanas.
Solicita el crédito para la Agricultura ciclo corto de maíz, arroz. Con la ayuda del crédito cambiaria y obtendría un beneficio económico mejor. No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. En el Tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.

Con el crédito anterior pudo realizar los trabajos esperados en la agricultura,la producción ha aumentado, en la familia la relación ha mejorado porque ahora puede aportar para el bienestar de la familia.
texts.en:
Dairon Esequiel is 24 years old and has a common-law relationship.  He lives with his wife, parents and son in Ventanas canton, in los Ríos province.

The JERUSALEN community bank is located in El Caimito, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Dairon is a farmer who has been growing corn and rice for 10 years.  He makes his sales and purchases in Ventanas.

Dairon is requesting a loan for his corn and rice crops.  With the help of this loan he will make more income.  He hasn't experienced any problems in his work.  In his free time, Dairon enjoys taking part in sports.

With his previous loan, Dairon was able to carry out his anticipated farm work.  His production increased and his family relationships have improved because now he is able to provide for his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Rosa Hermelinda

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Hermelinda, tiene 34 años de edad, cursó los 4 años de educación primaria, tiene  3 hijos, se dedica al la artesanía, a la elaboración de calzado para mujeres, inicio este trabajo por iniciativa propia, lleva 5 años e experiencia en realizar este trabajo.

Solicita un préstamo para utilizar como capital de trabajo para iniciar su propio negocio, para la compra de piel, cuerina, forro, adornos, suelas, etc. Espera en el futuro tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
Rosa Hermelinda is 34 years old and completed four years of primary school.  She has three children.  She is a craftswoman, making footwear for women, and she started doing this work on her own initiative.  She has been in this business for five years.

She is seeking a loan so she can have working capital to start her own business. The funds will be used to buy leather, cloth, decorative items, soles, etc. She hopes in the future to have a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy materials to make sandals.

loans.name: Nuris

texts.es: Nuris de 61 años de edad es la madre de 4 hijos en las edades de 30 a 38 años, que inició su aventura emprendedora desde el año 2004 con el montaje de un negocio del servicio de costura en su propia casa. Con esto le fue bien pero sus aspiraciones eran superiores a lo que podría ofrecer en este lugar; fue así como se trasladó a un sector más comercial y  llevándose algunas de sus máquinas inició su mercadeo cuando arrendó un local,  alcanzando muchas de sus metas de producción. Gradualmente y de acuerdo al crecimiento de su negocio,  ella agregó una miscelánea, con la que aun cuenta;  con sus planes de crecimiento Nuris necesita aumentar su capital de trabajo, para lograr responderle a su creciente clientela y mantener un surtido que diariamente rote aun más. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas como telas, hilos correderas, con los cuales desarrollará diseños y hará que todo este Diciembre y el mes de Enero del presente año, sus ventas se incrementes, por efecto de la celebración de las fiestas familiares, a las que sus clientes asistirán con los elegantes vestidos, resultado del trabajo bien hecho de Nuris. Su negocio está está registrado en Cámara de Comercio de su jurisdicción, cuenta con clientela fija,  localizada en los barrios aledaños y genera unos ingresos mas por efecto de capacitaciones que ofrece en el sector donde habita.
texts.en: Nuris, 61, is the mother of four children, ages 30 to 38.  She began her entrepreneur adventure in 2004 when she set up a sewing service in her own home. Although it went well her aspirations were greater than what she could offer from that location.  She moved to a more commercial location where she rented a space and set up her machines and began meeting her production goals.  Gradually, as the business grew, she added a bazaar which she still has.  For her expansion plans Nuris needs to increase her working capital to meet growing customer demand and to keep up with the daily inventory turnover.  So she requested a Credikiva loan which is her first through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She plans to use it to buy supplies such as fabric, thread and bobbins which she will use to make her designs and increase sales throughout December and January because of the holidays.  Her customers will wear her elegant dresses to the parties.  Her business is registered in the Chamber of Commerce and she has a fixed customer base in the nearby neighborhoods.  Her income comes mainly from the sewing classes she offers.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as fabric, thread and bobbins.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, el se dedica al negocio de elaboración de especias junto con otros ocho empleados, el oficio lo inicio junto a su esposa todos los días de lunes a domingo.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar la mercadería para la elaboración como: cominos, achote, canela, orégano, pimienta  de esa forma podrá aumentar en sus ventas y podrá pagar a las personas que le ayudan, tambien les podrá ayudar a su familia con los gastos de la casa.
El sueño de Juan es tener el negocio más grande y tener estable siempre su negocio.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his wife and children and is in the business of spice manufacture along with eight other employees.  He works with his wife every day from Monday to Sunday.  The loan will be used to buy merchandise for the development, such as cumin, achiote (a seed), cinnamon, oregano, and pepper.  He will be able to increase his sales and will be able to pay people to help him.  Also, it will help him help his family with household expenses.
Juan's dream is to have the biggest business and always have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase cumin, achiote, cinnamon, oregano, pepper.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel works for NRG Solution/Yejj Solar, a Barefoot Power distributor in Cambodia. 

This is his story: 

I came to Cambodia three years ago and saw the desperate need for basic access to electricity. With 80% of the population not having access to any kind of distributed electricity there was a lot of potential to improve people's lives by giving them access to basic electricity. Most people depend on car batteries and kerosene lights, which is inadequate, inefficient, labor intensive, and unsafe. 

NRG Solutions was established with the goal of providing sustainable, appropriate, and affordable solar energy solutions to Cambodia and S.E. Asia. Our team began working under the name Yejj Solar, as part of a larger NGO. This experience helped us learn about the local and regional market. We tested different models and approaches to the distribution of solar energy into remote areas. Earlier this year we decided to transition out of the NGO model into a social enterprise model, in order to improve sustainability as we saw the need to scale up. Our approach has two fundamental pillars: quality and service. We have slowly introduced Barefoot Power products in order to build the brand and trust in the products. By building a network of entrepreneurs to which we offer constant training and support we are pushing this emphasis of quality and service down to the end customer. This has quickly allowed us to differentiate ourselves from distributors of cheaper products with no after-sales service. 

Your contributions will help us bring much needed stock in order to meet the large demand and grow the business. This stock will then be given to local entrepreneurs we have trained to sell these products in very remote areas of the country, where they are most needed. This loan will help us in that final push to establish our business and the Barefoot Power products into a known and trusted brand. The largest challenge with solar energy in Cambodia is the lack of trust due to the availability of very cheap, low quality products, and no after-sales service support. Barefoot Power provides the best quality and easiest-to-service products in the market. 

Our efforts and patience in building trust in our brand has recently and quickly translated into larger and larger demand. We are currently not able to meet demand due to lack of funds to place larger orders, which can be solved with initial financing. We envision a network of entrepreneurs all over the country reaching the most remote and needed families, in order to make a significant difference in their lives with reliable, adequate, modern, and green energy.

loans.use: To sell renewable solar lighting

loans.name: Margarita María

texts.es:
Margarita a sus 18 años de edad, ya piensa como toda una empresaria, montar su propio negocio es su gran sueño y por el cual se encuentra luchando a fin de convertirlo en una realidad. Cuenta que aprendió el oficio viendo a su hermana quien es estilista, se apasionó tanto por este trabajo que realizó un curso para perfeccionar su conocimiento. Hoy ya labora como independiente  frecuentando los clientes que solicitan su servicio.
 
Margarita desea abrir un salón de belleza, por lo cual recurrió a un crédito para comprar los implementos necesarios para su funcionamiento como plancha de cabello, secador, kit de cepillos y esmaltes.
Con los ingresos recaudados, gracias a su trabajo, esta joven colabora con los gastos del hogar, debido a que las condiciones económicas de su familia no son las más optimas. 
Su mayor sueño es poder iniciar una carrera universitaria con el propósito de convertirse en una profesional y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Margarita, at her 18 years of age, is already thinking quite like a businesswoman.  To start her own business is her great dream and for which she is struggling in order to make it into a reality.  She says that she learned the trade watching her sister who is a stylist.  She got so excited by this work that she took a course to perfect her knowledge.  Today she already works independently seeing the customers who request her service.

Margarita wants to open a beauty salon, therefore she turned to a loan to buy the necessary implements for her operation like a hair iron, hair dryer, brush kit and nail polishes.  With the income gathered, thanks to her work, this young woman contributes to the household expenses, due to the fact that the economic conditions of her family aren’t the most optimal.

Her greatest dream is to be able to start a university degree with the intention of becoming a professional and improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a hair iron, hair dryer, brush kit and nail polish.

loans.name: Mahude 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUDE 2 est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Cossiba est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Cossiba est âgée de 49 ans est mariée à un boucher du nom de Latifou. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et un reste encore à leur charge. Cossiba vit seule avec ses enfants. Cossiba supporte ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges familiales. Pour y parvenir, Cossiba vend des tissus et des canettes depuis quatorze ans dans sa région. En plus de cette activité, Cossiba vend de façon secondaire des produits GSM. Cossiba achète ses produits dans une ville du Bénin. Cossiba désire satisfaire un plus grand nombre de clients par ses produits, mais Cossiba ne dispose pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pouvant lui permettre de rehausser le niveau de son activité. C’est pour ce faire que Cossiba sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUDE 2.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus.

loans.name: Sun's Group

texts.en: Sun, a residing living in Kratie province, is 54 years old and a father of six children. He overcomes his family’s hardship via growing cassava and pepper to earn extra income. This is his first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He leads a group of three to get new loan. As the group leader, he will spend his loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fee to support his farmland. He hopes that he can get more yields than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fee to support his farmland.

loans.name: Dürdane

texts.en:
Dürdane is married and a mother of two.  She is knitting at home, selling them and making a contribution to the family budget.  With the help of the loans from Maya she is buying bulks of threads and increasing her profit.
 
Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Dürdane hanım evli iki çocuk annesi.  Evde örgü örerek ve bunların satışını yaparak ek gelir elde ediyor.  Mayadan aldığı krediler ile toptan yün alarak kar oranını artırıyor.

loans.use: to buy knitting yarn

loans.name: Nancy Celeste

texts.en:
My name is Nancy Lisette, I have a business that sales new clothes and shoes in my one room house, which I deliver to my community, I have several years working in this business, with the income my business produces I’ve been able to take care of my children because I’m a single mother and they depend on me.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre Nacy Lisette, cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa nueva y calzado en mi casa de habitación, el que distribuyo de manera ambulante en mi comunidad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este negocio, con los ingresos que me genera este negocio he sacado adelante a mis hijos ya que soy madre soltera y mis hijos depende de mi.

loans.use: To buy shoes, bags, pants for ladies and gentleman, make-up, blouses and underwear.

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.en:
Leoncio is an enterprising man, active and very hardworking. He has always wanted to have his own business and he made this happen four years ago when he started up his own grocery store. He is married and has two daughters. This business, apart from being his dream, is the way Leoncio can earn a living for his family and educate his daughters. Starting wasn’t easy, but with his and his family’s hard work, they have been able to get ahead.

Leo has put all of his effort into making his grocery store grow. He is just missing one little push, which is why he needs a loan of $475.00, which he will use to buy merchandise to stock his store. With this he hopes to offer a wider variety and better service to his customers, which is how he hopes to ensure that they will prefer his store. This will help him grow as a small business owner. You can be an important part of the development of this store, you can support Leoncio and his family. With your help, he can do great things.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Leoncio es un hombre emprendedor, activo y muy trabajador, siempre tuvo deseos de tener su negocio propio y se cumplió hace cuatro años que inició con su propio abarrote, él está casado y tiene dos hijas. Este negocio ha representado, además de su sueño, la manera en que Leoncio puede obtener el sustento para su familia y para la educación de sus hijas. Empezar no fue fácil, pero con el esfuerzo unido de él y su familia han podido salir adelante.

Leo ha puesto todo su empeño para que este abarrote pueda crecer, solo le hace falta un pequeño impulso, para lo que necesita de un crédito de $ 475 dólares que utilizará para la compra de mercancía y surtir su negocio, con esto espera poder ofrecer una mayor variedad y un mejor servicio a sus clientes para obtener su preferencia, crecer como microempresario. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en el desarrollo y crecimiento de esta tienda, tú puedes apoyar a Leoncio y a su familia, con tu ayuda él puede hacer grandes cosas.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his grocery store

loans.name: Govkhar

texts.en:
Govkhar is a very active and responsible woman. 4 years ago she decided to start this business .
She is 52, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in the Finnish houses, which are built temporarily on front line in the Fizuli region. She is married and has 2 children.
Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy foodstuffs. 
She wants to increase her foodstuffs to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy foodsuffs

loans.name: Ana Celia

texts.es:
Ana Celia is married and has five kids. In order to earn some more money so that her kids could continue studying Ana decided to start her own business 6 years ago. She sells second hand clothes in markets and with the help of her husband her merchandise has increased and her service improved. Her love for her children and promise to her husband keep her going everyday.

In order for her business to grow and to increase the amount of products that she offers, Ana would like a loan of $250 which she will pay back over a period of 4 months. Your help is much appreciated in the development of this business. Help this family to improve their lives. They thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Ana Celia es casada y tiene cinco hijos. Ante la necesidad de un ingreso extra que les permitiera a sus hijos continuar estudiando desde hace seis años Ana inició su propio negocio con la venta de ropa usada, con el apoyo de su esposo realiza sus ventas en los mercados y poco a poco han ido incrementando la mercancía que ofrece y mejorando su servicio. El amor hacia sus hijos y el fiel compromiso con su esposo la motivan a esforzarse más cada día.

Para continuar creciendo con su negocio y ampliar la variedad de productos que ofrece Ana está solicitando un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que se compromete a devolver en 4 meses. Tu ayuda es de gran utilidad en el desarrollo de este negocio, apoya a esta familia a mejorar su vida, ellos te lo agradecen mucho.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Muhamed Lamin

texts.en: Muhamed sells adult clothes and shoes in Makeni Town.  He has been running this business for the last six years.  Muhamed is thirty-six years old and married with three children.  He is the sole income earner for the family.  He also assists his brothers and sisters with their education.  Muhamed would like to expand his business by including children’s clothes.  He is requesting a loan of US$ 200 for this purpose.

loans.use: Diversify his clothing shop by adding children's clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To diversify her fish business.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
Yanet is a woman of immense strength. Driven by her love for her children, she works tirelessly day after day to give them a good future. She occupies her time attending her little store and at night she sells kebabs. She began this most recent venture when an opportunity presented itself to care for a neighbor’s house during his absence. In this way she was motivated to open her store. It’s already been four years since then, and Yanet is satisfied for having obtained economic stability and loyal clients who assure her earnings. Nonetheless, all these efforts she’s undertaken are still not sufficient to cover her fifteen-year old daughter’s costly medical treatment. As a result of this, her desire to grow her business has been notably prioritized. She requests the support of your noble hearts in order to increase the quantity of products in her small store. Contribute to building Yanet’s future with diligence and through Yanet, a hard-working and strong mother.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Yanet, es una mujer de una fuerza inmensa, impulsada por el amor de sus hijos, día a día trabaja incansablemente por otorgarles un buen futuro. Se desempeña atendiendo su pequeña tienda y en las noches vende salchipapas; esta última iniciativa la tuvo cuando se presentó la oportunidad de un vecino que le ofreció su casa para que la cuide durante su ausencia; es así que se animó a abrir su tienda. Ya han transcurrido 4 años desde entonces y Yanet está satisfecha de haber conseguido estabilidad económica y de poseer clientes fieles que aseguran las ganancias; sin embargo aún todos los esfuerzos que otorga no son suficientes para cubrir el costoso tratamiento médico de su pequeña de quince años. A raíz de este hecho sus deseos por acrecentar el pequeño negocio se han priorizado notablemente y solicita el apoyo de vuestro noble corazón para incrementar la cantidad de productos de su pequeña tienda. Contribuye a que el futuro sea construido con diligencia y a través de Yanet una madre trabajadora y esforzada.

loans.use: Increase capital in order to acquire a greater quantity of items of utmost importance

loans.name: Ntawo A (Ii) Group

texts.en:
Leah is a single mother of five children. She makes and sells fruit juice and fruit salads. She plans to use the profits from this loan to open a retail shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit and a refrigerator

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Mrs. Teodora dedicates herself to selling regional vegetables at her stand in the Micaela market. She has a large number of customers because of the attention she gives them and the fresh “just picked” quality of her vegetables. Additionally, she sells cold beverages such as sodas and beer from her home where her dear daughter helps her. She is 52 years old and now only enjoys the company of her youngest daughter who is 15. She provides her daughter with all that is necessary to continue studying to allow herself a good future. The desire of this working mother is to improve her two workplaces to allow for additional comfort for her customers and for this reason she looks to you for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Teodora se dedica a la venta de verduras regionales en un puesto del mercado Micaela, ella tiene una gran acogida de clientes ya que les brinda una buena atención y sobre sus productos son ofertados frescos como recién cosechados; adicionalmente a este negocio vende en su casa bebidas heladas (cervezas y gaseosas), contando con la importante ayuda de su querida hija.Ella tiene 52 años y ahora solo goza de la compañía de la menor de sus hijas de 15 años de edad, a quién le da lo necesario para que siga estudiando para que pueda forjarse un buen futuro.El deseo de esta trabajadora madre es implementar sus dos centros trabajo para mayor comodidad de sus clientes y por esta razón recurre a ti en búsqueda de tu ayuda.

loans.use: Improving her business

loans.name: Subhonkul

texts.ru:
Subhonkul Komilovich K. lives in the Shahrinov region. He is 21 and is single. He has a secondary education. Subhonkul buys seeds of pototoes and sells them at the local market to both private customers and agriculture enterprises. Subhonkul buys seeds wholesale , paying lower prices and then he resells them at lower then usual prices. It allows the local population to purchase potato seeds at affordable prices. This business is the main source of income for Subhonkul. He plans to use the proceeds of his loan to increase his turnover. It will allow him to attract more customers and increase his profits. He is planning to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers

Кенджаев Субхонкул Комилович проживает в районе Шахринау. Возраст 21 год, холост. Имеет среднее образование.Занимается предпринимательством в сфере сельхоз продукции. Завозит в район семена картофеля отборных сортов и реализует у себя на рынке частным покупателям , а так же аграрным хозяйствам.Так как клиент скупает товар у оптовых реализаторов по оптовым ценам и реализует оптовым покупателям так же по более низкой цене. Это позволяет населению приобретать картофель по доступным ценам. Кроме того этот бизнес является основным источником дохода его семьи. Клиент планирует получить кредит для того чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Это поможет увеличить объем продаваемой продукции, что даст возможность увеличить количество клиентов, а так же увеличить доход. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase turnover

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is forty-nine years old and a father of three children. He is married and has been preparing and selling herbal medicine in his community of Mankessim for the past thirty years.
He wants to use his loan to prepare more medicine so that he can ultimately rent a store to sell his products. Currently, he hawks his products.

He is a member of the group called Stewards. Group members agree to take responsibility for the loans of their peers, which serves as social collateral for the loan.

loans.use: to prepare more medicine and rent a store for his operations

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata is 25 years old and married.  She sells cotton materials in the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone.  With her previous loans from SMT, Fatmata was able to purchase the materials in cash and on wholesale,enabling her to generate good income.  Fatamata now owns 75% of the business and she would like to continue building her own capital from the profit.   She is therefore requesting a loan of $350 to increase her stock of cotton materials and to build her capital..

loans.use: To increase her stock of cotton materials and to build her capital.

loans.name: Hector Vidal

texts.es:
Hector Vidal is originally from the Nagarote district in the city of León, where he works hard as owner of a tailor business. He makes all kinds of clothing and accessories, such as trousers for men and women, shirts, and backpacks, etc.

As a 43-year-old father of two small, school-age girls, Hector is motivated by the desire to provide his daughters with the conditions necessary for their development.

Currently Hector doesn’t have the financial resources needed to purchase materials such as fabric, zippers, and buttons, etc. As such he has turned to Ceprodel for a loan to continue operating in the tailoring business.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

El caballero Hector Vidal es originario del municipio de Nagarote de la ciudad de León y se dedica muy esforzadamente a su propio negocio de sastrería elaborando todo tipo de ropa como lo es pantalones para caballeros y damas, camisas, mochilas, etc.

A sus 43 años de edad es padre de dos pequeñas hijas en edad escolar el cual son el motivo de sus esfuerzos en el negocio para brindarles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo.

La necesidad que hoy en día el señor Hector atraviesa es que no posee el recurso económico para la compra de materiales de trabajo como lo son telas, ziperes, botones, hijos, etc. Por esta razón ha acudido en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito y así continuar con su actividad económica en su sector.

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Irma Guadalupe

texts.es:
Irma started her business because she had to support herself and her family after her husband's death. Even now she is always looking for ways to earn money for her home expenses.
