Eighteen years ago she began selling snacks, candy and crafts that she made, and little by little she has added more items to sell. Now she lives by herself, and her expenses are minimal; she only worries about earning enough to eat and to pay the house bills.

Irma requests a $600 loan to be paid back in 6 months to purchase more materials to make crafts and to buy more toys and gifts to sell. She needs a variety of products to maintain a good cash flow.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

Irma inició el negocio porque a raíz de que murió su esposo tuvo que buscar la manera de salir adelante y se tuvo que emplear a si misma vendiendo cosas además de que también hace manualidades y busca por todas las formas sacar dinero para los gastos de la casa. Comenzó hace 18 años vendiendo frituras, dulces y haciendo manualidades; y poco a poco fue metiéndole más cosas para sacar más dinero y así de esa manera le iba dando vuelta al dinero. Ahora ya no tiene tantos problemas porque esta sola y sus gastos son mínimos, solo se preocupo por sacar dinero para comer y pagar los gastos de la casa.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar más material para hacer manualidades y abastecerse de mas juguetes y regalos, porque si se queda sin nada después batalla para darle movimiento rápido al dinero.

loans.use: purchasing materials for crafts

loans.name: Oeu

texts.en:
Oeu C. S., 49, works on her farm each day while her husband, Kung C. Thorn, operates a small mechanic shop out of their home. The live in Phnom Penh with their three children, two of whom work in the local garment factories and help to support the family. The mechanic shop typically generates US$2 in income each day, leaving the family desperate for options to increase their income and improve their standard of living. Oeu C. S. has asked for a loan of US$150 to purchase more seeds for her field and expand her variety of crops. She sees this improvement to her business as a sound investment in her future that will allow her to help support her family.

Oeu C. S. was unavailable for a photograph at the time of the interview, so her husband is pictured above.

loans.use: Oeu would like to purchase more seeds to increase her yields on her farm.

loans.name: Fátima Del Rosario

texts.es: Fátima tiene 31 años de edad, es casada y habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, tiene tres hermosos hijos de 2, 7 y 10 años de edad, es casada, su esposo es albañil. Doña Fátima vende ropa, zapatos, juguetes tiene trece años en las ventas e inició cuando su familia tenia un tramo en el mercado oriental y ahí trabajaba ella, pero luego optó por hacer su negocio sola porque quería convertirse en microempresaria.. Con el préstamo quiere invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de maniquíes de medio cuerpo para lucir sus prendas de vestir a los clientes. A largo plazo es aumentar su inventario y lograr mejores ganancias, así como ayudar a sus hijos a superarse con los estudios.
texts.en:
Fatima is thirty-one years old, married, and lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood. She has three beautiful children who are two, seven, and ten-years old. Her husband is a building worker. Ms. Fatima has worked in retail for thirteen years, selling clothes, shoes, and toys. She started this work when her family had a stand in a market. She worked there until she chose to start her own business because she wanted to become a businesswoman. With the loan, she wants to invest in funds to buy medium-sized mannequins to show off the clothes that she is selling to her clients. In the long term, she hopes to use the loan to increase her inventory and gain more profit so that she can help her children better themselves through their studies.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de maniquíes para exhibición / Purchase of exhibition mannequins

loans.name: Nat

texts.en:
Mrs. NA. A., 57, and her husband, Mr. Thorn Sok, 60, who live on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1970 and have three children, one son and two daughters. Two of their children have full time employment and their youngest daughter studies in the local school.

Mrs. NA. has sold groceries for four years and has been selling cotton scarves since 2000. She buys them from a market in Phnom Penh for resale A. her home. Her husband grows papayas, tomatoes, corn, and other food crops on their farmland. 

Mrs. NA. is requesting a loan to purchase a sewing machine and a computer for her daughters, and to buy grocery items for her stock.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine, a computer, and grocery items for her stock.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mrs. San S., 52, a widow with two daughters, lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. San has been a silk weaver since she was young, a skill she learned from her parents. Now she spins thread for her daughters to weave silk. and sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who resells them in Phnom Penh.

San is now requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase silk materials for her daughters’ weaving along with zinc and other materials to roof her house.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving and roofing materials for the house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pagnes cloth and various goods

loans.name: Gladis Esther

texts.es:
La señora Gladys Esther tiene 40 años D. edad, es la presidenta del Banco Comunal Unidas para un Futuro Mejor II y vive en el distrito D. Florencia D. Mora, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Estudio primaria completa, pero por razones D. salud no continuó estudiando más. Se casó a los 17 años y tiene 4 hijos, 2 hombres y 2 mujeres, todos estudiantes.
El negocio se ubica en la esquina D. su casa y consiste en la venta D. raspadilla, pasteles, gelatina por la mañana, por la tarD. mazamorra y por la noche hamburguesas. 
El primer crédito fue D. S/. 200 cancelado en 4 cuotas, con lo que compró azúcar, hielo y otros materiales.
Con este crédito D. S/. 1,700, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en comprar material para la mazamorra y hielo para raspadilla.
Gladys sueña con vivir feliz rodeada D. toda su familia.
texts.en:
Gladys Esther is 40 years old and is the president of the United Communal Bank for a Better Future II. She lives in the Florencia D. Mora district in the Province of Trullio in Libertad, Peru. She finished elementary school but for health reasons she did not continue studying. She got married when she was 17 and has 4 children, 2 boys and 2 girls, all of whom are students. She has a business located at the corner near her home where she sells snow cones, cakes, jello in the morning, mazamorra [a type of corn porridge in Peru] in the afternoon and hamburgers at night. Her first loan for 200 soles, paid in four payments, was used to buy sugar, ice and other materials. With this loan of 1,700 soles, which will also be repaid in 4 payments, she will invest in materials to make mazamorra and ice for snow cones. Gladys dreams of living happily surrounded by her family.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make corn porridge and ice for snow cones

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys A. has been selling used clothes for the past eighteen years in the market of Apatrapa, Ghana. She relies on the income she makes from her sales to support her household in food and for payment of utility bills. Gladys is a 37-year-old wife and mother of five kids who are schooling. She was born and bred in the community. Her parents are no longer living; they passed away when she was 15 years old.

As she realized the need for expansion, Gladys decided to add eggs sales to the used clothes. She treks to the poultry farms in Kumasi to purchase the eggs. This has helped her to avoid middlemen who sell to her at high prices. Gladys is requesting the loan to enable her to inject more capital into the business to purchase more bales of used clothes and crates of eggs. She hopes she will be able to put aside savings to support her kids' education. Juliana belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyame naye’ which means "God did it". She hopes to receive GHS 500 to make her business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of used clothes and crates of eggs

loans.name: Nilo Marcio

texts.es: Nilo Marcio D. U. tiene 46 años, está casado, y tiene 3 hijos. Todos los hijos trabajan y tienen 22, 19, y 9 años individualmente. Anteriormente, Nilo Marcio poseía un trabajo pero debido a que la empresa en donde trabajaba realizo recorte de personal por el bajo presupuesto del gobierno, él fue uno de los despedidos. Es así que da comienzo a su negocio con la venta de recargas y gaseosas. Más tarde con algunos préstamos realizados a fundación su negocio creció y con esto ha podido invertir en la compra de pan y de esta forma poder venderlo. Su sueño es de comprar un vehículo con el que pueda salir a vender verduras y pan. El va a pagar la cantidad de C$ 10.000 córdobas a un plazo de 12 meses.
texts.en:
Nilo Marcio D. U. is a 46-year-old married father with 3 children, ages 22, 19, and 9, who all work. Nilo Marcio was previously employed at a company, but due to government budget cuts, he was one of the personnel who was let go. Thus, he decided to start a business selling cellular phone minutes and soft drinks. His business later grew thanks to loans from the foundation. He has now been able to invest the loans in purchasing bread in order to sell it. He dreams of purchasing a vehicle with which he can go out and sell vegetables and bread. He is requesting a loan for C$10,000.00 Nicaraguan Cordobas, which will be repaid in 12 monthly installments.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong S., 50, has business selling rice and making baskets to sell at the market. Her business has been around for about ten years and she makes US$ 8 every day. Her husband is village chief and earns US$ 3 a day. This couple has one son and he is a rice dealer. On average, he makes US$ 10 in revenue each day. Kong S. is asking for a loan to purchase a stock of rice and a motorbike to transport rice.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of rice and motorbike

loans.name: Khazratqulu

texts.en:
Khazratqulu K. is 54 years old. He is married with three children. He is an entrepreneur who sells different kinds of food stuffs such as: sweets, produce, preserved foods, soft drinks, juices and other items in his grocery store.

Khazratqulu is not alone in this business. His whole family actively helps him with sales.

Khazratqulu is requesting a loan of 1200 USD for a term of 15 months to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder and make sacrifices to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

Aqroinvest Credit Union believes his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: Purchase more food items.

loans.name: Jemilat

texts.en: Jemilat A. is 36 years old and married with 3 children. She sells bags of cement for building houses. She is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more bags of cement to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of cement to sell

loans.name: Kheun

texts.en:
Mrs. Kheun Y. has had a job as a rice farmer in the village since 1980. She is age 42 and the mother of four single children, three of whom are students, while the other one is a fisherman. She is married to Mr. Chek, age 39, who sells fish that he catches in the local public lake.

The family faces difficulty with transportation because they always need to pay a lot for taxis. Because of the problem, Y. has decided to seek a $500 loan to purchase a motorbike so that she can use it for the family's transportation needs. She intends to use 30% of the loan for her farming operations. (Mrs. Y.'s husband is pictured).

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for family needs

loans.name: Loveth

texts.en: Loveth is 30 years old and she is married with two children. She sells baby clothes, cream, flask, etc. She hopes for the loan of N30,000 to purchase more baby clothes and cream to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baby clothes and cream to sell

loans.name: Carol Lizeth

texts.es:
La señorita Carol Lizeth Velásquez L.  tiene 23 años, vive en el distrito de Florencia de mora, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudia Educación Secundaria en la Universidad Nacional de Trujillo, no tiene  hijos que depende económicamente de ella.
Carol  se dedica a la venta de productos de pan llevar este negocio se inicio hace 2 años, asi mismo gracias al préstamo implemento su negocio de venta de comida, sus negocios lo desarrolla en su casa.
Su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Bellavista  II, lo invirtió en la compra de sillas, mesas para implementar su negocio de venta de comida por las noches.
El crédito de 1000 soles, lo invertirá en la compra productos como arroz, azúcar, fideos para implementar su bodega.
Carol  tiene como sueño tener su bodega mas implementada para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Carol Lizeth V. L. is 23 years old, and she lives inthe Florencia de Mora district in the region of Trujillo or La Liberta, Peru. She is studying to be high school teacher at the Trujillo National University. She does not have any children that are dependent of her. Carol has been running a convenience store for the past 2 years. Thanks to the loan she received she also set up a catering business, with both businesses run from her home. Her first loan of 300 soles received from the Bellavista II community bank (Kiva Field Partner) was invested in the purchase of chairs and tables to set up to accomodate her food sales in the evenings. This loan of 1000 soles will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, and pasta to supply her convenience store. Carol's dream is to have a better established convenience store and to grow as a small business owner.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, and past to supply her convenience store.

loans.name: Afeni

texts.en:
M. is 43 years old, married, and has four children. She sells pepper soup and drinks. She started this business ten years ago and has a sales attendant who assists in the evening during the rush hour.

M. has been borrowing from LAPO without any default in payment. She now needs a loan of N80,000 to purchase more drinks at a discount direct from the company.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase potatoes and cooking oil.

loans.name: Nuevo Despertar Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario el nuevo despertar esta integrado por 3 miembros que tienen su propio negocio y se conocen desde hace varios años. las actividades que ellos realizan son las siguientes:

el sr. Jose Lupario F. tiene 24 años de edad, es casado, tiene 1 hija la cual esta pequeña.
el se dedica a la venta de productos de la canasta basica en la pulperia que tiene desde hace 04 años, esta ubicada en la colonia nueva esperanza de la ciudad de Nacaome y tambien tiene su propio taxi.

el sr. Melvin Armando Almendarez tiene 26 años de edad, es casado, tiene 1 hija.
el se dedica a la venta de ropa y electrodomesticos en el barrio san jose de la ciudad de nacaome desde hace 08 años. para cumplir el objetivo tuvo que vender su producto durante varios años en los diferentes  barrios donde el recide de manera ambulante; hoy en dia tiene su propio carro y sale a vender este producto a diferentes barrios y aldeas de esta ciudad.

la sra. Maria Cleofes C. tiene  41 años de edad, vive en union libre, tiene 3 hijos de los 
cuales 01 esta en USA y le manda ayuda desde hace varios años.
ella se  dedica a la venta de repuestos para bicicleta tiene 04 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.su mayor sueño es vender bicicletas al por mayor.

todos ellos necesitan el credito pra salir adelante con sus negocios y familias.,
texts.en:
The group Nuevo Despertar ("New Awakening") consists of three members who have their own businesses and have known each other for a number of years.

The activities each does is as follows: Mr. Jose Lupario F. is 24 years old, married and has a small daughter. He makes a living selling basic grocery items in the convenience store he has had for the past four years. It is located in the colony of Nueva Esperanza in the city of Nacaome, and he also has his own taxi.

Mr. Melvin Armando Almendarez is 26 years old, married and has a daughter. He has made a living selling clothing and household appliances in the San Jose neighborhood of Nacaome for the past eight years. To reach this point he had to sell his products outdoors for a number of years in different neighborhoods of the city. Currently he has his own car and goes out to sell his products in the different neighborhoods and surrounding areas of the city.

Mrs. Maria Cleofes C. is 41 years old, lives with her common-law husband, and has three children, one of whom is in the United States and has sent aid for a number of years. Maria makes a living selling spare parts for bicycles and has four years experience. Her biggest dream is to sell bicycles wholesale.

All the members are requesting the loan to make headway with their businesses and their families.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various supplies for the members' businesses

loans.name: Arco Iris Group

texts.es:
This committee was formed by Mrs. Juana R. when she found out about the Fundación through a friend who was already a part of the Mujeres Emprendedoras committee.  

One of the ladies of the group is Mrs. Laura C.. She is 44-years-old, has 3 children, and is a single parent who has sacraficed a great deal for her family, having to play the role of both mother and father.  She sells fruit in the Mariscal Lopez and Gral Santos area of Asunción.  At 4am she goes to the market to get the fruit. For the last 10 years she has had the same stand.  She works from 7am to 11am.  Her oldest son helps her and cooks lunch for the family.  She says thanks to this program she is moving forward.  

All the others ladies work in diffrents tipes of activities like: food sale, clothes and shoes sale, grocery store, cosmetics and make up sales, etc.

loans.use: to invest in their activities

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora  Lucia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 27 años de edad, estado civil casada y madre de 1 hijo y tiene estudios de primaria completa, vive en la comunidad de Urani 

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 4 meses,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado ovino que luego del engorde los venderá en las ferias de Ilave.

Su deseo es educar a su hija y seguir trabajando.

A ella le gustan las facilidades de los préstamos.
texts.en:
Lucia belongs to the communal bank “Manuela de Hoy II” which is located in the community of Camicachi in the district of Ilave, a province of El Collao in the department of Puno. She is 27 years old, married and the mother of one child. She has completed primary school and lives in the community of Urani. She has worked with the field partner Manuela Ramos for 4 months, taking out an initial loan of 500.00 nuevos soles which she used to purchase small livestock. At the moment she requires a loan of 1000.00 nuevos soles to buy sheep which, after fattening up, she will sell in the Ilave markets. Her desire is to educate her daughter and continue working. She likes the ease of access to credit with Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Kaku

texts.en: Kaku F. is currently in the business of alcohol distillation and selling of local alcohol and is requesting a loan to purchase more brewing materials. Kaku is 28 years old and is widowed. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy food for her family. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more brewing materials

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en:
Rubelyn V. is 24 years old and married to Marlon V.. The couple is blessed with two children: Jessica Jane, 2 years old, and Jessabel, 4 months old. Rubelyn is a tricycle operator and a fish vendor, and is also engaged in the business of buying and selling recyclable materials.

She hopes to improve her family's standard of living. Rebelyn believes that through “sacrifices and patience” they will be able to achieve success in life. Rubelyn and Marlon are helping one another provide for the needs of their family. Rubelyn would like to have additional capital for the maintenance of her tricycle and for her other businesses, selling fish and dealing in recycled materials. She hopes to get a loan from the Kiva lenders in the amount of PHP5000.

loans.use: Additional capital for the maintenance of her tricycle.

loans.name: Soutoura. Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Soutoura, toutes mariées, ont une moyenne d’âge de 36ans, 4 enfants et vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur neuvième  prêt solidaire. Tous les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente d’orange, de sucre, de lait, d’oignon et poissons fumé.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 20 paniers d’orange,  50 kg de sucre,  50 kg de lait, 5 sacs d’oignon et 8 cartons de poisson fumé, au grand marché de Sikasso ville et les localités avoisinantes. Les marchandises sont revendues en détail, dans les différents  marchés de Sikasso et dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, la plupart au comptant. 
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 11.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée rembourser le prêt et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Les femmes du groupe Soutoura ambitionnent augmenter le montant de leurs prêts  pour mieux satisfaire leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The four women of the group Soutoura are all married and average 36 years of age and 4 children.  The women live for the most part in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, a district of Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of Mali). These group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers and are now on their ninth solidarity loan.  All the past loans have been repaid.  They operate diverse businesses, including selling oranges, sugar, milk, onions, and smoked fish.  With this new loan, they intend to buy 20 baskets of oranges, 50 kg of sugar, 50 kg of milk, 5 sacks of onions, and 8 boxes of smoked fish.  These goods are gotten at the Sikasso City market and neighboring towns and are sold retail at different markets of Sikasso and in the different districts.  The customers are composed of men and women, most of whom pay in cash.  The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 11,500 francs CFA.  A portion of the profits will be used to repay the loan, and the other portion will be invested in the businesses.  The women have the ambition of obtaining larger  loans in order to satisfy their customers more.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Boturjon

texts.en:
Boturjon is 36 years old. He is married and has two independent children. Boturjon is a farmer. He has been working in agriculture for 4 years and has gained much experience and a love for the land. He began cultivating his land through his own efforts and has gradually gotten ahead in life. He has been producing such crops as wheat, onion, potatoes. Each year he has produced a yield sufficient for the family consumption and for selling. 

Farming is the family's main source of income.  To generate a stable income, the business requires considerable funding. Boturjon is asking for a loan of $1000 USD. He would like to use this loan to buy supplies for the harvest and to improve production and thus increase the quality of his yield along with his earnings. Boturjon and his family are counting on your help. He thanks all who support him and promises to repay the loan in time.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es:
Erlinda Gómez es una mujer carismática y emprendedora, vive en el distrito D. calleria región D. Ucayali, tiene 58 años D. edad, es madre (separada) D. ocho hijos, se dedica a  la confección D. prendas D. vestir.  Paralelamente brinda servicio D. alquiler D. cuartos. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Juntas hasta el final” desD. hace nueve años. El primer crédito que obtuvo fue D. 300 soles que le permitió invertir en telas para confeccionar sábanas. En la actualidad ella necesita un crédito D. 2000 soles que le permitirá invertir en la compra D. telas e hilos para confeccionar juegos D. sabanas y luego venderlas. 
La meta D. Erlinda es tener más cuartos para alquilar ya que tiene un terreno amplio en donD. hacer cuartos para más clientes.
texts.en:
Erlinda Gómez, 58, is a charismatic and enterprising woman who lives in the Callería district, Ucayali region. She is separated and has 8 children. She is a seamstress but also has some rooms she rents. She has been a member of the "Juntas hasta el final" (Together until the end) communal bank for the last nine years. Her first, 300 sol loan, was used to buy fabric to make bed sheets. Currently, she needs a 2000 sol loan to buy fabric and thread to make sets of bed sheets to sell. Erlinda's goal is to have more rooms to rent since she has a spacious lot on which to make more rooms for customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread to make bed sheet sets.

loans.name: José Americo

texts.es:
EL Sr. José Américo C. A. tiene 55 años de edad, vive con su hijo en Ica y trabaja en el Centro Comercial Amazonas (es una asociación de trabajadores que anteriormente eran ambulantes) esto queda en la Calle Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de cebada,chicha, jugos extractos y otros desde hace mas de 20 años empezando primero con su esposa quien en la actualidad no vive con él pero el Sr. continuó con el trabajo hasta la actualidad. Es su principal fuente de ingreso el cual le a permitido lograr que sus hijos salgan adelante.
Solicita que lo apoyemos en esta campaña navideña para poder invertir en la compra de adornos y luces navideñas para poder así obtener un mejor ingreso que le permita cubrir mejor sus gastos personales.
El tiene buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos y los socios del centro comercial donde trabaja.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose Americo C. A. is 55 years old and lives with his son at 557 A Pimentel Street in Ica. He works at the Amazonas Shopping Center (this is an association of workers who were previously street vendors) which is located on Lambayeque Street. He is in the business of selling barley water, purple corn drink, fresh juices, and more. He has been in this business for more than 20 years, initially with his wife. She is currently no longer living with him, but he continues in this work up to the present date. This is his primary source of income and has allowed him to attain the success of his children. He requests our assistance so that this Christmas season he can invest in the purchase of Christmas ornaments and lights in order to obtain an income that will better allow him to cover his personal expenses. He has good references from his neighbors and from his associates at the shopping center where he works.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest for the Christmas season

loans.name: Jennifer Wanjiru

texts.en: Jennifer Wanjiru runs a hardware and sells goods such as paint, spare parts and electrical wires among other things to regular customers and walk-ins. She has been in business for the last two years. Her business challenges are low demand from customers and high electricity bills. She will be using this loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more engine oil, spare parts and nails. In the future, she wants to become the main supplier in the area. Jennifer is married and has two children. She describes herself as hardworking and honest.

loans.use: To buy engine oil, spare parts and nails

loans.name: Nevados De Huayna Potosi Group

texts.es: “Nevados de Huayna Potosí”  es un grupo de 7 señoras y 1 varón que asisten a sus reuniones en el Centro Focal “German Busch”,  se agruparon hace poco por  la necesidad de acceder al préstamo ya que todas necesitan incrementar su capital de trabajo. Todas tienen diversos negocios como la costura de faldas, venta de ropa de muñecas, venta de frutas, producción de archivadores, venta de plásticos y venta de comida. Una de las integrantes de este grupo es Jhenny Lizethe C., una joven de 20 años, ella se animó a formar parte del grupo a invitación de una amiga, Jhenny elabora ropa de muñecas de barby  hace 3 años, tuvo la iniciativa porque a su madre vende juguetes y muchas de las clientas le pedían ropa para las muñecas, entonces empezó a confeccionar. Con el préstamo piensa comprar tela y encajes.
texts.en:
The Nevados de Huayna Potosí group is comprised of seven women and one man. They attend meetings at the German Busch community center. The group formed recently from the necessity of accessing a loan. All of them need to increase their working capital. They all have different businesses like making skirts, selling doll clothes, selling fruit, making filing cabinets, selling plastics, and selling food. Jhenny Lizethe C. is one of the members of this group. She is 20, and she was motivated to join the group by an invitation of a friend. Jhenny has been making Barbie doll clothes for three years. She took the initiative because her mother sells toys, and lots of her customers asked her for doll clothes. So, she started to make them. She will use the loan to buy fabric and lace.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise and raw material

loans.name: Ancelmo

texts.es: El señor Ancelmo M., habitante de colonia Talolinga desde hace 12 años labora como tecnico Electronico, su familia esta conformada por 4 hijos y su esposa, 3 de sus hijos estudian la educacion secundaria y uno la educacion primaria, su esposa trabaja en la empresa AVON vendiendo productos cosmeticos y le apolla con los gastos del hogar,la mayor necesidad que se le presenta es el sector economico, por que no cuenta con los recursos necesarios para poder comprar los materiales utiles para brindar un buen servicio y poder sastifacer la demanda de los clientes. El espera que AFODENIC, le apolle con este financiamiento para mejorar las condiciones en su taller de manera que su negocio sea mas rentable y mejorar las condiciones de vida  a nivel familiar.
texts.en:
Señor Ancelmo M. lives in the town of Talolinga. For twelve years, he has worked as an electronics technician. His family is made up of four children and his wife. Three of his children study in secondary school and one is in elementary school. His wife sells Avon cosmetics and supports him with their home's expenses. His biggest need is in the economic area because he doesn't have the resources he needs to buy materials to offer a good service and to satisfy his customers' demand. He hopes that Afodenic will support him with this financing so he can improve the conditions of his workshop so that his business will be more profitable and he can improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for his business

loans.name: Alassane

texts.fr:
Né le 22 janvier 1970 à Abidjan (république de Côte d’Ivoire) Monsieur Alassane C.est marié et père de deux garçons. Il réside avec sa  famille à Wayerma Zone, un des quartiers populaires de la  ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant appris la réparation  de radio depuis tout petit auprès de son père, Monsieur Coulibaly  parallèlement à cette activité, mène  une activité d’achat et de vente des appareils électroniques (TV,Mine Chaîne, DVD, etc) dans son atelier  sis au quartier Fama en face du boulevard ’’Voxon’’ il y a environ quinze ans. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses activités. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a quelque mois avec laquelle il est à son premier prêt individuel. 
Monsieur C.vend ses appareils (TV, Mines Chaînes, DVD, batteries, etc) dans son atelier de réparation à ses clients composés généralement de ceux qui sollicitent ses services de réparations.
Avec ce premier prêt, il compte acheter, 3 DVD, 2 TV écran 29, 2 Mines Chaînes, des CD, etc. Ses appareils proviennent de la république du Ghana.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born January 22, 1970 in Abidjan (Republic of Côte d’Ivoire), Mr. Alassane C.is married and the father of two boys. He lives with his family in Wayerma Zone, a working-class neighborhood in the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). At an early age, Mr. C.learned to repair radio sets from his father. Fifteen years ago he set up a workshop in the Fama neighborhood facing Voxon Boulevard, where he also buys and sells electronic equipment (TVs, mini-hifi systems, DVD players, batteries, etc.). Mr. C.sells the equipment in his repair workshop to customers who for the most part are in need of repairs. He is in high demand due to the quality of his services. To satisfy an increasing number of customers, he decided a few months ago to join the Soro Yiriwaso MFI, where he is requesting his first loan. He intends to buy: three DVD players, two 29” screen TVs, two mini-hifi systems, CDs, etc. His supplies come from the Republic of Ghana. This loan should increase his monthly income to 100,000 FCFA, which he will use to increase his stock of equipment, contribute to family expenses, repay his loan and invest the remainder in his business.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy electronic equipment

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy items for a small general store such as batteries, candles, salt, bouillon cubes, rice, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Betty Nabisubi's Group

texts.en:
Betty is 44 years old and is married with five children aged between 14 and 27 years. Two of her children go to school. Betty also takes care of additional family members. She resides in and owns a twelve-roomed house where she lives with seven people. She doesn’t have electricity or piped water at home.

Betty works seven days a week in a semi-rural area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She has a kiosk in Mulago and has been in this business for twelve years. She doesn't incur any transport costs as she buys from her place of work. She sells to all categories of people.

Betty is servicing her third loan. She wants to use this loan to buy more Irish potatoes and cooking oil.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of Irish potatoes and cooking oil

loans.name: Ankadignongonyé Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes qui composent le groupe Ankadignongonyé sont toutes mariées avec en moyenne  36 ans, 6 enfants et  vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, co-épouses, enfants et époux,  dans le village de Djoutièbougou relevant de la préfecture de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues par des relations de parenté, de mariage et de voisinage. 
C’est dans le souci de recherches de ressources financières complémentaires que ces femmes ont décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela pour faire le commerce de condiments alimentaires. 
Elles sont à leur  premier prêt de groupe, qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 200kg de noix de néré pour faire du Sounbala (très apprécié dans la sauce africaine), 300kg de feuilles de baobab séchées et 150kg de dah. 
Tous ces condiments sont achetés sur place dans le village de Djoutièbougou et environs, pour être revendus ensuite au comptant et en détail sur le marché de Bougouni à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent obtenir un bénéfice mensuel de 15.000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé  dans les frais de santé de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
The women of Ankadignongonyé Group are all married. On average, they are 36 years old and have six children. They all live in extended traditional families with their brothers, sisters, cowives, children and husbands in the village of Djoutièbougou in the prefecture of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members know each other through family, marriage and neighborhood ties. On their search for additional income, they decided to join the credit program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and become sellers of food condiments. This is their first group loan which they will use to buy 200 kilograms of néré nuts (the nuts are boiled and pounded to obtain a dark paste, which is made into various shapes (balls or ovals) and turned into sounbala, a highly appreciated ingredient for African sauces), 300 kilograms of dried baobab leaves (from monkey bread trees) and 150 kilograms of dah (hibiscus blossoms used to make drinks). The women will buy all these condiments in Djoutièbougou and other nearby villages, and retail them for cash at the market in Bougouni to a clientele made up mainly of women. Thanks to the loan, they expect to make an average monthly profit of 15,000 CFA francs, which they will spend on healthcare for their children.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food condiments

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is a 53 year old man who lives in the Beirut, capital of Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Adnan has owned and operated a coffee shop for five years. He also offers “narguileh” (also known as 'shisha' in Egypt), which is an ancient tradition enjoyed by the people of the Middle East. A tall (or short) water pipe is used to smoke fruit-flavored tobacco. Narguileh is enjoyed in cafes across the Middle East and is beginning to gain popularity in the US, Europe, and other countries. 

He decided to start his business because he used to work as a waiter and gained experience from his previous jobs. He is special in his work because he is well located, and he does his best to meet his clients’ demands and offer them the best. His clients are his friends, neighbors and tourists. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of clients, because he wasn’t known by the public, but he knew how to enlarge his network. 

He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase an espresso machine. Adnan has been a microcredit client for seven years now and has always paid on time. His previous loans allowed him to continually improve his business by purchasing the necessary tools to have a nice coffee shop.

loans.use: To purchase an espresso machine

loans.name: Marapat Okoeva`s Group

texts.ru:
Марапат, 57, она замужем и мать 6 детей. Самому старшему 36 лет, а младшему 26. все взрослые и проживают отдельно. Ее супруг крестьянин. Она занимается животноводством: откормом и разведением КРС. 5 лет назад она начала этот бизнес, использовав полученный кредит в другой финансовой компании на закуп МРС. С тех пор она несколько раз использовала заемные средства. Сейчас она запрашивает этот кредит, чтобы отремонтировать свой дом. 

Калыскан, 47, вдова. У нее 4 детей. Старший сын работает в Казахстане, старшая дочь замужем и проживает отдельно. С ней живут двое младших, которые учатся в школе. Она занимается животноводством. Ежемесячная прибыль равна 3К сом (70 долларов). Кредит запрашивается для закупа МРС. 

Элмире 43 года. Она также вдова и мать 5 детей: 3 сына и 2 дочери. Она также как и Калыскан, занимается разведением скота на дому. Кредит запрашивается для закупа КРС. 

Орун, 49, вдова. У нее трое детей: все дочери и учаться в местной школе. Клиент занимается малым производством: пошив и реализация тушаков. Кредит необходим для закупа сырья - ткани для шитья национальных изделий. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Marapat is 57 years old. She is married and is a mother of 6 children. The oldest is 36 years old, and the youngest is 26. All of the children are grown and live separately. Her husband is a farmer. Marapat is involved in animal husbandry: fattening and breeding of cattle. She started this business 5 years ago, after using a loan, obtained from a different financial company, to purchase small livestock. Since then, she used borrowed means several times. Now, she is requesting this loan in order to repair her house. Kalyskan is 47 years old, a widow. She has 4 children. The oldest son works in Kazakhstan, and the oldest daughter is married and lives separately. Two of the youngest children, who go to school, live with Kalyskan. She is involved in animal husbandry. Her monthly profit equals 3k som (70 dollars). She is requesting the loan for the purchase of small livestock. Elmira is 43 years old. She is also a widow and a mother of 5 children: 3 sons and 2 daughters. Just like Kalyskan, she is involved in livestock breeding at home. Elmira is requesting the loan for the purchase of cattle. Orun is 49 years old, a widow. She has three children, all of whom are daughters, attending a local school. The client is involved in a small-scale manufacturing. She sows and sells tushaks. The loan is needed for the purchase of fabric for sowing national crafts.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: House repair

loans.name: Natalie

texts.es: Natalie V. S., tiene la edad de 22 años, está soltera, y vive con sus padres y hermanos. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de una motocicleta. La idea es tener un medio de transporte que le permita movilizarse hacia su trabajo y así poder llegar a tiempo al trabajo y poder lograr tener una estabilidad laboral. Ella cuenta con experiencia necesaria para conducir la moto. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Natalie espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona, además de poder alcanzar el logro de sus metas y proyectos.
texts.en:
Natalie V. Sanchez is 22 years old, single, and lives with her parents and siblings. She wants this loan to buy a motorcycle. Her idea is to have a means of transportation that allows her to get to work on time, so that she can hold a stable job. She already has the driving experience necessary for operating a motorcycle, This is the first time she has gotten a loan with FUDECOSUR [the Kiva field partner] and she is very happy with the services they have offered her. In the future, Natalie hopes to offer her family a better standard of living and more financial stability. She hopes to continue growing as a person and to finish the goals and projects she's set for herself.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle

loans.name: Maria Catalina

texts.es:
María Catalina Gómez Z., resiD. en ciudad D. San Miguel, ella tiene 55 años D. edad, vive con su esposo, su madre y un hijo, ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa,
Hace 20 años se dedica a la venta D. ropa para dama, caballeros y niños, con mucho esfuerzo  comercializa  la ropa D.  8:00 am - 4: 00 pm, en las calles del mercado municipal D. San Miguel, ya que considera que D. esta forma venD. más, D. Lunes a Sábado, los domingos descansa y va a la iglesia  con su familia, es una persona muy amable, responsable y dedicada con su trabajo ya que con mucho sacrificios a logrado construir su casa.
María hoy se ha visto en la necesidad D. adquirir el préstamo para comprar dos puertas prefabricadas y láminas para mejorar el techo D. su cocina, ya que por las noches no posee seguridad, con la instalación D. las puertas ya no correría el peligro que le roben sus cosas, sus aspiraciones son seguir trabajando y está segura que con el crédito va a  mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus familia, ya que este tipo D. apoyo es el que permite a mucha personas solventar las necesidades.
texts.en:
María Catalina Gómez Z., 55, lives in the city of San Miguel. She lives with her husband, her mother and a son. She makes a living selling clothes. For 20 years, she has worked selling clothes for women, men and children, working hard every day, from 8:00am to 4:00pm, as a street vendor in the area around the municipal market of San Miguel. She works from Monday to Saturday. On Sunday, she rests and goes to church with her family. Maria is a friendly person, responsible and hard-working. With much sacrifice, she has managed to build her own house, but she now needs a loan to buy two prefabricated doors and material for improving the roof over her kitchen. Someone could easily break into the house and rob it now, so the doors will reduce the risk of being robbed. Maria wants to continue working. She is sure that this loan will help her to improve her family's quality of life because this kind of support has improved the lives of others.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials.

loans.name: Flora

texts.fr: G. Flora est née le 26 novembre 1981 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Flora est mariée à CODJIA Prince un commerçant. Le couple a trois enfants à leur charge, dont deux sont leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Il y a trois ans environs que la famille vit à Cocotomey dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi. Flora vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les différentes charges familiales. Flora a fréquenté l'école jusqu'à l'université. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Flora mène comme activité, la vente de fournitures scolaires et de fournitures de bureau dans sa boutique size à Cocotomey. C'est dans les papeteries de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, que Flora fait ses provisions. Flora exerce cette activité depuis deux ans. C'est la première fois que Flora sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un prêt en vue de renforcer son activité et d'augmenter son stock de produits, pour mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
G. Flora was born on November 26, 1981 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin.  She is married to CODJIA Prince, a merchant.  The couple have three children to support.  Two of the children are their own; all of them are in school.  For three years, the family has been living in Cocotomey, in the community of Abomey Calavi.  Flora helps out her husband and ensures that their different family expenses are covered.  She attended school up until the university level.  To meet her different responsibilities, she runs a business selling school supplies and office supplies in her shop in Cocotomey.  She acquires her goods from the paper suppliers of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She has been in this business for two years.  This is the first time that Flora has requested a loan from ALIDé for bolstering her business and increasing her stock of products, so that she may respond better to the demands of her customers. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying three boxes of notebooks and more

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora se dedica a la compra y venta de queso que lo distribuye en los mercados y por las casas de la zona sur, de la ciudad de la Paz.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz. 
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (Compra de queso) para continuar con su negocio.
Es cliente antigua en Impro, desde junio del 2008, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas, por lo que le permite acceder a este crédito.
texts.en:
Teodora buys and sells cheese, distributing it to the local markets and in the neighbourhood in the southern regions of La Paz. Her home is located in the Irpavi district in La Paz. The loan will be used as working capital (the purchase of cheese) to sustain her business. She is a long time client of Impro (Kiva Field Partner), since June 2008. She has been classified as "client 1" meaning that she has maintained her payments, which now grants her access to this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cheese to distribute to markets and neighbourhoods in La Paz

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean J. is from the village of Brgy.Lantap,Bagabag,Nueva Vizcaya. She is 51 years old. Jean is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Jean owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Jean has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jean joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jean is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jean from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 38-year-old married man from Lebanon. He has 2 young children who attend school. He has owned a car repair shop and specializes in car body work. He has been involved in this occupation for more than 15 years. With his experience, he has been able to gain a good number of clients asking for his reparation services. He works hard, as he is the only family provider, to support the heavy expenses of his life and to pay for his children's schooling. He plans to make some modifications and expand his shop and to do so, he is asking to borrow $1000 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy additional tools.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his picture, not indicating his name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans with Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: buy additional tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more of her goods for sale

loans.name: Rashad

texts.en: Rashad A. has a successful business selling food items. He started his business about 2 years ago, as an additional source of income. His primarily business is livestock breeding. Rashad purchases products, at very low prices, and then resells at a profit. Because he sells in bulk, he deals with a high inventory turnover rate. He has requested a loan of 1000 AZN to increase his business capital. This loan will give him the ability to purchase more products to sell, enabling him to increase his profits and to continue operating a profitable business. Rashad is going to use his loan also to purchase one cow.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell and one cow.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala West region of Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Irene has a retail business, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Irene has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more sugar and soap.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Irene hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Irene hopes to own a house. Irene is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: buying sugar and soap for resale

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe vive en la zona de San Isidro de la ciudad de La Paz. 
Ella es profesora y trabaja en un colegio de la Ciudad de El Alto  y es su única fuente de ingresos que tiene.
El crédito será destinado para el pago de estudios, pago de pensiones y elaboración de tesis para licenciatura de profesora en la universidad ya que el titulo que tiene solo es como técnico superior. 
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la segunda vez que requiere el apoyo de Kiva. Su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
Con este crédito podrá mejorar sus condiciones laborales y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Guadalupe lives in the San Isidro sector of La Paz.

She is a teacher and works in a school in the city of El Alto.  This is her only source of income.

The loan will be used to pay for educational expenses, meal costs and thesis writing costs leading to her teaching degree at the university since her current title is just as a superior technician.

This is her third loan request from Impro and the second time she needs Kiva support.  Her credit history  is grade 1, that is, she has good payment ratings.

This loan will make it possible for her to improve her working conditions thus improving her income.

loans.use: To pay for meals and pay thesis writing costs to get her degree in Education.

loans.name: Kenia Morella

texts.es: Kenia es una mujer muy alegre y a demás responsable ella tiene1 hijo y está a su cargo. Hace 3 años que se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general dicha actividad la realiza de una manera permanente porque cuando comenzó a trabajar fue por razón que como madre comprometida y responsable decidió ayuda a los ingresos de la familia ya que tenía que sacar adelante a su hijo, ya que por las mañanas realizaba la lo quehaceres del hogar y por las tardes sale a vender sus diferentes productos. Actualmente solicita un financiamiento para la compra de sabanas, toallas, perfumes y calzado. Su deseo es seguir esforzándose para que a sus hijos no les falte el pan de cada día
texts.en:
Kenia is a very happy and responsible woman.  She has one son, and she takes care of him.  For three years she has sold general merchandise.  She began to work because, as a committed and responsible mother, she had decided to help with the family income so she could help her son get ahead in life.  Now she does housework in the mornings and goes out to sell her products in the afternoons.

Kenia is currently requesting a loan to buy sheets, towels, perfumes and shoes.  Her wish is to keep working hard to give her son his daily bread.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. was born in 1953, she is married with two children. She works hard and strives higher for herself and the family. With the death of her first daughter, who was more of a sister, she was obliged to work very hard raising her son, and her plans for her son could only be realized with a larger income income which led her to joined GHAPE. 

With this loan, she plans to carryout  mixed farming and increased her business of cooked food. Her business is selling Koki that she provides to  the community with lunch at a cheaper cost and also food during ceremony. With the profit from this business she planned to buy her plot of land and build a house for her son.

Elizabeth will plough back her profit into her business and use part to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to expand her business   and save for  rainy days. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.


About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchse of food Items and ingredients

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 45 años, es una mujer muy afectuosa,  vive en un departamento alquilado, junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijas. El negocio al que Ana se dedica, es la venta de zapatos y carteras que son traídas del Trujillo, ciudad que se encuentra al norte del país. Sus clientes son integrantes de su congregación cristiana donde asiste ella, quienes  gustan y conocen de la calidad de calzados y no dudan en comprarle, ya que les deja a crédito. Le gusta su trabajo y más por que el producto que vende tiene garantía y eso le da mayor rentabilidad. Por esta razón deja su mercadería a crédito, de esa manera gana ya que los créditos que recibe recupera la inversión. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad, a pesar de sus dificultades que tiene para viajar a Trujillo, pero no le importa, sabe que con mucho empeño podrá comprase su departamento, y así brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijas. Es su 11avo  crédito con MFP y se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente como de costumbre. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más zapatos y carteras, para abastecer los pedidos pendientes de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ana, age 45, is a very loving woman who lives in a rented apartment with her husband and two daughters. She has a business selling shoes and purses that are brought in from Trujillo, a city that lies in the northern part of the country. Her customers are members of a Christian church that she attends. They are familiar with and enjoy the quality of the shoes that she sells and do not hesitate buying them on credit. Ana enjoys her work because her products are guaranteed to sell and generate a good profit. Since she extends credit for her merchandise, she needs the loans while she recoups her investment. Ana has been in business for 15 years. Despite the difficulties associated with traveling to Trujillo, she does not mind because she knows that with more effort she will be able to buy her apartment and provide a better quality of life for her daughters.

This is her eleventh loan with MFP. Ana promises to submit all of her payments on time like she usually does. The loan she requested will be used to buy shoes and purses so that she can fulfill the outstanding orders of her customers.

loans.use: Purchase shoes & purses to fulfill her orders

loans.name: Dopé

texts.fr: Dopé a 35 ans et est  mariée . Elle a en charge un enfant. Elle améliore les conditions de vie de son enfant en faisant la vente de bijoux et couche pour bébé. Elle a remboursé déjà un crédit et compte dans cette activité 6 ans d’expérience. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et revend au marché de Hédzranawoe. Avec ce nouveau crédit,  elle espère acheter  un lot de bijoux et couche pour bébé.
texts.en: Dopé is 35 and married. She takes care of one child. She improves the living conditions of her child by selling jewelry and diapers. She has already repaid one loan and has 6 years of experience in this business. She stocks up at the big market in Lomé and resells at the market in Hédzranawoe. With this new loan, she hopes to buy more jewelry and diapers.

loans.use: to buy jewelry and diapers

loans.name: Alejo

texts.es:
Don Alejo vive en la comunidad de "Llano las rosas", municipio de San José del rincon, tiene 57 años de edad y es un hombre casado cumplio 38 años de casado, tiene casa propia y solo una hija vive en su casa, su hija ya trabaja y le ayuda con algunos gastos en su casa, de dependientes solo esta su esposa, aunque la esposa de don Alejo tambien ayuda porqué ella vé que ahora es mas dificil la economía, es por eso que ella atiende una tienda de abarrotes que puso en su casa. 
Don Alejo ya no puede buscar trabajo por que ya es una persona mayor y no consigue en ningun lado, él fue albañil, y siempre trabajó la siembre en su propio terreno, todavia trabaja su terreno en tiempo de siembra y cosecha, pero conseguir un trabajo ya no, es por eso que en estos momentos don Alejo solamente se dedica a criar animales para venderlos.

Don Alejo cría borregos y con el prestamo quiere comprar corderitos y unos becerros todo para criar, por el momento don Alejo no va ver ganancias alcontrario hay que mantenerlos por un tiempo, pero lo que le ayuda es que cosecho y tiene la pastura para mantenerlos.

Don Alejo quiere que en unos meses los animales que vaya a comprar den crias y su situación economica pueda mejorar mucho, con las ganancias don Alejo las quiere ahorar puesto que piensa en su vejez y en la situación economica que pueda estar, de ese modo pueda sacar dinero para la comida y las medicinas que puedan nesecitar él o su esposa.
texts.en:
Alejo lives in the “Llano Las Rosas” community, San José del Rincón municipality.  He is 57 years old and has been married 38 years.  He owns his house and just has one daughter still living with him.  She works and helps out with some of the household expenses.  His wife is his only dependent although she too helps out because, seeing how difficult the situation is, she tends to a store installed in the house.

Because of his age, Alejo can no longer look for work; he can’t find employment anywhere.  He used to be a bricklayer and always worked his fields.   He still works in his fields during planting and harvesting but getting a job isn’t a reality anymore.  Therefore, Alejo only raises animals to sell now. Currently he raises lambs and will use the loan to buy baby lambs and a few calves to raise.

For the moment, Alejo won’t realize any profits.  On the contrary, he’ll have to feed them for a time.  But what helps is that he has harvested and has pasturage to feed them.

Alejo says that he hopes the animals he will buy will produce offspring in a few months so that his economic situation will improve greatly.  Alejo wants to use his profits to save up because at his age and with the economic situation that might develop he will be able to have money available for food and medicines he or his wife might need.

loans.use: To buy lambs and calves to raise and then sell.

loans.name: Keo's Group

texts.en:
Four people in Preaek Samraong village in Kandal province are forming this group loan.  They have selected Mrs. Keo L., a 38-year-old married woman, to be the group leader. The members of this group hope to increase their income and improve their family living with these loans.

Mrs. Keo L. is a stay-at-home mother taking care of her two children:  one is a student and the other stays at home.  Due to her child's need to study extra classes, she is not able to pay for her child's school fees. So she decided to ask for a loan to pay the school fees. Her husband, Mr. Sin Mang, is 37 years old and works as electrician where he earns a little income to support his family.

loans.use: To pay for her child's school fees

loans.name: León Ángel

texts.es:
A sus 60 años de edad, León Ángel A., no conoce otro oficio que el de carnicero, pues desde pequeño al lado de sus tíos aprendió de este trabajo. Desde hace 6 años y después de trabajar para otros en diferentes carnecerías, descubrió que para salir adelante era necesario montar su propio negocio, pues de esta forma mejoraría sus ingresos, su calidad de vida y la de su familia. 

Actualmente, León necesita de un crédito para comprar surtido y así incrementar sus ventas, lo que se convertirá en mayores ingresos, pues actualmente es el responsable de mantener un hogar en el que son 6 los integrantes. 

Desde que León creó su propio negocio se ha encontrado como limitante la falta de capital, pues para salir adelante, viéndose obligado a surtir diariamente, lo que demanda mayor cansancio físico y disminución de utilidades al no poder comprar en mayores cantidades para obtener mejores precios.
texts.en:
At 60 years of age, León Ángel A. knows no other trade than that of butcher.  He learned his trade from his uncles when he was young.  Six years ago, and after working for others in various butcher shops, he discovered that he would need to start up his own business to get ahead.  With his own business, he would be able to improve his earnings, his quality of life, and that of his family.

Currently, León needs a loan to purchase stock for his shop, which will increase his sales and his profits.  He is responsible for providing for a household of six.

Since León started his own business, he has found lack of capital to be a limitation.  For him to get ahead, he needs to re-stock his shop each day. This causes him greater physical fatigue and creates a decrease in profits.  If he cannot purchase large quantities, he does not get good prices.

loans.use: To purchase supplies (meat)

loans.name: Williams Erick

texts.es: El señor Williams se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en el radio urbano de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  trabaja con su auto que ahora se encuentra en mal estado el motor ya no tiene fuerza y por esta razón necesita un cambio de motor motivo por el cual solicita el préstamo. El señor vive en casa de su mama  vive con su esposa y sus hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar,  su esposa es profesora y también comercia sabanas, edredones y demás.  Ambos de una  u otra forma generan ingresos para la manutención de su familia y de esta manera poder mejorar su calidad de vida, es un apersona muy trabajadora y esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Williams is a taxi driver in the urban region of the city of Cochabamba. He works with his own car but the engine is in disrepair. The car needs a new engine and it is the reason why he has requested a loan. He lives in his mother's house, living together with is wife and school-aged children. His wife is a teacher and she also sells bedding, dresses and more. They both generate an income one way or another for the support of their family and to improve the quality of their life. He is a very hardworking person and he is thankful to the organization for the support they provide.

loans.use: To buy a new engine for his car.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has operated an open food stall business for the past year, selling from her home to her neighbors and passers-by. Fatuma faces a major challenge of competition from other food stall operators. She hopes to be a reliable seller in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sacks of sugar, cooking oil and coconuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, sacks of sugar, cooking oil and coconuts.

loans.name: Caroline Mwende

texts.en:
Caroline Mwende is 42 years old and married to Michael. She runs a retail shop, which has been in operation for a period of four years with an income of KES. 5,000 a month. She also has a farm where she grows maize.

She has never borrowed from any other MFI, and this is her first loan from KADET LTD, and she intends to use it to buy seedlings for the for the next season of planting. She hopes to improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: To buy seedlings for the farm.

loans.name: 3 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Hoan N. Thị (14) is a 28-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Hoan is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 3 Đông Vệ (08.01.3 Đông Vệ).


Hoan is married and has 1 school-aged child.  To make a living, Hoan owns & operates a clothing business.  The main source of income for the business comes from providing general clothing services to local community members.  Hoan has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Hoan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hoan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,253,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,159,600 VND which will be used to purchase cloth to resell.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Hoan plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  T. Thị Tỵ (12) is a 61 year-old female who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a clothing business.


2.  H. Thị Giang (13) is a 28 year-old female who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a clothing business.


3.  N. Thị Tân (15) is a 31 year-old female who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a clothing business.


4.  N. Thị Lan (16) is a 49 year-old female who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a clothing business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hoan N. Thị (14) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Hoan là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 3 Đông Vệ (08.01.3 Đông Vệ).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ quần áo thông thường cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hoan thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hoan kiếm được khoảng 2,500,000 VND.  Vào 2010, Hoan đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hoan đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,253,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư đổi mới công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,159,600 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  T. Thị Tỵ (12) là 61 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo.


2.  H. Thị Giang (13) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo.


3.  N. Thị Tân (15) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo.


4.  N. Thị Lan (16) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Ty from  Viet Nam

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jaime De Jesús

texts.es:
Después de trabajar durante años en la industria del calzado y después de quedar desempleado y debido a la falta de oportunidades, Jaime de Jesús J. O., de 50 años de edad, decidió trabajar de manera independiente en lo que sabía hacer.
